Reviews.Title: “Central location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Stepballchange
Reviews.Content: Good points: great location - midtown, around the corner from 2 subway stops. Good-sized bedroom (in need of redecorating) and bathroom, clean and comfortable, free wifi, good breakfast. Rooftop bar with good view of Empire State building, accessible by non-residents. Staff polite and helpful. Bad points: The slowest lifts in the whole city - there are only 2 for the whole building. Can be a loooooong wait especially in the evenings with people wanting to go to the bar on the 14th floor. Difficult to find a table at breakfast during busy period. Noisy - even though our room was at the back, away from the street, there was a huge bunch of very noisy teenagers staying in the hotel. Take your earplugs. Rooftop bar extremely crowded at the weekend - go early if you want a seat. Points of interest: You can book a shuttle to the airport. The restaurant next to the hotel - the Wonjo - does an excellent Korean barbecue.

Reviews.Title: “Just book it!”
Reviews.Author: strawberryshtc
Reviews.Content: So I stayed at the La quinta Inn for four days with some girlfriends. My stay was awesome. Ill start at the airport. I got in late from Chicago and I was assuming my cab ride would be expensive. I flew in from LGA. At the taxi stand the attendant will ask you what city. Once in the taxi the driver asked where was I going. I gave the address and the driver asked was it between 5th and 6th. Since I did my research I knew that it was. He asked which way would I like him to go. I said the fasted. He took the tunnel. The ride was maybe 20 min. And the fare was like $25. Wow! Cheap! Check inn was easy. The room was clean. Im glad I decided to stay in my own room separate from my girlfriends because the rooms are small! However it was really clean, the water was hot, the sheets were warm, the heat worked, no smells, no bugs. No loud noises. I have no complaints. I had the breakfast which was good. I liked the apple juice. The area cant be beat. Its on this block that takes you to asia! Your right off of the famous 5th ave. right down the street from Macys, Madison Square garden, The empire state building. Lots of gift shops, restaurants, little bars. The sub way is right there. This is the place to stay it cant be beat. I payed $99 a night on southwest.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Very Good Price”
Reviews.Author: travelingTch
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with our hotel. The staff has been extremely helpful and the hotel is very centrally located. Our room is typical of NY rooms small but very clean and good wifi access. The breakfast in the morning is substantial. Our room was for the most part quiet at night, and the beds were very comfortable. Would definitely stay here again, and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dorit147
Reviews.Content: Small room good brekfest neer the empire state buildind and macyes Good location for shopping trip

Reviews.Title: “very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: ashley r
Reviews.Content: we stayed here only 1 night because of a bad experience at the Royal Park Hotel and Hostel, and we found them very clean , they even upgraded us to a king sized bed at no charge! the location is perfect, the staff was friendly and overall it was a very nice place. we will come back next time we are in NYC !

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: kacunningham
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. Front desk staff were very courteous and helpful. Did not run into any rudeness as other reviewers seem to have. Yes, they are undergoing some renovation I supposed to the front of the hotel, so there is scafolding out front, but it's the same way with half the buildings in NYC. Our room was clean, and larger than we expected. Room with 2 queens and plenty of room to move around in. Pretty much no view as we were on 3rd floor. Our room faced another building and rooftop equipment. But, how much time do you spend in there looking out the window? The only complaint we had was the slow elevators. Quite a wait sometimes and half the time by the time it got down to the 3rd floor, it was full. So, request a lower room floor and use the stairs, or a higher level floor so you can get an elevator before it's full. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Dabzzz
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay at the La Quinta in NYC. Before we chose this hotel we read the reviews. We decided to take a chance on this hotel since most of the reviews were positive. We had a wonderful stay. When we first arrived in the morning our room was not ready. It was very convenient to leave our bags with the concierge for the day. We did the same on the day of checkout. The location of the hotel is two blocks away from Penn station which was very convenient for us. The subway station is also just at the corner. I liked the location of the hotel, I found it easy to get to anywhere we wanted to go. When we arrived back at the hotel to check in I retrieved our bags while my husband got our keys. He announced to me that we were on the eleventh floor. I said to him, oh no I think you should ask for a lower floor, the reviews said how slow the elevators were. Well we kept our room and had no issues with the elevator at all. We had a room in the front of the hotel on the scaffolding side. So yes we had no view but going up to the 14th floor bar to see the view of the Empire State building at night made up for it. Except for the garbage truck that passes every night at around 11:30PM, there really was little noise. We had a room with two queen size beds. I really have no complaints about the room. The truth is we hardly spent anytime in the room so as long as it was clean, we were happy. This was our first time staying in the city. Just being able to come back to our room at some point during the day was a pleasure. The only small complaint I have is that there was no hot water in the evenings to shower. But we learnt the trick of letting the water in the shower and the tap run for a few minutes and then we had hot water. The breakfast in the hotel was very nice and there was quite an assortment to chose from. We ate one night at the Korean restaurant next door, Won Jo. We enjoyed the experience of the Korean BBQ. It was very tasty and very plentiful. We would definately stay at this hotel again. It was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised.”
Reviews.Author: babs h
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as an amenities driven experience with a good value for the price. No where on the website was there mention of current renovations. The hotel is covered in scaffolding and dark steel mesh. The street is extremely loud with deliveries continuing through the night. The hotel allows smoking, so the non-smoking rooms are the only place you will escape the smell. The staircase allows the smell of smoke on every floor. I received a letter from the management when I checked in which boasted all the facility had to offer. The letter from the manager stating that the hotel was undergoing a "facelift" was posted in between the two elevators on the first floor. Finally, the manager was not available to speak with me about the problems I experienced and I was told that I would have to contact him on Monday at the earliest. I cancelled my 2nd stay there and had to spend vacation time looking for alternative arrangements. Luckily the Holiday Inn has just opened a new, quiet hotel about a block away for roughly $25 a night more. Well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for great manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn M
Reviews.Content: It is always a challenge to find a reasonable price for a hotel in Manhattan that is centrally located as well as clean and comfortable. This was all of those. The room and private bath were roomy and clean. It was at least $100 less than other hotels I found, especially good with an AAA discount. I would stay there again and not look further.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, very good price, roof terrace.”
Reviews.Author: chdine
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times at the La Quinta Manhattan. The location is the hotel's greatest advantage. It is literally 5 minutes walk from Penn Station. Just straight down the street. So, if you arrive from the airport at Penn Station or by Amtrak, this is a very good place to go. It also has several subway lines just around the corner, so it is easy to get anywhere in the city. It is surrounded by Korean restaurants, many of them are open all night. I found the rooms adequate and clean and the service friendly. Wireless is free, so is the breakfast. And, there is are computers and a free printer in the basement. Many people overlook the fact that there is a nice bar at the rooftop with an open terrace. Spectacular in the summer. You don't have a great view over the city, but if you look up you see the illuminated spire of the Empire State Building right above you. It is not a fancy hotel, prices vary, depending on what is going on in the city, but it is always one of the most affordable. It is not carried by several search engines (like expedia), so best to book it right on the LaQuinta site.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but wouldn't highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: NohaG_04
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positives. The location is excellent in the middle of the garment district. It is so beautiful around Herald Square. If you're interested in shopping, this is where to go. However, if you want an area with more restaurants, bars, etc. maybe you'd want to stay in chelsea, Times Square or go down to meatpacking or the west village. The hotel itself is clean, beds are comfortable. The staff is ok but not remarkably helpful and friendly. The negatives: elevators are super-slow for a hotel this size, they need major rennovation there! The rooms facing the street are noisy (wish i listened to the reviews here) especially during the night; at least that's when we were in the room. We were staying on the third floor so there was no view worthwhile and we only saw the bars from the construction work anyway. The breakfast is basic even for hotels in the same price and room offering range. The TV system broke down the first day and stayed down for two days! Now the big no no!! We were two couples travelling, we made our booking through booking.com online. The first couple arrived on the 23rd and the reservation was ok. When the second couple arrived on the 25th the reception told them their reservation was cancelled by booking.com and tried to give them the room at a higher rate (they showed them a document of the cancellation from booking.com) They told them they'll look elsewhere for another hotel. This is when their reservation magically appeared not to be cancelled!! By then they found a cheaper reservation (than the original price) in Nyma Hotel right across the street. With the hotel manager being rude, the staff being not in a hold of things we all moved to Nyma which proved to be a better hotel (managed by the same company). I stayed in Stanford Hotel before (same street - January 2011) and Nyma Hotel during this stay. Both i would recommend over La Quinta Manhattan. Same price range but more comfotable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pstein49
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel and the price should tip off those who expect the Ritz. That being said, we found this hotel to be a terrific value. The breakfast was very nice - the rooms were clean, and the staff were very responsive to our needs. We did not have any of the problems some have reported. The location is great. We went during the holiday season when prices at other hotels were pretty outrageous. This is a great economy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: linsey c
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! The staff was rude and unhelpful. The people next door were screaming and slamming into the walls, and the front desk said that everything was fine bc they called up and was told there wasn't a problem. It was so bad that we almost called 911. The room phone didn't work and they said that it wasn't a hazaard and that they have many other hazaards in the hotel. The staff lied and said that we picked a room by the bar, being in our 50s, this was not a first choice, the music could be heard until after 1:30 am. The management was not helpful and we were forced to call head quarters. This was the worst experience we have ever had at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: TGAV742826
Reviews.Content: LaQuinta Manhattan has a great location with a subway station right at the corner. Empire State building and Macy's are two blocks down walking distance. Times Square was one subway station away. The hotel had clean and spacious rooms for New York standards. Included was free breakfast which was a great start to the day. Also free Internet. Indoor parking across the street gives the hotel a discount of $27.00 per day. The staff was friendly and helpful. There were some funny smells in the lobby coming from Korean restaurants but besides that the hotel is a great value for your dollar!

Reviews.Title: “My Worse Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Baronette S
Reviews.Content: When it comes to customer service, this hotel gets the thumb down from me. I stayed at this hotel from December 24, 2011- December 29, 2011. Every service from check-in to check-out was terrible. Although confirmed, there was no shuttle service from the airport to the hotel. Upon check-in, I found out that there were no fridge or microwave, which were promised at time of booking and the hotel did not make one accessible to the guest. Although breakfast was provided, guests were not allowed to take food to their rooms although there was not sufficient seating available at anytime and breakfast staff was rude and inefficient. Hotel employees were generally rude and not at all helpful. The rooms were too small and not very clean. The television was out for at least 3 of the 5 nights that we stayed and although promised that we would get a refund for the inconvenience, we did not receive it at time of check-out. The front desk clerk named (Tom) was rude to a family member trying to reach us at the hotel. In addition, we were advised that calls within the US were not free when the actually were. The employee working in the business centre was extremely rude. Front desk refused to assist with getting a cab to the airport although we check out at 5 am in the morning. Internet service was weak and there was always problems getting online. I seriously did not feel like I was a paying customer but as if someone was giving this vacation to me but the really did not want to give it. I will never stay at this hotel again and would not recommend it to my worse enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for holiday season in New York City”
Reviews.Author: rbr0wn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at three out five of the Applecore hotels in New York City and this is one of my favorites. It is perfectly situated on 32nd St between 5th and 6th avenue in Korea Town just steps from a subway station. It takes just a few minutes to get to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and anywhere else you might want to go. My cousin lives way up on the west side and it is easy for me to get to his neighborhood by subway. It is a tourist mecca because it's right around the corner from the Empire State building and Macy's is practically across the street, but even if you don't plan to do "touristy" stuff, it's exceptionally convenient. If you think you can't afford to visit New York during the holidays, this is the place for you. It's not fancy and could definitely use some refurbishing, but if you simply want a clean, safe, convenient place to stay, La Quinta is a great. As others have said, the lobby is small and you can smell cooking odors from the restaurant next door, but there are many pros: Free computers downstairs, free breakfast (cereal, breads, fruit, and boiled eggs), free in-room safe, free wi-fi, etc. Also, there are a number of very inexpensive places to eat nearby - even late at night. Finally, if you're a woman traveling alone, this area feels very safe and comfortable. They have new mattresses since I stayed here in 2009 and they're very comfortable (memory foam). Rooms also have flat screen TVs (not that you'll spend much time watching it with all there is to do nearby) with lots of channels. This is not the Plaza, so if you are looking for a fancy, romantic place to stay, this isn't the place, but again, if you want to enjoy all that NYC has to offer during the holiday season, the La Quinta is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “My stay At La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Jole L
Reviews.Content: I would say the bed was very comfortable and it was cozy.The shower was great.Hot water and a good water pressure.Did not care for the smell in the entry downstairs.The next door was a restraurant and smelled fishy every time I would come or go.The staff was nice and I did like that is was close to Times Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TracyEPa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and was pleased for what I paid for it. The room was tiny but clean and comfortable. The lobby area is nice, but it and all the hallways smell like fish from the sushi restaurant just off the lobby - kind of overwhelming. Thank God the room didn't. The outside of the hotel is ensconced in scaffolding due to remodeling, so it doesn't look very nice from the outside, but is better inside. The elevators are slow as molasses, many times it was quicker to take the stairs to my 3rd floor room. The room was a smoking room, it had an ashtray, but I couldn't smell cigarettes at all. I had reserved a non-smoking room, so that was an error on their part. Be sure and go up to the Vu lounge on the 14th floor. It has an outdoor patio with beautiful views of the city, including of the nearby Empire Statue Building. Free wi-fi, which you can't always get in NYC was a must for me. The free breakfast is also rare, and it was serviceable. All in all, a good value for a NYC hotel.

Reviews.Title: “All that we needed and more plus excellent location”
Reviews.Author: BRINCKLEY
Reviews.Content: If you want a mid level hotel that has all the basic amenities (clean rooms, hair dryer, in room safe, free morning breakfast, free wii fi), AND is only about 50 meters from the subway, you will love this hotel. The Empire State bldg is a block away, as well as Macy's. The location is excellent! Yes, it is on a street that has many Korean shops, banks, restaurants, but we liked that it was not on a busy street and there are many fancy bakeries and expensive Korean restaurants open 24/7 if you're hungry late at night. The area had a very safe feeling. And we had NO problems with bugs, as one reviewer said. We have actually stayed here annually as tourists 6 years in a row and love it. Minuses are the room lighting like most hotel rooms is a bit dim and during busy summer months or times the elevators can be very busy and are slow, or 1 breaks down. No hair conditioner is included FYI but thankfully there is a 24hour CVS down the street.

Reviews.Title: “good position, but ...”
Reviews.Author: 378Frequent_travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well placed for visiting Manhattan, very close to Times Square and all subways . Penn station 2 blocks away with good connection to JFK through Subway+airtrain. I dont recommend to book the shuttle/cab from hotel, its a scam ! There is a nice pub, open from 6Pm on 14th floor with a nice view on the Empire state Building. Very expensive, even for NYC, for VERY small room (no space to open the suitcase! ) with no view and poor light , Bed smell of food at the lobby all times, coming from Korean restaurant in the street. Recommended for for 1-2 nights stay or 1st time visitor in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Really bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: 56003Richard
Reviews.Content: Worst place I could have stayed. I booked a room for two nights but made the mistake of booking 2 rooms for one night. The guy at the desk said there was nothing he could do about it and to call headquarters. HQ said it was ok but that only the front desk to fix the problem. The guy then says oh he can't do anything and that only the owner can approve it but unfortunately the owner is out of town. Then he tries to trick me into staying an additional night but NOT giving me credit for the extra room I booked. What a thief. So basically I only needed one room but had 2. The customer service was awful. As for my room it was damp and musty smelling. Maybe I should have gone to my other room but I didn't want the hastle. I chose the hotel for it's location and reasonable price and I go to NYC quite frequently. All he had to do was give me credit for the one night and I would have been a lifetime customer. So instead he makes $150 by ripping me off but in the long run, they have missed out on literally thousands of dollars that I would have spent over the years to stay at their property. And the breakfast? Not that great. It closes early and the selection is poor. By the time I got there, there was nothing but crumbs, literally. :(

Reviews.Title: “It's New York!”
Reviews.Author: buckman41ss
Reviews.Content: This was a trip to tour and take in a basketball game at MSG. Great location with access to everything we were trying to accomplish in a 4 day period. The hotel is dated and is located in what I think they call the "the little Korea district". Lots of Korean eateries so the whole area including the hotel smelled like Asian food. The room was nice in size for "its New York" . Just a couple of issues with the room. It was uncommonly warm for the week of Nov 12th and we couldnt get the a/c in the room to get it comfortable and asked if someone could check it but nothing changed.The carpet needed some serious cleaning. But everything else was acceptable for "its New York".

Reviews.Title: “Nicely surprised”
Reviews.Author: trav4hob
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about staying here after reading some of the reviews. I didn't know what it meant to be in Korea town or having a very small room. But we were very pleasantly surprised with the hotel and room. Our rate was about $100.00 less than other mid range hotels in the area averaging $200.00 per night (AARP rates). November 1st evidently starts high season in New York City. The room--very clean, mattress was comfortable, quiet, and adequately sized (it is New York people keep saying). The maid service was excellent. The bathroom was roomy and very clean. We were on the 5th floor in the back--only used the elevator when we had luggage--there are only 2 of them and are quite slow--easier to take the stairs. The breakfast was plentiful and much like any you get at La Quinta's. Korea town turns out to be 1 block long which is no big deal and looks like some of the best Korean food in town. The hotel is nicely located--with the subway being a block away. Time's Square, Broadway, Hell's Kitchen (great restaurants), Central Park are all within walking distance. Actually most of New York City turned out to be within walking distance. The only time we needed assistance from the front desk was getting a taxi to the airport and they were cordial. If ever in New York again, I won't hesitate to book here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: xubiluca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Manhattan on Nov/2011 with a family group. We had confirmed reservations for 3 rooms. They pre-approved 4 rooms (one more than my reservation) in my credit card but, when we arrived, only 2 rooms were available. 2 couples had to share the same room for the first night. They told us that the guest that was supposed to leave decided to stay, so, they couldn`t honnour our confirmed reservation!!! The next day they mooved the couples to theirs own rooms. The rooms were on the back side, no view, but very comfortable and clean. Everything was fine for the rest of our stay, nothing else to complain.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make the mistake of staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Kristynn
Reviews.Content: Horrible customer service. The manager of this hotel Vic lies and does not put the customer first. They cheated us of $250 in show tickets and refused to do anything about it. While a nice location, I recommend highly you stay somewhere else. Will never stat at La Quinta again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable Manhattan hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: echodoll
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a hotel in the Manhattan area that was below $300 per night but yet still in a good area where we could walk to things and I found it: La Quinta Manhattan. It was a little over $200 per night but it included free wifi, breakfast and the room had 2 queen beds. The room was decent (no view unless you count that of a brick wall but this is very common in NYC) and the staff were all helpful and friendly. The only downside is there was also a Korean restaurant attached in the lower lobby area and the smell permeated the lobby and halls. Our room was fine and that was what mattered. You can walk to many local NYC attractions (Madison Sq Garden, Empire State bldg, shopping) and the subway as well. Plus the rooftop bar was essentially right next to the Empire State building which was wonderful for a fall evening in NYC (with heating lamps). I also took advantage of the hotel's shuttle to the airport ($28, well worth it since most cab fare was $45 flat fee to/from airport, make reservations ahead of time). If you want more than your free continental breakfast its walking distance to a Korean bakery and starbucks too. I would definitely stay there again for its location and price in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “midtown convenience”
Reviews.Author: joshhikes
Reviews.Content: Check in staff was friendly, continental breakfast was pleasant and plentiful. They were refinishing the facade, so it took an extra minute to find the entrance under a scaffold. Nothing else about Korea Town presented any problem that I could see. The room was smallish, but that hardly matters when the weather is perfect, which happily it was. Easily walked to Times square, Rockefeller Center, MoMA, Grand Central, and restaurants. Bought a metro card and rode the subway to the the Brooklyn Bridge, walked the bridge & back. Wandered to South Ferry terminal and Battery Park, and subway'd back to a couple of easy blocks from the hotel. If the walls were thin, I didn't notice. The hotel location was fine for almost all the tourist stuff on the checklist. Also, had no problem getting a taxi outside the hotel when it came time to go to La Guardia. It's an older hotel property. The room was not inspiring, but it worked for me. The bathroom almost seemed large & bedding & such were fresh enough & clean. Elevator worked, and the stairs were also convenient for descending (without the luggage.) The Wi-Fi worked o.k. for my purposes. Flat screen TV & a bit of desk space were alright. No bugs, no bites, not too bad on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “Been here before and will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: GothicblueCJ
Reviews.Content: This will be my 1st time posting a review for the La Quinta Manhattan. I've stayed here before(April 2010) and came back. It's at a great location- in Korean town, close to Madison Square Garden, Empire State Building, Herald Square, Macys, lots of other stores and shops and the subway lines nearby. My friends and I came back again and will try to come back here every time we come to NYC. Even though the rooms are small, they are clean and will provide your basic needs. The beds this time were super comfortable-I think they changed them to memory foam or something. Very cushiony! The breakfast is fine and will provide much needed nourishment for the day ahead. It's free and full of continental items like cereal, bagels, toast, yogurt, jams, butter, cream cheese, juices, milk, and coffee. All very yummy. Just a heads up on a couple of items: -You have to go up a small flight of stairs(5 steps) to get to the door. So you will have to lug your luggage up them. -The hotel is sandwiched between 2 restaurants. It is connected to one of them and this time the odors from there enveloped the lobby area every night when we would come in. I will come back- Thanks again La Quinta Manhattan! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small rooms with thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: JoDiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is along walk to Times Square action, but access to the subway and Penn Station for airport travel was very convenient. The room was very small and the door did not tightly seal; therefore, hallway noise was not blocked out. The staff was courteous, however, the room did not seem quite clean (maybe it was the old bedspread and thin towels?). I did check for bed bugs and did not find any thankfully. Overall, I would try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “One week stay great price. Close to every thing”
Reviews.Author: nellmiah
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i stayed Here for a week. Great price on room. Breakfast every morning roof top bar. And right behind the empire state building. The subway is a block away and Starbucks macys it was great. Never felt afraid. Nbc studio is a must. We went to the jimmy falon show and were selected to dance behind the band. Awesome. Went to battery park, statue of liberty, walked on wall steet. Took in a broadway show, central park. And trinity church. Is Just one of the many church we saw. They are all wonderful. We have to return. One week is not enough. FantÃ¡stc city and. Great hotel. Will stay Again

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: TammyL
Reviews.Content: The hotel and the room were very clean. Lobby was nice but furniture in the room was a bit dated. The room was large though. and the beds were very comfortable. Above average breakfast included in the room price. Best value I've ever found in Manhattan. Would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. You get what you pay”
Reviews.Author: h0liday_m00d
Reviews.Content: Room is clean, quite old furniture, spacious for two ppl. Near korean restaurants, one block away from empire state building. Free internet. Breakfast is just so so.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: TGH56003
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days. The hotel staff were very pleasant, the room was clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. You can't beat the location, a half block from the Herald Square subway stop and 2 blocks from Penn Station, with restaurants and shops all around. The area seemed very safe. Now that I know that you can take a $12.50 train ride from Newark Airport, this is definitely the way to get to NYC. There were a few minor problems with the hotel. The service elevator was broken for several days so there was only one working elevator, which made it difficult for us on the 12th floor. Also, the water pressure and tempeterature in the shower tended to fluctuate. However, considering the location and price, this hotel is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever-Don't stay there if you were planning on sleeping”
Reviews.Author: paul n
Reviews.Content: A new standard for the worst hotel stay. I could not sleep. I was located in room 912 which was facing the street. They had no double pained windows or any type of noise abatement. They are located on a narrow street surrounded by tall buildings which amplify all of the street noise below. I am writing this at 5:29am, as a result on not being able to sleep. All night long, horns, people yelling, police/fire sirens, construction equipment noise including the loud backup alarms. I slept with 32db ear plugs and no apparent effect on the excessive and constant noise. They should not have been able to rent this room. In the event you find yourself stuck with no other options, switch to a room which does not face the street, or if they are full(my case), move to another hotel(which I did the next day). Additionally, one of the two elevators was not working, which lead to excessive wait times to get to your room or the lobby, typically 3-7 minutes. The internet access did not work, which required calling a third party tech support company, waiting on the phone for 10 minutes to speak to a technician and an additional ten minutes before being able to connect to the internet. The fact that there are no other hotels located on this street should have been the first clue this location was wrong. Bottom Line: No amount of cost savings($259 per night) or proximity to landmarks justifies staying here. There are other options and I would recommend not making the same mistake my travel agent did. :(

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: KBrookshire
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in NYC & we'd go back to LaQuinta Manhattan again. The location is great. We flew into Newark airport and took the train to Penn Station (only $12.50 each). When we left Penn Station, it was about a two-block walk to LaQuinta's front door. The hotel is very clean and although NYC hotels are quite expensive, the LaQuinta is a good value considering its great location. We noticed the Radisson is only a few doors down and costs about twice as much!) We ate their continental breakfast each morning & then we were off! The subway station is at the end of the block and we were only one stop away from Times Square! Before going, I worried because I had read the reviews about their dining room being too small and their elevators being too slow! Most of the time neither was a problem for us but both were on occasion. But this is New York City, people! One has to be reasonable about what to expect in a city as crowded as Manhattan! Both are servicing many people and an occasional problem can be expected! We had no real complaints during our stay. Our room was clean, they had good housekeeping services, there was a safe in the room for storing valuables, we slept good at night, ate plenty each morning, the Empire State Building was outside our window! We couldn't have asked for more! We would definitely recommend this hotel to our family and friends and would stay there again ourselves with no reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay!”
Reviews.Author: pannme
Reviews.Content: This updated hotel in the heart of NYC- 1 block from Empire State Building- on the Korean Way-provides a pleasant atmosphere, FREE breakfast (needs less carbs & more other choices), and the most comfortable beds! Just returned home and we're going to buy one of those beds this week!

Reviews.Title: “Meets basic needs”
Reviews.Author: HamptonRoadsNative
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, in town for work. The hotel's location is its main selling point: a 10-15 minute walk from Penn Station, and half a block from the 34th St-Herald Square subway station. From my perspective, this hotel was a good choice: it was a 10-minute ride on the Q express line to my work location in lower Manhattan, and when I wanted to go to Times Square, it was a brisk 15-20 minute walk. Also, the front desk staff was pleasant at check-in and check-out. The breakfast area was well-stocked, but as someone who's used to eating more at that time of the day (i.e, not just fruit and cereal, but also eggs or egg whites or bacon), I needed to grab something on the way to work to feel satiated. This breakfast would be a good option for people who are happy with cereal, fruit, yogurt and toast in the morning. The mattress wasn't very comfortable. Each night, it took a little while to get used to that and fall asleep. It took a minute each morning to get the water temperature in the shower just right, but otherwise it worked well, and the water pressure was great. All in all, the hotel met my basic needs, but not much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta Manhattan Hotel - 17 West 32nd Street”
Reviews.Author: francine h
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with this hotel. It is centrally located and near shopping, Broadway plays, subway stops and Gray Line tour bus stops. The free breakfast room offerred tasty and healthy food and beverages. There was a business room with three PC's and a printer free of charge. The room was large and comfortable (very soft beds), and the housekeeping service was excellent. Check-in and check-out service was very efficient. The only problem I encountered was that the water was cold on the final day of my stay, so I couldn't take a shower before leaving for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Must have been nice once”
Reviews.Author: GeeDubya_UK
Reviews.Content: OK, so I got booked in here by the company. The hotel looked OK on the website, but as of right now, you can't see the facade for scaffolding and it's in the middle of Korea Town, so not quite the salubrious area it's address might imply. Inside, well... It was probably quite nice when it last had a facelift, but I suspect that was sometime in the late seventies. The view from the window was of a brick wall 8 feet away (probably not that unusual in Manhattan, I suppose) and the aircon rattled and wheezed like some kind of 19th century dive compressor. The bed featured a trick base that squeaked loudly when you sat on it, and thereafter very time you moved. I hung one of my suits in the closet, but the hook fell off the hanger, depositing my suit in a crumpled heap on the floor. I was advised that the rooftop bar had a spectacular view of the Empire State Building, which turned out to be true, but as the bar has no connection with the hotel, I couldn't charge anything to my room, which was a little odd. Into the shower the following morning, only to discover that it had been built before the invention of the thermostatic mixer. The temperature fluctuated wildly between freezing and scalding as other guests used the water supply. The hotel was billed as having free continental breakfasts, so I went down with great expectations in the morning. The breakfast room looked like the kitchen from a downmarket hostel, or maybe a prison visiting room - lino, cheap chairs and cheap domestic kitchen units round the walls. The food was basic but plentiful - bread, fruit, cereals, juice and coffee, but polystyrene plates and plastic cutlery??? And rather worryingly, a large sign on the coffee machine informing me that a CPR mask was available from the supervisor. Do many people collapse here and need CPR?

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGSS!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: albertoviajero z
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights. First night at about 4 am woke up to find a SEA of BEDBUGS. Requested a change of room. Next night same thing happened. Highly suggest not to stay at this hotel. Frontdesk is rude, rude rude. The manager is incompetent and full of himself. And needless to say... BEDBUGS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: KS79
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a king room at the LaQuinta in Manhatten. It was very close to Penn Station and shopping on 34th Street. The room was clean and the bed was very comfy. It was one of the few rooms available for Labor Day weekend. The hotel was not 5 star, but was clean and the price was decent by NY City standards. The room was decent sized, it wasn't huge but there was plenty of room to do what you needed to do. The room did have a flat screen tv, desk with computer work area, an IPod docking radio and they offered free breakfast in the morning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: glambert_forever
Reviews.Content: I had cancelled an earlier reservation due to Hurricane Irene. Although I cancelled late, after the penalty period, the general manager kindly agreed to refund the penalty if I re-booked within the next thirty days or so. I found myself needing a room on 9/20, called the general manager, and he was a man of his word. I should also add that there were no rooms to be had on the website (or anywhere in the city as far as I could tell) because the UN General Assembly was in town and hotel rooms were very scarce (and very expensive). However, he did manage to find a room for me on that date. The room was a very good size and extremely clean. The breakfast had a decent variety of cereals, fruit, bagels, eggs, etc. and was well-stocked. I found the staff helpful and pleasant. The location was convenient to the bus station and theaters. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close quarters but good location”
Reviews.Author: J0eB44
Reviews.Content: The service was unremarkable, not out of the ordinary. The room was very small but clean. The price was proportional to the size of the room. The location was good, very close to the Empire Stare building, as a matter of fact there was a rooftop lounge that enabled a neck wrenching view of the ESB. I recommend La Quinta for people that are on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk staff unacceptable, hotel stay made up for it”
Reviews.Author: daisylu0415
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived to the hotel at 730pm to find out our reservation had been cancelled. They cancelled stating I had an invalid credit card, which in fact the situation was the card expired and had been reactivated with the new expiration. This was after I called the hotel the week of our stay to assure confirmation was made. The front desk starff was extremely rude, did not apologize, stated they had tried to call me to notify me but said they had gotten an invalid phone number which was my phone number. Noone had tried to call. The man continued to help other customers, did not call his manager when we asked, and offered us a rate that was 70 dollars higher then was quoted originally. Completely unprofessional staff. The cleaning staff, breakfast, room, and location were all ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel for NYC Visits”
Reviews.Author: GS14
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta is an older building completely renovated by the Apple Core Hotel group. Check-in was quick and efficient. The elevators are small and slow. I had an 8th floor room with queen size bed. The room was spotless and the bed linen including the comforter was clean and fresh. The room size is very small with modern furnishings and a closet with a door. There is a 32 large LCD TV. The room is too small to allow use of the luggage racks without interfering with use of the available space. The bathroom was small and included a tub/shower. The bathroom was very clean. The towels are not plush and what I would expect in a budget hotel. The air conditioning is very good but the noise from the unit is noticable. Overall, I heard very little noise from the hallway and none from the street or neighboring rooms. The breakfast included in the room rate is basic with a selection of frash baked goods, yogurt, cereal, some fruit and hard boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Reg_Daphne
Reviews.Content: located in korea town.... close to macy's and empire state building is around the corner... Were the elevators slow - yes... big deal!!! The price is right, you get a morning breakfast included, the room was clean and tidy.. flat screen tv, one closet, one dresser, one desk and two endtables (not big,but not small either).. the washroom was clean and water pressure was great the bed was comfortable too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated Rudely”
Reviews.Author: BeachGalfromMN
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually get to stay here. I had to cancel my stay due to hurricane Irene. Because I never received a confirmation of my stay, I didn't know cancellation was due by 3:00 pm. on the day prior to arrival (my fault, I should have looked into it). I called at 4:00 pm just after a long chat with the airlines, who bent over backward to help out, even prior to allowing people to opt out of their flights. Each and every staff person I talked to was rude. While I understand the rules, they could have been more professional, helpful and less rude. The people at central La Quinta certainly were. I am thankful I am not staying here during my rescheduled trip. Who needs to be treated so poorly!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay In Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen D
Reviews.Content: We loved out stay. It's the perfect Location - right around the corner from Penn Station, the Empire State Building and Broadway, Clean, comfortable rooms and great FREE breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Will happily give your room away”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo2525
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a tour of the US in june 2011. When we tried to check in we found they had given our rooms away because my card details had changed. My card details HAD changed but i'd informed La quinta inns a few weeks earlier and they said there would be no problem. The office staff had said the had e mailed us the day before we arrived (which is not very helpful to travelling foreigners who may not have wifi), to confirm our booking. In fact they had mailed us at 11am on the day of arrival whilst we were travelling from Las Vegas by air. To travel for several ours just to find your room has been given away is so dispiriting. Some of the staff actually appeared to think this was funny (other staff were better though). Although the manager eventually found us a room in another hotel in the franchises group (Apple Core), the stress ruined our stay in New York. Other than this the hotel is mediocre at best, would stay elsewhere. We have stayed in anoth La Quinta inn in LA and that was a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “traveling with baby went well”
Reviews.Author: Rican524
Reviews.Content: I don't want to be repetitive considering everybody's said the same thing about elevators, food, and so on. So additional things would be that we requested a crib and it was nice not to worry about packing that. They brought us your standard graco pack and play with a few extra crib sheets. If you're picky about the sheets fitting a certain way then you might want to bring your own, but I'm not. We were on the 12th floor and from inside the room I did not hear the bar. Actually, I enjoyed being right underneath it because I was able to walk up a few stairs and have a glass of wine before bed:) There are some locals that do enjoy the bar, but that's because it's not pretentious. I did hear that they might be closing the bar and that would be sad. There are numerous places to eat nearby from nice restaurants to street vendors. We enjoyed $5 pizza specials. I used the computers and printers around midnight to print off itineraries for the next day. I'm glad we used the computers because we found out you can't take strollers to the statue of liberty:( The elevators are a lot less busy during off peak times. We checked in at 3pm and had no problems, but they were much busier at 6pm. Side note: we absolutely loved the water taxi. The inside is air conditioned and my older parents stayed in that part while the rest of us hung out on the top deck. We paid 25 bucks a person and it's good for the whole day.

Reviews.Title: “No problems and a great price”
Reviews.Author: FredMVa
Reviews.Content: Most New York City hotels are expensive. But this one is affordable. The location is convenient, close to the Empire State Building, and it's fun and interesting to walk through Koreatown every time you step outside. (If you stay here, you should have at least one Korean meal!) The rooms are pleasant, though not large. The lobby and breakfast area are also small, and sometimes very crowded. But the free breakfast is nice. It's not a luxury hotel, but it is convenient and comfortable. It is a terrific resource for someone who does not need grandeur, and who prefers to spend vacation money on something other than lodgings! You won't want to hang out a lot in this hotel, but you'll be happy and comfortable when you return to it at the end of the day. I was very satisfied and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, it's near everything. Going back again!”
Reviews.Author: juanesfan20
Reviews.Content: They let us check in early, their complimentary breakfast was good and you can take it up to your room if you'd like as well. The bed spreads were clean and they had memory foam mattresses, which were awesome. I didn't know that it was in Koreatown when i booked it, but it was awesome and it was around the corner from the Empire State Building and the rooftop bar was small but amazing view!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Koreatown, NYC”
Reviews.Author: Orlolo
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at this Hotel. The rooms were clean, and not as small as the normal NYC hotels rooms for the price. The staff were friendly and courteous, and were there to assist you with whatever you needed. Considering I lived in NYC for 27 years, and was back as a tourist, it felt very comfortable to stay here. It was convenient to everything!! I got to hit all the favorite spots in the city from this location. Most of the subway lines are about a block or two from the Hotel. Would stay here again on the next trip back! Overall, it's a really clean well maintained hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, professional staff, great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Annette1986
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Great Value, staff very helpful and professional. Rooms a little small, but clean and tidy. We were there for sightseeing vacation with family from out of the country. Had a great time. YOung woman at information booth was able to get my aunt and cousin tickets to Chicago near the stage, for great price. Breakfast plentiful and filling. Within walking distance to Penn Station, shopping, EMpire state Building, and other sights. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jjegj5k
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to New York and Washington DC, and were very happy with our stay at the La Quinta Manhattan. We drove, and were able to unload all our luggage right in front of the hotel. Parking was close by. We were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room. It was a larger room with 2 double beds. There was a safe in the closet. The breakfast area was small, but we always found a place to sit, and although there wasnâ€™t a large variety, the food was well stocked and filling. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: LiFrannie
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on Friday, July 22, 2011. Our room had a king size bed. We were on the 9th floor and the only problem seemed to be the elevators which were not air conditioned. The elevators were also very small and very slow. This was really our only complaint. The continental breakfast was great. Bagels, donuts, cereal, oatmeal, yogurt, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, milk, juice. We also had our car and parked across the street in the garage, which cost $27 (after the hotel validated) for 24 hours. The hotel was also conveniently located next to the subway. Would definately recommend this hotel for the price and the location!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: breeze3005
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Not sure where to stay in the city and reading review after review, we just weren't sure which hotel to stay in, that was moderately priced. The staff was very helpful. The room was spacious for a NYC hotel, plenty of storage and a very nice size safe in the room. We were able to fit 2 laptops, a couple handheld games, travel docs and still had room. We discovered that there wasn't hot water and that was promptly fixed. We were told the whole floor was out. We arrived at 2 am, so they said if it wasn't fixed by 9 am they would change rooms for us, but we woke to hot water, no problem.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER THEN THE LAST TIME”
Reviews.Author: Claytonandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel again this year as I said I would. I think they will be seeing me every year. As I stated in my review from last year [July 2010 ] the place is clean, location excellent, friendly staff. Just an around pleasant stay for the last 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again: clean, friendly, convenient, safe,”
Reviews.Author: goodbeegirl
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 day stay here with my husband and two teenage sons and was pleasantly surprised. For a mid-range price NYC hotel, we found the bedroom and bathroom roomy enough that we were not stepping over each other. Beds VERY comfortable and clean. The staff is consistently helpful & friendly. This location is incredibly close to the Empire State and Flatiron buildings, and a very easy walk to Macy's and Times Square. Subway is close by too. We had to park our car & the hotel made that easy and affordable. It's not fancy, but who cares? We came to see the city, not our hotel room! What you really want is a relaxing shower and clean, comfortable beds after a full day of traversing the city....and we all felt like we got that at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in K Town”
Reviews.Author: captainpeanuts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite old and could do with refurbishment, but i really couldnt fault it otherwise. The staff were very friendly and very helpfull. The roof top bar is cute and cosy and has the most superb view of the Empire State Building at night. The location is fabulous and the price extremely reasonable. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: BethanieKay
Reviews.Content: Generally, I think that La Quinta is a reputable, consistently clean, low-to-mid range hotel chain that provides good value. This LQ in Manhattan does not meet that standard. Granted, most hotels in NYC are extremely overpriced â€“ so already the value for what you get versus what you were forced to pay is poor. And granted, many hotels in NYC are in old buildings that have some restrictions in size and quality based on the constraints of the building they are in. However, this hotel still falls very short on the comfort and cleanliness scale, and is definitely not worth the prices they charge. The hotel is listed as a 3-star hotel, but Iâ€™d probably say itâ€™s more like a 2-star. The halls of the hotel smelled bad, and were very hot (there was only air conditioning in the lobby, and in the rooms themselves â€“ but not the hallways of the upper floors or the elevators). The walls of the hallways were painted a sort of 1970â€™s mint green, which you may or may not like â€“ I personally thought it made the hotel look old and outdated. The room that I had was extremely small, which Iâ€™d say is acceptable in the old buildings of NYC. However, the room felt unclean, and I just felt uncomfortable in it. The carpet seemed old, and strangely, the bathroom door didnâ€™t even have a handle on it. You just had to push it open â€“ and it wouldnâ€™t stay open. I was spring-loaded to close again automatically. Weird, and not to my liking. The shower took literally 4-5 minutes for hot water to come through, and when it finally did, it alternated between freezing cold and scalding hot. Not a pleasant shower experience, obviously. The only channels I could get on the TV were in Korean (this hotel is in Korea town), but if my TV remote would have been working properly, I might have seen other channels in English. Although I appreciated the complimentary internet that was provided throughout the hotel, I had difficulty staying connected to the WiFi signal (this may or may not have been due to my device, Iâ€™m unsure), and there was no work desk in my miniature room â€“ so I had nowhere to actually work, other than sitting on the bed. The bed itself was too squishy, and the bedspread just seemed icky, so that wasnâ€™t a great option for working, either. There were also not enough power outlets. I could only find one that was usable in the bedroom, otherwise, I had to use the one in the bathroom to charge my devices. Again, very odd. Overall, it was not a room I wanted to linger in at all. The complimentary breakfast buffet was mediocre, at best. Not the usual La Quinta fare. I only saw some bagels and yogurt, some bread for toast, some cheap donuts, some cold cereal, and of course coffee, juice and milk. The breakfast room was way too crowded, even at 930am (30 minutes before â€œclosingâ€� time), and there was no place for overflow. It was an unpleasant eating experience with so many people standing, waiting, and crowded around. On the positive side â€“ all of the employees I encountered were very nice and pleasant, even the housekeeping staff said hello in the hallways, and the person stocking the breakfast buffet told almost everyone good morning. Also, we had difficulty checking in (the system that electronically renders the card keys for the doors was down). So a maintenance employee had to let us in to each of our rooms individually, and we had to return to the front desk later to get our keys. The front desk staff gave us each a voucher for $13.01 (and odd amount) to be used next door at the Korean restaurant. Iâ€™m not sure if this is normal, or if they did this because of the inconvenience we experienced at check-in, but the effort was appreciated. One good thing, which may or may not be related to the hotel itself, is that there is a rooftop bar in this building. Iâ€™m not sure if itâ€™s owned by the La Quinta or if itâ€™s independent, but if you take the elevators to the 14th floor, there is a nice outdoor bar with lovely views of the Empire State Building. Prices were a bit expensive, but it is NYC, after all. Overall, although the location of this hotel is decent (in Mid-town Manhattan, near Times Square), the hotel itself was not to my liking and the value for price paid was too poor, therefore I will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: peckli
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just came back from NYC. We stayed 3 days at La Quinta. What a great hotel. Rooms were small but very clean. We found the location to be very convient to all major attractions, subway and bus lines. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The neighborhood was safe and we did not feel uncomfortable walking around at night. Our whole trip was a pleasant experience and I would definately come back and stay at this hotel again. I picked this hotel based on trip advisor recommendations from other people. Having never been to NYC I took a chance on this hotel and it paid off.

Reviews.Title: “charged for two rooms because reservation was duplicated, street very dirty, parking rip off,”
Reviews.Author: pjg0929
Reviews.Content: When travelling I always confirm my travel arrangement 1 â€“ 2 weeks prior to arrival. I called the hotel the previous week to verify my reservation. The individual could not find it. I went on-line and created a new one. When I arrived the hotel clerk told me that I had two reservations, I explained to her what happened and asked her to delete the duplicate. She refused. I contacted the manager and because no one would admit that they talked to me about the missing reservation he will not credit the charge. I was charged for two rooms . I was told the parking was 30.00, The car was in the garage 24 hours and 45 minutes and I was charged 60.00. The door man is very lazy, every time I saw him he was sitting on the steps texting. Never opened the door or asked to handle the bags, The street was very dirty and busy, there are actually two street signs , 32nd street and Korean Way, If you like Korean food and culture you will fit right in. Do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location, lacking in other areas”
Reviews.Author: ginabuchanan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location to the Empire State Bldg., located on 32nd St. between 5th Ave & Broadway in "korea town". I booked online and was not able to book a "Non-smoking" room. The web does not allow you to select any smoking preference. So after booking I called and requested they add non-smoking to my room. The hotels were very expensive this week and I was able to get a great AAA rate. I was also able to get non-smoking room upon check-in. The staff was super friendly. The room itself was rather disappointing though. Very small but that's ok and to be expected in NYC. The cleanliness was lacking. The decor needs to be updated. There was hair around the sink and in the bath which is a pet peeve. It took me 5 minutes to get the hot water working in the shower. It was hard to get the temp to my preference - window unit (did not have digital thermostat to specify temp). But the bed did sleep ok, of course I was extremely exhausted... The room provided a hair dryer, coffee maker, iron, and nice flat screen TV. They offer comp breakfast but I did not even go to see what the selection consisted of....

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTravelqueen
Reviews.Content: I booked last September for 2 rooms for 3 nights in June at this hotel as a final stopover in a 3-week USA trip. A couple of months after I made the online reservation my credit card company contacted me to say they were reissuing my credit card as there had been potential fraudulant activity at one of the hotels booked for our trip! I contacted all of the hotels we had reserved and for the La Quinta I had emailed via the website to advise the situation and to ask if I needed to provide the new card number and had an email response which stated no payment was taken at the time of booking so this was not necessary. We had no problems at any of the other 10 accomodations we stayed at in USA. Upon arriving to New York on Tuesday 7th June at 3pm we were told by the man at the desk (Zac - with much sighing and face pulling) that our room reservation had been cancelled because the bank declined my card. He advised that I had been emailed the day before to advise me and to ask for a new credit card. I asked why no one had called me as it was such an urgent matter and he said it was policy to email when the contact given was an international number! The man was rude (as with other posts, wonder if its the same idiot!!) I insisted he called the manager and he made a call infront of me in another language and was pulling faces and laughing during the call... how rude! The manager came and I Insisted he called other hotels to help find a room for us. The manager was inititally fairly unhelpful stating 'it isnt my responsibility to manage your credit cards properly' and when I asked why no one had phoned me he re-iterated that policy is to email when an international number is given. I have never been spoken to in such an unprofessional or unhelpful manner. The reason we cancelled the credit card was because of the lack of card security in USA and someone at one of the hotels we booked had tried to use our card number fraudulantly..... hardly a case of me 'not managing my credirt card'. I explained to the manager that I had contacted La Quinta regarding the card and showed the email response. He stated that it was a generic response and not relevant because La Quinta was just a franchise so whatever reply I got from the website would not apply to all hotels. After me unfortunately losing my temper the manager agreed to find us rooms elsewhere but after a wait we were told that there was in fact one room still available at La Quinta and that one couple would have to stay at a nearby hotel for the first night and that a room was available at La Quinta for the other 2 nights. I initially refused the offer as I did not want to pay a cent to this hotel however, after a quick run around it was apparent we wouldn't get in anywhere else so we accepted. We left my parents at La Quinta and the manager told the doorman to get us a taxi to the other hotel and left. As soon as the manager had the left the doorman told us we should walk as he would not be able to get us a taxi at that time. So... we trecked for about a mile with our cases through Manhattan in a heatwave - charming!! Plus we had the additional cost of a cab the next day back to La Quinta!!! The mystery email which 'Zac' said he had sent the day before actually arrived when I connected to the wifi, in reality it had been sent at 10.30 that morning requesting a new credit card number .... I was on the flight to NYC at that time!! If email had been sent day before I would have been able to pick it up in time to avoid situation!! When we eventually checked in at La Quinta the next day a room was available early for us which was aprreciated. I have visited Manhatten several times so am aware that rooms are expensive/small. The room was indeed small and next to the lift and linen cupboard so quite noisy. Toilet was blocked but this was repaired quickly following complaint. Breakfast offering was poor (vile coffee, watered down orange) and the breakfast room is too small for the amount of guests resulting in a crowded waiting room atmosphere with people eating in lobby & lifts even!! Never again! One week later I am still very angry and will never stay here again I will also ensure anyone I know never stays here be it for business or pleasure. I would say my review of the hotel is of the customer service as anything else was probably overshadowed by this.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, OK hotel, near Penn Station and Empire State Bldg.”
Reviews.Author: bluevoter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value for midtown Manhattan, especially with the AARP discount rate. The room was clean and of adequate size. Everything in the room worked, including the free WiFi, and there was a good selection of channels on TV. The free breakfast was nothing special, but the bagels and pastries were fresh. The staff was friendly enough, and both checkin and checkout were easy. People who are unfamiliar with NYC prices may well be underwhelmed by this La Quinta, since it's an older building with a tiny lobby. I wouldn't want to stay there for several days, but it worked fine for an overnight stay. The subway is less than a block away, and Penn Station is two blocks away, which is very convenient for getting to/from JFK on the Long Island RR and the AirTrain. It's only a 10 minute walk to the theater district. That block of 32nd Street is filled with Korean restaurants, but there's a good French bakery there, too.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for business trips”
Reviews.Author: Alice_95d
Reviews.Content: I stayed in early June 2011, booked through a hotel search engine, filtering it with location and price. Location was great. But there was just a bed taking up about 90% of the tiny room, NO workdesk to be seen! The hotel search engine clearly said 'The work desk and coffee maker are provided in every room.' How can you make a business trip staying at a hotel without a workdesk? I have used many hotels on business trips, this is the only hotel that didn't have one. I had to work hours with my laptop sitting on the bed, which wasn't easy at all. Definitely not recommended for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it!”
Reviews.Author: agrepina82
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend have come to the States for the first time and picked this hotel after some research on the internet by chance. It was a lucky pick! The hotel is in walking distance to the Empire State Building, 5th Avenue, Herald Square, Madison Square Garden and if you like to walk you can be at Times Square or Rockefeller Center in about 15-20 Minutes. The hotel has a concierge service in the entrance if you need some advice on how and where to start. There is a popular bar on the rooftop but we did not go there during our stay. We were pleasently suprised by the breakfast which was included in the price. You won't be disappointed. Our room was quite big and they cleaned the room every day. La Quinta Inn has not the newest building but it is good enough. Maybe the only thing I did not like too much was the smell from the neighbour Korean Restaurant. Our hallway was smelling all the time like we were standing right inside the kitchen. But other than that we enjoyed our stay and we would definatley recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT VALUE, GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: carolk1030
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay. It was very clean, the staff accomodting, breakfast appreciated, slept very well on a soft mattress with air conditioner (no odor noted) and multiple pillows. Our housekeeping person dd an excellent daily room cleaning and appreciated her friendly manner. The room was small but so are the rooms at Disneyworld. You are not there to stay in the hotel room but to sight see after all. The price was good for Manhatten. The hotel is on Korean Way or 32nd st. and there are many great restaurants and fun ambience esp. the yogert shops where we stoppped daily.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: M_and_J24
Reviews.Content: La Quinta was much better than we had expected. This is a very old building, which retains some of it's character. The room had all the conveniences, including coffee maker, safe, flat screen tv, free local calls, free Wifi and hair dryer. I must admit the space was tight...but everything we needed was there. The nicest surprise was the continental breakfast....fresh fruit, yogurt, eggs, cereals, along with the pastries...and decent coffee too! The staff were great...hailed us taxis and stored our baggage when we arrived at 8am. The downside was a long wait for an elevator and the rooftop patio was highly overrated...and crowded! The best part about this hotel was definitely the neighborhood! 2 blocks from Macy's and the Empire State building, and within a few short hours we had walked through Times Square, Saks 5th Avenue, the Rockefeller Centre, the Plaza and into Central Park to name a few sights. If you are looking for modern and spacious, La Quinta is probably not for you, but if you're looking for a good clean, pleasant hotel in a fantastic location then you've found the right place! We will definitely stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal right in the heart of midtown manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: Salsajo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel upon the recommendation of another family member who stays here on business occasionally and we were not disappointed! We had a very positive experience at this hotel, right from arrival to departure. We arrived to NYC at 10:30 am via train at Penn Station, which is located only a few short blocks from La Quinta. After a short walk we arrived early in the morning at La Quinta loaded down with all our luggage, far too early to check in. The lovely staff there took our luggage and stowed it safely away in a locked room for us, so we could go off and explore for the day and come back later to check in. When we returned later on, we had a lovely room with two very comfortable beds. The room was very quiet both nights we spent there. The roof top bar was fabulous and the view of the Empire State Building was incredible! The location of the hotel is fabulous. It is close to everything and close to all the subways. The included breakfast is an unbelievable bonus for NYC. The staff was always pleasant and smiling. This hotel is a great value for Manhattan!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Irakate
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for one night to attend a concert and I wasn't looking for anything fancy. This hotel was very clean - I checked for bed bugs. My only complaint was that I wasn't guaranteed a non-smoking room. I had to take a smoking room. The front desk sent someone up to open the window and he also sprayed the drapes with a deodorizer. The only problem was that the window overlooked a ventilation system which was very noisy and the room smelled of spices and food from the local restaurants. I did not sleep well. I guess it was better than stale smoke. I did not hear noise from other guests or street noise. The shower was great and breakfast was included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Corredor01
Reviews.Content: We stayed there fro five nights last April,2011. Weather was still a little cold, great to sleep, our bedroom didn't have much noise, was the number 1209, 12th floor, turned to the back street, I could see Empire State from my windows. The hotel's staff was perfect, very attencious, everything I'd asked them, they answered in details, Directions, facilities, average prices in the city, etc. The room was not big, but had everything we needed in good conditions. It was very clean and tidy every night when we got back to hotel. Bathroom was always clean as well, bathtub a little old, but always very clean. The breakfast was better than we expected before going there. Fruits, cereal, milk, coffee, donuts, yogurt, etc. Enough to begin our tourism circuit everyday. Facilities are good, free Wifi, internet access on the lower lobby for those without a portable computer. Just the fitness center that I didn't like because of the musty smell. I definitely recommend the hotel for those who doesn't want to spend a lot of money on a comfy hotel in Manhathan.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: NickyOm
Reviews.Content: La Quinta is a good deal in expensive New York. As everyone says, great location! Walking distance to Penn Station, Times Square, and The Empire State Building (which is literally right behind the hotel). We took buses and trains uptown and caught them about one block away. It's easy to flag a taxi going uptown or downtown on 5th or 6th Avenues. Plentiful ethnic (mostly Korean/other Asian) restaurants, even a well-stocked Korean grocery two doors down, great-looking deli on the corner and CVS, Chase Bank, Macy's all within a block or two. We had a non-smoking room with 2 queen beds. It was $225/night plus taxes, but with a 10% AARP discount the base price was $202.49 per night (plus $33.37 in taxes). Tip: the AARP discount is 10% while the AAA or senior citizen discount is just 5%. We got there before noon and the room wasn't ready (check-in is 3 PM) but they kindly gave us a room immediately when I told them my elderly mother would be resting in the lobby until it was ready. The room wasn't big but it wasn't tiny either. There was room for 2 chairs and a desk; Nice big flat screen TV with lots of channels; A room safe that locks and unlocks just by swiping a credit card. Seems like people either love or hate the foam Tempurpedic mattress the hotel uses. You sink into the foam and that makes it a little hard to move around or roll over, etc. While my mother didn't like it at all, I slept well and happy to wake up without a back-ache. No bedbugs! The room was very clean, and every day it was made up impeccably. On the 8th floor it was quiet. But we had no view except the windows of the next-door building's offices around a central "well". I could just barely see a sliver of sky. Maybe that's why it was quiet - we didn't face the street. The breakfast is really good! I don't understand the complaints on TripAdvisor about mediocre carb-fests and fast-food fare - which is what I was expecting from the reviews. If you want you can have a quite healthful breakfast: oatmeal, real orange juice, bananas, apples and pears, non-sugared cereal, whole-wheat toast, hot hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, low fat milk, tea and coffee. There's also an assortment of (Noah's?) bagels & cream cheese. There's cinnamon buns, donuts, Frosted Flakes, etc. if you like a sweeter breakfast. You can really have a substantial and good breakfast - and it's free! The staff tending to the breakfast area was fantastic - working continuously to refill items so nothing ever ran out. They were constantly cleaning up, keeping the area running smoothly - just excellent, hardworking staff. I was impressed when I saw the guy remove a bowl of bananas which had begun to speckle (just a tad too ripe) and replaced them with perfect yellow bananas. The apples were crisp and juicy. We luckily never had to wait for a table but you may have to wait a few minutes on occasion, especially on the weekend. Loved the free internet and printer access - there were 3 computers. There's also an exercise room with a flat-screen TV. A few things could be improved: - The water in the shower and sink never got really hot. We had to let the water run a very long time before it got warm. If we waited long enough, we finally got hot-ish water. - The air-conditioner cooled the room down but not as cool as I like. Also the vent faced straight up, not out into the room and the air got caught behind the curtain which billowed out. I had to rig the curtain so it wouldn't trap the cool air behind it. - The room is a bit dark because of lack of sunlight. La Quinta offers shuttle service to JFK, La Guardia and Newark airports through a third-party at the concierge office in the lobby. We booked the shuttle ($63 for 3 people to Newark). Very convenient and quick but I cannot recommend them because the van was not safe. My mom's seatbelt was missing but luckily our hotel was the first stop so she could move to the back row where she found one. The unfortunate people we picked up at other hotels had to go without. Also the shock absorbers were terrible. The driver was friendly and a safe and sane driver - in contrast to some crazy taxi drivers! When I expressed surprise that the company (Apple Commuter) would send out a van with missing seatbelts, he said "Yeah, the van is junk." It would be nice if La Quinta associated with a better quality shuttle service. Overall La Quinta Manhattan exceeded our expectations. NY is not cheap but this hotel gives good value and we'd definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice option in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: mobycat
Reviews.Content: Had a last minute trip to New York and found the La Quinta based on price and location. It's one block from the Empire State Building in the Koreatown section of Manhattan. Macy's is about 3 blocks away. Even though it's not a main thoroughfare, taxis pass by very often. The rooms are small, as expected in Manhattan. Very quiet. The bed... foam. I HATED it. Personal preference, but I don't know why anyone would like sleeping on a foam bed. I don't like soft beds and this was 10x worse. The shower - took FOREVER to heat up. This was at 3am, so it wasn't a matter of sharing water with anyone else. Once it did heat up, the temperature range was good. Pressure not too bad, either. They have flat screen TV's and even better, the alarm clocks are iPod docks. Cordless phones - 2 in the room which seemed kind of pointless, considering the size of the room. It's an older building, so the elevators are fairly slow. With 14 floors, expect a longer than usual wait for the elevators. I found it easier to walk down 8 flights of stairs rather than wait for the elevator. Free wireless internet - a definite bonus, especially in Manhattan I'm guessing. There is a 24 hour CVS less than a half-block away, so if you forget anything, you are covered. The benefits outweigh the crummy bed, so I would recommend this hotel. My AAA rate was $189/night (about $225 after taxes are added in).

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant, dismissive, high-handed”
Reviews.Author: DonArmstrong
Reviews.Content: Subject: La Quinta Manhattan Location: New York City, New York, United States, North America Title: Worst hotel treatment ever ID#: 102352465 From: Mr DON ARMSTRONG Date: Mar 24,2011 Subject: Complaint Would I stay here again?
