Finally someone other than the management at La Quinta Manhattan will read this. Nobody there cares enough to even respond. The answer? Never. Neither should you... In fact, with no apology or compensation for the events of last week, I will make it my mission to go out of my way to warn others that the management at this location needs to go. We have never been treated in such a dishonest fashion, and been met with such arrogance as from the La Quinta Manhattan's manager. The rest of the staff are very nice. And they quite obviously detest this man as well. The hotel was emailed ahead of our arrival to inform them that packages that would be arriving at the hotel prior to our arrival; packages that were clearly explained to be of an urgent nature, as they were needed for a tradeshow setup at the Javits Center on the morning of our arrival. This has never been a problem in the past at this hotel. We had stayed here many times. In fact, it has never been a problem at any hotel that we have ever stayed in. After clearly indicating via email that this was against their new policy, but that they would make an exception in this case of not accepting packages until the guest is checked into the hotel, the hotel manager went ahead and refused our deliveries from UPS regardless. I would be pleased to show you their emails in order to prove these statements to you. Instead of an apology and/or some effort to compensate for the fact that they had done this after promising not to...... they made a pathetic attempt to use my email response, which thanked them and advised that I would ask my shipper to TRY for a Wednesday delivery, (the day of arrival) as their excuse for refusing my packages, when they arrived the day before. Our tradeshow materials arrived back at my Chicago office the night before the trip to NEW YORK, forcing us to take them onto the airplane as excess baggage, at an extra cost to us of $200. Our tables could not be re-delivered in time, forcing us to waste half of the day of our arrival shopping for new ones, while we were supposed to be setting up our booth. new tables; another $66.00. Add in the UPS $100 in shipping costs after LaQuinta Manhattan's refusal to accept them. Not UPS's fault at all! But here's the kicker. Nobody at Apple Core Hotels has seen fit to even respond to our complaint. I spend an average of 100 nights per year in hotels, and this would be the first complaint that I have ever lodged... SO before booking, call and ask who's in charge. Is it the same guy from March 2011???

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with awesome location and good staff”
Reviews.Author: lbalisson
Reviews.Content: this hotel has a great location. it was less than a 10min walk to Times Square, right behind the Empire State Building and close to the subway. being a solo female traveller it was good that the streets surrounding the hotel were always busy so i felt safe walking home late at night. the room itself was very clean and so was the bathroom, the room was warm and the bed comfortable. the staff working there were also very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Clean,good location,friendly, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: fastfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in April 2011. It suited our needs. Clean, comfortable, good location.Would return here again when visiting New York.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: mlanders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta Manhattan for 4 nights in April. Our room was extremely small. It was just myself and my 10 yr old in the room with a queen size bed and we were tripping over each other. The bed was Extremely comfortable though. We were on the 9th floor and didnt hear any noise from the street. There is free breakfast included but the room was always so full that we only used it one time as there is a sign asking you not to take food to your room. It was your standard breakfast with bagels, juice, cereal and fruit and yogurt. The hotel is located right in the heart of Korea Town and is surrounded by restaurants. It is very convenient to the subway and about 3 blocks from Penn Station. For the right price we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, good price. It works, if you're looking for a decent bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trenner
Reviews.Content: It's in a busy and not particularly fun part of the city, but it's very close to Penn Station so it's easy to come and go to airports/trains, and it easy to walk or subway to any other part of the city from there. The lobby is busy and cramped with slow elevators (but so what), the rooms are small (as one would expect), but my bedroom was clean, it was cool and quiet, the WiFi worked, and the bed was GREAT. There's a little rooftop bar where you can look up at the Empire State Bldg. and the drinks aren't expensive, so that's nice too. The breakfast is just okay, but it will get you through the day. The plates and bowls and cups are styrofoam (ick) and the "cutlery" is plastic. Otherwise, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: willieromano
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Victor for his willingness to resolve those inconveniences in order to make our stay at la Quinta,Manhattan, a unforgettable one. In general, I'd give them 100% satisfaction on customer service, room and the continental breakfast. I just missed the Pool. Thanks, la Quinta. William

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and a bargain”
Reviews.Author: Jrub58
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights to celebrate our two year anniversary. The hotel was in a great location and the view from the rooftop bar was amazing. The room was small but that is expected in New York. The sound from the hallways carried into the rooms and the bratty little teenagers that were across the hall from us made so much noise that it sounded like they were in our room with us. The free breakfast was fine for me but my boyfriend wanted waffles because the pictures in the elevators advertising the breakfast had waffles in them lol. The staff was friendly when we checked in and out. The room was practically a steal at $106 a night. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You should totally stay here!"”
Reviews.Author: TheRealRebecca
Reviews.Content: I researched tons of hotels in NYC, and the room size and location on this one seemed to be our best option. Great location, just off 32nd and 5th Ave, literally steps from Empire State building, and reasonable walking distance to Times Square, Union Square area, Theater District, etc, about 2 miles to central park. The room was really spacious by New York standards, and allowed up to 4 adults with no extra costs. It was really clean, offered free breakfast and Wi-Fi, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel if you want a nice, basic, reasonably priced hotel in a great central location. Certainly not a luxury hotel with a ton of amenities, but we were impressed for the price! Also, the memory foam beds were really comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value - just bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: VLMMemphis_TN
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to NYC and when I started searching for hotels I was appalled at the prices. I lucked up on the La Quinta and thought it was fairly good compared to others. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived in NY. The La Quinta was right in the middle of everything. We were close to Macy's, good shopping, walking distance to Times Square. The room was small but comfortable enough for just the two of us especially considering that we were out and about most of the time. The hotel was clean and the staff was responsive to our needs. Free internet was a plus and there was a nice bar on the top floor. When I return to NY - which I plan to do - I would definitely stay there again. Only issue was the noise. It was right in the middle of Korea town and we had a street view. NYC truly never sleeps and deliveries were being made all night long. I didn't notice to our last night but next time I'll take earplugs and be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't accept a room on 14th floor”
Reviews.Author: sattamassaganna
Reviews.Content: 14th floor is the top floor and on the top floor you will find a very trendy NYC bar, which opens at 17:30 and closes at about 2:00 in the morning. The patrons are extremely loud when they are waiting for elevators. You will not sleep until 2 AM. Some douchebags set of the fire alarm at 2 Am to add to the experience. Otherwise, this place has an amazing location, close for everything. Cheap too, I paid $110 for the room. The rooms are cramped, but what do you expect? Free wi-fi is effectively not working, except deep into the night. So many people are connected to it and they must all be downloading movies, since there is no way to get any bandwidth in the evening. There are no bed bugs here. They have a weekly spraying program.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here last year and staying again next week!”
Reviews.Author: kasper905
Reviews.Content: I love it here! The price is great and location excellent. I asked for a room with a city view this time tho becasue my rom last year I faced a wall and made me a bit claustrophobic , so hopefully I get the city view! The breakfast is excellent! I cant believe its free! I always get a double bedroom so that its bigger, we were very comfy in the double queen and the beds are very comfy! Staff was nice too. I will always stay here, and Im pretty picky =) The only small recommendation: updated rooms, its been a year but they could use updated bedding and carpet

Reviews.Title: “simply the best”
Reviews.Author: FDevlieger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at La Quinta Manhattan for 4 days, enjoyed a splendid stay and experienced a wonderful and positive experience. First the location : simply perfect Room : perfect as we had two double beds, more than enough space for 3 people Bathroom a bit tiny, but ok for us Toproof bar : superb view on the Empire State building, what a feeling Reception : very helpful and friendly people, we felt home immediately Breakfast : simple and efficient, we did not need anything more And then we have an additional story we want to tell to everyone : the date of our departure, we forgot a wallet containing 400$, and only noticed this when arriving at the JFK airport...I called the hotel, but the housekeeper was not available anymore, so I left a message announcing our loss. Next day arriving in Europe, in the day, i already obtained a phonecall from the hotel housekeeper informing they found the wallet and money. Later on, the hotel manager Mr Victor, coordinated with us how to send back the money, which we finally did collect last weekend. A splendid positive experience showing that the hotel team is totally honest, and fully at the customers service. We arranged to bring them a nice tip via friends who will visit NY within a few weeks, they really deserve it ! Anyhow, overall evaluation beside the above experience, the hotel is the best value for money, and we compared this with the 4 previous visits we made in NY to other more expensive hotels...and next visit, no discussion, this will be La Quinta Manhattan again. go there for Your next staying in NY, for sure a hit ! Family DEVLIEGER-DEMETS from Belgium

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: carolynthor
Reviews.Content: my husband and i loved this hotel !! great price and near time square and a quick subway ride to anything else. loved walking around at nigh and going to the yummy pizza places near by. vary safe. when we left i didnt pull the door to our room all the way closed yikes! came back to nothing missing. the door men went out of thier way to help us with our subway maps. going back april 4th for 4 nights and cant wait to stay again, i tell everyone i know that goes to nyc to stay here for the great rates and great serivce keep up the great jo

Reviews.Title: “Attention All Travelers: Location is Great .. the Beds are extremely restful !”
Reviews.Author: travelusa
Reviews.Content: Location was Ideal, the King size Bed extremely comfortable, the memory foam does make a difference. Staff was very friendly, would recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LiamRyan32
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 weeks, July 2010 and enjoyed my stay for the most part. We had a non smoking room which was very well air conditioned, free wifi and very confi bed, the maid service is EXCELLENT and are to be commended, my room as spotless and fixed up every day. The location is perfect for a mid town stay, 1 block from the Empire State building, Time Square is a 10 minute walk away and there is a subway station at the end of the street, right in the middle of Korean Town there are plenty of nice places to eat. There are down sides to staying here, the breakfast isn't up to much and consists of sugary or boring 'fast food breakfast', the bar on the roof is very popular with the locals and although it is nice bar to have a drink in it can become VERY busy on the weekends which causes a great deal of noise and tom foolery on the tops few floors and makes it difficult to use the elevators. These things might seem small but after 2 weeks it got on my nerves. This hotel is perfect if you do not intent to spend much time there, why would you its NYC. When I return to New York I will stay here again despite the down sides.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ushalavie
Reviews.Content: Best staff, best service. A home away from home! And so well situated, close to main stores like Macy's.

Reviews.Title: “Not a boutique hotel but offers main commodities”
Reviews.Author: 187849Ana
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was worth staying inn if you don't want to spend too much on hotels. It has some positive aspects like it is in a centered area (near a metro station) or close to many entertainment places like Madison Square Gardens or not far from TimesSquare. However, I've been to various boutique hotels and this certainly isn't one. As it claimed to be on the information sheet that you are given when you arrive. For starters, the smell of korean food from the entrance of the hotel to the corridors is constantly all over. The breakfast area is poorly equipped. Food ser ved in plastic cups and plates leaves you feeling a bit disappointed. It does not offer a great variety of food (not even waffles as it says) or other hot food. Rooms are confortable but bathrooms aren't really, they are not heated and you can't have a great view. I would say it is recommended if you don't want to spend too much but don't care about little extras.

Reviews.Title: “HIDDEN JEWEL IN NEW YORK CITY”
Reviews.Author: rowdyroo44
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a week in NYC, NY - Manhattan district - with all of the hotels extremely pricey (ridiculou for the average person)- it is so hard to find a decent hotel, in a safe area, with great ammenities. Belonging to the La Quinta returns program, I looked up la Quinta in Manhattan as a last resort - sure I would notind one I could afford. I found the Manhattan La Q. The price, was reasonable and better with AARP! Upon checking in -the location was 2 blocks of Madison Square Garden and all of he major shoppng areas - everything was within walking distance and when a cab was required the doorman was only quickly to obligue. The front desk staff greeted you with a smile,which never let down - I could not find an unfriendly staff member! - the rooms were top knotch, kept so clean by housekeeping, and the beds were so comfortable and rooms quiet so you cold sleep. The free breakfast was delicious and fresh! I cant say enough to compliment this outstanding hotel. I travel with a service dog and he was well received by staff as well. I strongly rcommend this hotel as a great buy for a safe, clean, and outstandingly wel run hotel in such a busy city known for rudeness! - THANK YOU Manhattan LaQuinta for a wonderful trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great bed!”
Reviews.Author: jenny6578
Reviews.Content: we really enjoyed our stay. rooms are really average but the bed was great, the service was great, the people were great and helpful, and it has a great rooftop bar. we were close to the great things about manhattan, but not too close.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: petecris21
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my partner over weekend of Jan 28th. Location is just perfect for visitors. Walk to everything in midtown. Empire State Building was right behind our room and we actually got a view - sort of craning our necks upwards. Hotel is not new but really clean, beds are comfy, staff goes out of their way and rooms are large for New York. Breakfast was adequate, and all for $118 and change with with my AAA card. Can't beat that for value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice to come back to”
Reviews.Author: brucesmithSydney
Reviews.Content: When I booked online via applecore.com? I got a quick response from the team. Very polite and helpful. We arrived late in the evening and we recieved a greeting from the staff. Our room was small( welcome to New York) there all the same. Don't let that put you off. It all runs like a well oiled cog. Breakfast was basic. Very busy from opening time. It was a shame that the owner did not get back to me, as i have a few comments that will , I'm sure be an advantage in the during breakfast. i.e the power to the toasters kept shutting off every day at least 4 times, much to the dismay of the customers. No healthy food was on offer. The typical food on offer was, iced buns and very sugary serials, Bagels, white bread, the menu needs to be changed for a healthy one. the man with the turban who was on duty some of our 10 day stay was amazing the way he worked. I woul demploy him any day(Owner please note and email me) i was told that you read all of the reviews... Bruce & Sheila Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: mgduran
Reviews.Content: I love the location of the hotel is a block away from Herald Square, one walking block to MACY's! (the best store ever)! The hotel is only one block away from the Empire State Building. There was a friendly gentleman that helped me take in my luggage upon arriving and the front desk person was very bubbly and helpful. Our ice machine was broken on our floor but when I could not find a floor with one working, the gentleman downstairs went to get an bucket full of ice. Our housekeeper was very friendly and came quickly with our towels when we requested extra ones. I will definitely stay here again. The only suggestion to make it better would be to have a microwave and a small fridge. That would be my only complaint.

Reviews.Title: “I'd happily stay here again”
Reviews.Author: arrooo
Reviews.Content: Several of us stayed here for three days in January while attending the NRF Conference. Since rooms were not over priced we were a little hesitant but were very happily surprised. Rooms have been recently refurbished and very clean, beds are a 9 on a scale of 1 to 10, LCD and WiFi. Rooms aren't huge but very very comfortable. I'd very happily recommend and stay here again. Service was good, and hotel staff was friendly. Location is also very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep on a month-long holiday!”
Reviews.Author: SandyJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reviewing accommodation in NYC and, for some reason, this hotel appealed to me:within budget, close enough to walk to attractions and most importantly, clean. Having spent a month travelling in the US, we found to our surprise (and delight!), that the mattresses on the beds, were just the best for a good night's sleep. We woke up each morning, quite refreshed and ready to walk our way around the city - even on a cold winter's morning!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and great experience.”
Reviews.Author: NYC20111
Reviews.Content: LaQuinta in Manhattan was a great hotel for experiencing NYC! The location, continental breakfast, and helpful staff were assets to a fun winter vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located and affordable”
Reviews.Author: BellaAurora66
Reviews.Content: My husband took my to NYC for my birthday weekend - December 17-19, 2010. We stayed at La Quinta Manhattan and had a wonderful stay! Our room view was a building, but when we looked up there was the Empire State Bldg. - I was really pleased. The roof top bar was wonderful we sat outside - under the heaters - and enjoyed the view of the Empire State bldg. Our room had a comfortable, clean queen size bed and was a good size. Great location there was a subway at the top of the block, Macy's was just around the corner and at Christmas it was wonderful to go see the windows and all the beautiful lights (3 times we went by there). We even walked from Rockefeller Ctr. back to the hotel - not a bad walk (it was after midnight and we felt perfectly safe on the streets). The breakfast was perfect and had many options to choose from. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Ill-Mannered Manager”
Reviews.Author: happytalkTuscaloosa
Reviews.Content: I love manhattan. The location of this hotel is perfect. The rooms are nice. The continental breakfast is pleasing and the staff is helpful. I have alwys enjoyed La Quinta Inns and would definetly recommend this hotel... The only damper on this particular hotel is the manager, V. Alim. He is rude, discourteous and does not know how to communicate with people.. If you have a problem, you definetly do not want to take it to him. I never advocate for firing someone; instead, I believe some communication or business ethics training is needed. If not for the manager, I would say that this is an excellent hotel;otherwise, very, very good would have to suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dori46
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews and hearing so much about bedbugs, we went prepared. Check-in was prompt and staff was very friendly. We did a "bedbug check" (only because stories of New York had us cautious) and happily found everything very clean! The room was quite comfortable in size and the bed was comfortable. Often beds feel like a lot of bodies had slept there. It was quiet and we slept like babies. The continental breakfast was ample and had an attendant on duty to refill as necessary. The location was perfect for us to walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, the Flatiron District and was close to the LIRR and subways. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great property for the money!”
Reviews.Author: TravelTeam614
Reviews.Content: Convenient location between 5th and Broadway, clean rooms, great view of the ESB from Rooftop bar and our room. 2 blocks to Subway. Breakfast was well stocked, staff friendly. Our friend in Manhattan couldn't believe the deal and will rec. this site to others.

Reviews.Title: “Be Careful”
Reviews.Author: ForYourConsideration
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for Thanksgiving Day 2010. Arrived at their 17 West 32nd Street location only to find an abandoned building. Besides the untold inconvenience, it makes me wonder if the reservation website is a scam to rip off credit card numbers.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, not the cleanest”
Reviews.Author: roselynnbelle
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel based on the location and price. It is defnitely a no frills hotel, which is fine with me. . When you enter/exit the lobby, you can smell the cooking from the restaurant next door, which I didn't care for. It is close to Macy's, Empire State Building, walking distance to Times Square. The staff was friendly, beds comfortable as they are memory foam. Our room was very run down looking. rugs were dark so you could see that they don't vacuum around any of the corners or under desk or bed that often. Our soap dish in the bathroom was an ashtray which I thought was very unusual. I don't know if we were in a non smoking room or not (we don't smoke) but to use an ashtray as a soapdish was not cool, budget hotel or not. Breakfast was decent, good coffee, bagels, pastry and the one person working there in the a.m. was always very friendly. We parked an SUV which in the end cost us $40 per day, something to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “First time NYC visitor....Very Pleased!! Will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Mackm5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled for the first time to the city. We decided last minute to take the 5 hour bus ride to NY to watch the parade. We booked our room less than a week from our arrival and still got a great deal...$550...for 3 nights including all taxes. To our surprise, the hotel was very nice, very clean and the staff was very friendly. The rooms are small but expected for the city. I will take location over size anyday seeing we only used the room for sleeping. I booked a queen bed with the thought of myself, my husband and my son could share. Definitely was a tight and uncomfortable squeeze for us. The beds seemed to be more of a Full than queen. They ate very comfortable though. Breakfast was great with it being Free and adequate. Bagels, yogurt, donuts and coffee suit us just fine for a filling breakast. Luggage storage is an awesome service. We checked out and stored our bags while getting a last hour of shopping in before our bus ride home. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and the price was great. The location was a huge plus too. Very convienent! We hope to visit the city again soon and will be booking our room here.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at this hotel several times but never again.”
Reviews.Author: my2centstodays
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times. The last time we booked this hotel, we had to cancel our trip which we did 3 days in advance which is more than enough time for cancellation without penalty. I was still charged for one night stay at the hotel, which the 1 800 reservation would not take responsiblity for and told me to contact the hotel. Front desk told me to speak to the manager Sunny. I was told by her that it was not her responsiblity. After spending over 20.00 in long distance calls, I was finally reimbursed 2 weeks later. I was put on a wild goose chase over many phone calls over several days. I don't want to be bothered with this kind of mess again should I ever need to book and cancel with them. The hotel itself is ok for Manhatten, considering that you are only there to sleep. Room is very tiny. Free breakfast was nothing to talk about but it saves you a few bucks in the something small and quick in the morning especially with young kids. One thing that happened which has nothing to do with the hotel was that there was a man in the elevator that seem to have followed a girl to her room. That was creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Dr._Bob_4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times over the last 2 years. The location is great, particularly for people who come in by train to nearby Penn Station, which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The practicality of coming in and out by train is enhanced by the fact that the hotel has complimentary luggage storage for guests. On my last trip I was running a bit late, but the person in charge of the baggage did a great job of getting my bags out for me in record time. Thanks! My reservations have always been honored at the rates quoted when I made the reservation. The check in has always gone off without a hitch and there have been no problems with check out or billing. There was a definite improvement in the high speed internet available in the room, it now being much faster then before. The fact that it is still free is an added advantage. I have noticed improvements in the breakfast. During my most recent stay, the usual La Quinta fare of bagels and cereal was supplemented by fresh pastries. The breakfast room was spotless and well cared for. While other hotels have more elaborate breakfasts, the price of this one, namely free, can't be beat. My room this time was a "queen" on the 10th floor. It was small but adequate for 1 person (or two compatible people) and was spotless. It was also quiet-no noise from the street of from adjacent rooms. The heater was a bit noisy when it came on but this did not bother me. The hallways were generally clean and well lit, although I did find a cigarette butt on the floor in the morning. The hotel has a great bar on the top floor with a view of the nearby New York skyline. For some reason there were no signs in the hotel about the bar and it was not mentioned in the material which I was given on check in-so don't be discouraged from trying it if you don't see any signs. The only recent downside to the hotel is that the prices have been going up-I paid close to $200 for a night when the NY taxes were added in. However, the hotel is still a reasonable value considering the alternatives in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Location, Very Nice Staff, Great King Rooms & good breakfest I would recomend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: desireehemingway
Reviews.Content: I love how there is no wait to check in the hotel, got right in. The queen beds are a lil small in room size, i like alot of space so i get the king bed and I love it! They have a roof top bar witch is very good place to hang out. The rooms are deffently clean no problems there. Shopping is one block away , everythngs close by, and the staff people are very friendly no attitudes like most! I would deffently recomend this hotel for people to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: KelliConnecticut
Reviews.Content: This La Quinta is perfect for people who don't plan to sit in their hotel room but rather explore the city and come back to a clean, well located hotel. The rooms are small but clean and you can't beat the location or the price. We were right next to the Empire State Building and only a short walk to Time Square. It is in a safe area so I felt comfortable running down to Central Park on 5th Avenue at sunrise by myself while my husband slept in. The breakfast is a nice bonus in a city that is so expensive. The only issue can be the lack of signage out front. You will probably walk right by the first or second time (as we did). I also asked about late checkout and was given information on the hourly charge. This surprised me because most hotels will extend checkout an hour or two at no cost especially when you are a loyality club member.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced Hotel in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: rockyjoe
Reviews.Content: Decent, reasonably priced hotel near the Empire State Building, The room and bathroom were small but I only needed it for one night. I paid $220 Total (including all taxes) which is good for this part of the city. Pretty good breakfast buffet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Pigglet3
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small but clean and continental breakfast is included in rate. Easy access to local tours and within walking distance to Empire State Building and about a 15 mins walk to Times Square and 30 min. walk to Central Park. Taxi ride from La Guardia to Hotel about 30 mins and $35.00 USD. To Pier to embark ship about 15 mins and $20.00 USD.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nanw824
Reviews.Content: Check in and out very accomodating. The continental breakfast is good, hotel is clean and housekeeping is excellent. Great location for getting around in New York City. Very centrally located. I would stay there again. The rates are very good and the only negative is, room rates are quoted per person and my preference is, rates be quoted for the room only and not per person. All in all, I would recommend the La Quinta Manhattan. Nancy W, Houston, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Cashmeredog
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The guest rooms were a bit small, but I found the hotel to be charming. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel was clean and the mattress was very comfortable. I had a great nights sleep, and the continental breakfast was a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Eripsni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business - had meetings all over Manhattan. Convenient location for both taking the subway (easiest mode of travel in Manhattan) and catching a taxi. Front desk was helpful and even let me check in early (as a room was available). Breakfast was pretty standard, but it did the trick. People need to get over the slow elevators - maybe you can get a little exercise and take the stairs! Otherwise, I only had to wait a minute or two at most. Room was clean and enough space for myself and my luggage. Wireless was a bit spotty, but who sits in their hotel room while in New York? It worked - it was just a little slower than I am accustomed to. No signs of bed bugs (I've had them before, so I check every hotel room I enter). The mattress was EXTRAORDINARY (of the memory foam type). Add to that the surprising quietness and blackout curtains and you'll sleep like a baby. On a side note, if you don't like being on a street full of Korean shops, this isn't for you. However, you're a block away from a ton of other options, so don't let it stop you. The people on the street are friendly enough and are willing to give you suggestions for locations to eat, get supplies, etc. All in all, a great place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good for quick trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: JuneBaby78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my parents- we got one room and there was plenty of space for all of us and all our luggage! We were in NYC for 3 days and this hotel suited us fine as we only needed the room. It is definitely no frills - breakfast is a help yourself affair, a bit like a very small cafeteria. It is very basic which is fine, but when you are joined by various homeless people looking for a free breakfast who get in when the bell hop guy isn't looking, it does make you wonder about the secuirty of the place. The room itself was clean and we didn't hear anything from any other rooms. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was all in working order. And the location is excellent. So all in all, not bad at all for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for first time in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix52
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9/25-9/28 on an East Coast trip. First time for four of us in New York Ciity. We looked for something affordable our standards vs New York standards. The room was small as we expected it to be. No frills. Major job getting all the luggage to fit and us to be able to walk around. It was clean and we met the maid who was friendly. Had a view of the office building next store. They really need to clean out their storerooms. The doorman was friendly and helpful. We had a car. Only tourists have a car. Small unloading area in front. The area is Korean with food to match. A member of our party will not eat exotic food. As someone else has said, the staff could not recommend a restaurant, but I found several on the next block. Burger King, McDonalds, Wendy's, Starbucks and a restaurant I cannot remember the name. In the other direction there is a KFC and Roy Rogers. There is also a CVS pharmacy and Walgreens in the next block in the Empire State Building. We found New Yorkers are very tight with their information. The hotel is close to the Empire State building. We went up to the small bar on the roof to see it. The free breakfast is mainly bread, donuts toast, cereal and Waffles. Very small and crowded. The elevator is small and always crowded. Went sight seeing on the double decker bus and saw a show. Took taxis.. The E ticket ride. . New York City was a real culture shock. I don't know how people live in constant traffic and crowded streets at all hours. The hotel was good for tourists looking for a cheaper place to stay. We survived our first trip. I felt fairly safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ccessex
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was shocked about the hotel prices (altough being used to London standards) when looking for a hotel in Manhattan and booked the La Quinta based on location and price. Even though the hotel and the rooms are slightly dated the hotel is excellent value for money: the location is right in the middle (metro just a 2min walk away), the room and bathroom was tidy and clean and the breakfast a good start into the day. Pick up from JFK was $17 pp and you are there within about 20mins. I enjoyed staying in the La Quinta in and can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, best value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_flyer1989
Reviews.Content: After checking out of our dodgy upper west side hotel, my partner and I walked the streets of Nyc to find a decent and reasonably priced hotel. We stumbled across la quinta! Great price for the holiday season and amazingly located, it's all we could have asked for our first time in Nyc. Down the road from Madison square garden, round the corner from 5th ave and the empire state building and walking distance to macy's and times square. The room it self was very comfortable and was cleaned throughly by the same girl everyday. The staff were exteremely friendly and we didn't have any issues throughout the entire 11 day stay. Free internet and a roof top bar to relax and have a drink with views of the empire state building and not to mention a 24 hr street (korea lane) all the restaurants stay open throughout the night for when you get the midnight muchies. I would stay at this hotel every time I go back to Nyc and I would (and have) recommended it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: WeAreScientists
Reviews.Content: We arrived in New York at the end of September and took a yellow cab to La Quinta. We were greeted by a very friendly and helpful concierge who took our bags in for us. Check-in was quick and simple. The room was clean(ish) and tidy and had all the mod cons we required (tv, hairdryer, ipod dock, kettle and safe). The carpets looked like they hadn't been cleaned in a long time but apart from that the room appeared clean and well looked after. The breakfast supplied in the hotel was superb - the best I've experienced. You can have anything from bagels and iced donuts to yoghurts and fresh fruit. All in plentiful supply. The location of the hotel was one of the key selling points and didn't disappoint, it is excellently located one block across from the Empire State building in Manhattan. Another nice surprise in the hotel was the rooftop bar, upon which you sit in the shadow of the Empire State building. Incredible. There is a chilled out atmosphere in the bar and you are supplied with popcorn which is a nice extra touch. If I'm ever lucky enough to return to New York I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Used syringe found in the bathroom and General Manager blamed us”
Reviews.Author: travelnowgirlie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 other friends and the only thing that let this hotel down was when we came home one night we found a used syringe on our bathroom floor. I immediately went down to front reception to tell them and they came up to remove the syringe and told me to come back in the morning to speak with their general manager. When I did I was completely shocked with the way he handled the matter. He said it was highly unusual and had never happened in his 5 years at the hotel. He then proceeded to drag the cleaner into the room so we could question her to see what her reaction was to see if she was telling the truth. This in itself was very unprofessional. He basically said he could not believe it was one of his staff so when we questioned how else it could have happened his response was "well why dont you tell me". I lost all respect at this point as he was inferring that we were drug users or had planted the syringe ourselves. What sort of General Manager stands there blaming the guests of the hotel when we were clearly upset by what we had found. He then had the nerve to say "if your toilet was broken, we would fix it and in this case the syringe was removed so tell me what else would you like me to do". We responded by saying that "an apology might be nice"!! He said he had apologised to which I pointed out that his reaction to the whole situation was to tell us that it was highly unusual and had never happened before and then proceeded to blame us. He responded by saying "well I am sorry then"....a little late for that after his handeling of the situation!! The General Manager (Victor) was the rudest person I have ever dealt with and put a damper on the whole experience. How he made it to that level of management with the attitude he showed us is beyond me!! I would not recommend staying here if this is the way they treat their guests!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: byebye3
Reviews.Content: We find it okay the road in front is one lane. No where to park ur car to unload if a car is in the small place they have for unloading. The room was a joke room they called it?????????? Try a walk in closet the bathroom was bigger. I know this is NYC BUT COME ON; the room was clean that because u had no room to walk to get it dirty. Well we did find a hair on the shower wall that was not ours. The next day we did NYC when we came back they said we checked out so our key was cleared so we could not get in our room. The lady @ the front desk not nice @ all. The next day we got stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes nice right! The breakfast is set up but they lock the door so u can not get in. Can u say tease u! The view from ur window that is a brick wall is very nice. It is close to some of the subways and Macy's is up one block. Locations is good so many other nicer place in this price range please find a better place to spend ur savings as u know nyc hotels will cost u a ton of cash.....

Reviews.Title: “USED NEEDLE FOUND IN OUR ROOM!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IndiaWells
Reviews.Content: Used needle in our bathroom!!! I stayed here with friends according to good reviews on certain websites. Our first 2 nights here were fine, sure the rooms were a little tight for 4 people, location was great! BUT on our 3rd night, we came into our hotel room after it had been cleaned to find a "used needle' beside our toilet. We called reception for them to come up and collect it (which they did) but asked to be told the next day what a used needle was doing in our hotel room! The next morning we had to go down to management to approach 'them' about the situation. The arrogant man who was 'management' told us to come down to his office and discuss it further. After we explained what had happened, he told us he was bringing down the cleaner who was responsible for cleaning our room that night and interrogate her! as "we will be able to know ourselves if she is telling the truth or lying"...what are we, behavioural analysists!?!? We told him that we felt VERY uncomfortable with this and thought this should be his job as 'MANAGER"! After the cleaner came down and was embarassed infornt of us all, he said he could not believe that a memeber of his 'staff' could be responsible for this and "what would you like from this", we asked for an apology and he said "it's like any problem in the hotel...if you had a blocked toilet, we would come up and unblock it, problem solved".....excuse me, but this is a NEEDLE! What if someone had children and they stepped on it! To which he replied "oh come on, it had a cap on it!". Doesn't matter!!!! The way he dealt with this was APPALLING! He should be fired, as there was no apology, he was arrogant, defensive and down right rude! Even insinuating that we were drug users!!!! I have never been more offended in my life and have NEVER been spoken or treated like this by a MANAGER in a hotel!!! From this situation, i would recommend NONE stay at this hotel and we are going further to report this to 'head' of management of this chain of hotels as we cannot believe they would be happy with this response! I have photo evidence and will be happy to show this for future reference. Will let everyone know what is the outcome. VERY DISGUSTED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: BeckyinBend
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel in the middle of the Korean district but just two blocks from Penn Station. It was very clean and the staff were very freindly. I would definately stay here again. The rooftop bar if you look up you can see the Empire State Bldg. I was so glad to find this hotel and the price was right for a Sat night in NYC. They had free internet with 3 computers and a light breakfast. Our room was very small (one queen bed) but we were only there to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Me and my friend checked in . The front...”
Reviews.Author: Alex1177
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend checked in . The front desk agents were great . Knowlegable . Room was small we found condum in the bed . So we changed room again we were not happy with it . This is not acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Last minute choice but worth it”
Reviews.Author: cebelicamm
Reviews.Content: We could not decide which hotel to book out of all in Manhatan. We were searching for good location, good value for money, breakfast, good reviews.... La Quinta was on our list but the price was a little to high (4nights 1100usd for 2). The last evening before departure, desperate for a good deal the price droped to 750tax included+complimentary breakfast-worth the wait. The hotel is easy to find, short walk from Penn station. The staff was so kind and helpfull. The room was clean and spacious. WOULD STAY THERE AGAIN!( If so would ask for a street view room, our was to dark,view on the naibor building)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome value - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Biljak2
Reviews.Content: In looking for a hotel in Manhattan over the labour day long weekend, I was blown away by the prices - ideally I wanted to save money on a hotel so that I could spend the extra on food & clothing! Then La Quinta came up - and it was much cheaper than any other hotel so I booked it - location looked good and it got good reviews on trip advisor. When we got there, I gave myself a pat on the back for booking it. It's in Korea town and when I looked at the street on Google Streetview it looked a little dodgy, but it's really not - you are literally a 30 second walk to the subway & a 10 second walk to Pinkberry and Jamba Juice. The rooms are pretty small & basic, but it's Manhattan so anyone paying less than $200 a night should not expect much more. But it was very clean, nice flat screen tv, comfy bed & quiet (our room was anyways). If you're driving to the city, parking is $30 a day, that is pretty good comparably. I would definitely stay here again if I had to travel to NYC during a peak time when hotels are atrociously expensive - in the off season I would probably stay in a higher star hotel for some added luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic great value find ...for New York!”
Reviews.Author: Joansholidays
Reviews.Content: Perfect simple hotel that really grows on you. Searched fro a cheap hotel didn't think I would get such a great location. Stayed in Room 1104, drew back the curtains and there was the Empire State building! Really centrally located. Ten blocks to Times square, two blocks to Maceys and the Empire State. Rooms a bit dark but provides all the necessities and more! Glad to say didn't find time to use the iron!! Breakfast buffet great - healthy options,saved lots including calories on those addictive American breakfasts! Look beyond the tired decor and you will have a ball....don't forget those walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Beware to stay there, do not recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: EGVSA2010
Reviews.Content: First of all, would like to mention that booking department charged my credit card twice! And it took about a month to make refund... Second: the Standard room is very very small, you barely can locate your suitcase there. The room was dark with tiny window in the corner of the room with no view at all, but all possible sounds from the street you can hear very well... The bathroom was okay, with window, BUT, there was terrible sound every night in the shower, so I couldnt even sleep at night. I had to buy ear-plugs, cos it was the only way to get some rest in the room. Plus you could hear any sound from the corridor. All impression of the room was: small, dirty with ants on the floor. By saying "dirty" I mean that it didnt look fresh at all, furniture, bed sheets - all that was literally not clean. Breakfast was okay: some toasts, jam, yougurs, fruits and its complimentary. Location is good: its 15-20 min walk from Broadway, and 30 min from Fifth Avenue and other nice places.

Reviews.Title: “Will never risk booking here again!”
Reviews.Author: nara1987
Reviews.Content: We booked a room with our credit card on-line from Athens, Greece. We were flying to Montreal, Canada for a wedding and wanted to visit New York for a few days. Our confirmation came with a reservation number and we printed it and took it along. On our drive down from Montreal I called the hotel and spoke with reservations to confirm our booking again and to let them know we will be about an hour late. I called them once more for directions. We finally arrived at about 5 pm and they told me at the desk that my credit card was not accepted. Apparently I was supposed to let the Greek bank know I was travelling. Anyhow, I told them we would pay cash. They told me they gave my room to someone else. I was furious because they did not tell me this on the phone. They told me they could give me a room at the going rate which was double the price I had booked it for. Why did they give my room before trying my card upon arrival. They told me one lie after another. I was furious and took my family out after some loud exchanges, only to find my car tire slashed as it was parked right outside their hotel entrance. We parked across the street in the parking and went down the street to Radisson Hotel instead. The tactics they used to get us to stay for double the price was unacceptable. I will never book on-line again with easy-to-book or stay at the Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but small. Great location for subway and Time Square”
Reviews.Author: wrightdallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here August 18-22. The hotel is nice but small. The room was clean but small bathroom was very clean. The house keeper was a really nice lady. Great location if you want to b close to subway, time square,etc. One problem I had was the clerk I believe made a mistake when he checked me in. Checked me in for 1 night only and when we got back to our room our key wouldn't work. Checked my reservation online and it clearly shows 4 nights. But of course they pretended like they knew everything. So please check your receipt, which I did not do. They call the area I believe Little Korea. So, If you find yourself not able to b around a different type of people then this wouldn't b the area for u. I would recommend this hotel but keep n mind it's very small and oh yea, I forgot to tell u the elevators r very slow and the breakfast was ok. Only Korean resturaunts at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, especially for the price! Wonderful location, very clean!”
Reviews.Author: CouponClasses
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised at the LaQuinta Manhattan. Started off great ~ we arrived early and were happy to be able to check in right away! Staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but that is very typical for NYC. The bathroom was very clean and actually a nice size, complete with tub & shower!! Breakfast each morning had a wide variety of the standard continental style breakfast items, including delicious, fresh, donuts!! :-)) The location of this hotel is great! We were very close to the subway, Broadway, Macy's Herald Square, & lots of other shopping. Easy walking distance to Times Square and the Garment District. We would ABSOLUTELY stay here again and have already told friends about using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: kinshasa
Reviews.Content: I needed two queen beds for a 23 year old son and myself, and many hotel rooms have only one bed. Not only did La Quinta have what I needed, they honored the request. I have checked into hotels before only to be told there were no double bed rooms available. AAA discount was just under $200 a night, a steal in my opinion. Extensive breakfast with bagels, cream cheese, cereal, juice, and some fruit. Free internet and excellent room A/C. The elevators and hallways however were NOT air conditioned. There are only two elevators and they are slow. Get a room on a high floor if you want to catch the elevator down. Food & Transportation: Two yogurt shops right next to the hotel, a plus! (Red Mango & Pinkberry). Great vegetarian Korean restaurant about a block down on 32nd St. (Hangawi). Also there are several drug stores within walking distance and fast food places if you go for that sort of thing. Just steps from several subway lines, and more lines are nearby. I recommend buying a laminated subway map at Duane Reade. The front desk staff was friendly and efficient. Depending on the location of the room, it can be a bit noisy at night. Koreatown is swinging. Despite a few quibbles, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain and Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: fauroki
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, great price but also the room was very clean and nice. Bed was very comfortable and staff was friendly. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nflder2
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week long stay. Couldn't ask for a better location! Just around the corner from 34th street shopping and the Empire State Building (visible from our window). Within walking distance of Times Square and Grand Central Station and just steps to the subway line. Roof top bar was a great way to wind down after a long day on our feet. Hotel is surrounded by great restaurants, sushi/Japanese, which were packed every night. Great breakfast that's included with the room. Felt very safe in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and $$”
Reviews.Author: annette1015
Reviews.Content: just spent two days at this hotel with my daughter. We wanted a central location in order to shop for clothes. The hotel was clean and check-in and out were quick and painless! There is a free breakfast and they hold your luggage after check-out if you like. Free Internet. Close to subways and a quick walk to Time Square.

Reviews.Title: “Our first trip to New York”
Reviews.Author: gosavi
Reviews.Content: After researching online for several days, I came across this hotel. Our requirements were 2-beds, in a location that was close to all the major areas of NY for under $250. We were only staying for a night, so we really only needed a place to lay our heads. This was our first trip to NY, so I wasn't sure what to expect. The reviews at Tripadvisor and Yelp were really helpful, so I felt like I should contribute as well...thanks to all! First off, let me address the other reviews that complained about the "stink"...EVERY block in downtown NY stinks. It has nothing to do with this location being K-Town. There are strange smells emanating from every subway vent, alley and vagrant in all of downtown Manhattan...K-Town is no different. These people probably never even set foot in the subway. If you're worried about the smell, don't visit NY. The stench you find in the countryside when the farmers are spreading manure is waaaay more horrible and it's a constant barrage on your nose for weeks. LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION...The location itself - very convenient. There is a subway station right on the block. You're within walking distance of several attractions and anywhere else, you can take the subway. There is a parking garage on the same block that La Quinta validates for...$26 per day. Pro Tip: If you're a newbie to NY subways like us, take along a NY map that includes the subway and educate yourself. It's a bit complex, but once you figured it out, you can take the subway anywhere and get there in no time. K-Town, where the hotel is located was safe enough for us. Most of the people that frequent this area are college age Korean kids and are much more well behaved than anything I've seen in any college town. There are police EVERYWHERE here, so atleast you can have some comfort in that. NY is still, NY, so take the proper precautions. The rooms are clean. I've stayed in some nicer hotels (business related travel) and I'd rate the rooms up there with them. We had a 2 Queen room and it's HUGE compared to the King room that my brother stayed in. The price is the same, so if you want a little more space, get a 2 Queen room. The beds were really comfy...with "memory foam" mattresses. I really want one of these beds now that I've actually slept in one. I mentioned that the area was "safe", but we did have some strange activity in the hotel. There were several undercover cops (supposedly) searching the hotel for someone. We have no idea why. An officer knocked on my brother's door (which was open) and told him to keep it closed. Also, in the afternoon I smelled something nasty coming from the stairwells...I thought maybe someone went to the bathroom and the smell was coming out of their room. However, later on that night my brother and I walked up to the 14th to go to the bar and we find a HUGE pile of feces at the top of the steps on the 11th or 12th floor. It was pretty disturbing...even more disturbing is that it had been there for several hours. Either no one reported or no one bothered to clean it up. Ok ok, I didn't report it either, but it was late and I wanted to check out the bar scene...and mind you, this pile of crap had been laying there since sometime in the afternoon and it was after 10p when we discovered it. Someone HAD to have reported it by then...especially the people who stayed near that stairwell (I smelled it from 2 floors down!) and if not why isn't their any hotel personnel checking the hallways? For some people, this is all it would take to get a horrible score, but I'm pretty laid back so, it was only a minor blemish. It made for a good story to tell my friends when we got home though. The 14th floor bar is both a pro and a con. It's a nice little rooftop bar that has a cool view of the Empire state building (pro). It's a pretty popular place, but what struck me as strange is that I was expecting a bunch of koreans here and instead, I felt like I was in an Irish pub at State College. However, since it's so popular, you get a crap load of traffic coming in and out of the hotel. Which means that the elevators...small and slow moving elevators...are always packed (con)...reviews about the elevators are spot on. Also, like I said earlier, there doesn't appear to be any security in the building, so someone gets plastered and decides to poop on the floor, it'll probably go unchecked (con). I never felt that I was ever in any danger, but just be wary. The front desk clerks were pretty indifferent. They answered my questions that I had and reactivated room a key that went dead. So they did their job. If you're coming here expecting them to be bubbly and giddy to see you, you're not going to get that. This is true for most of NYC in general...people just aren't as friendly as they are in say, Lancaster, PA. Which is fine by me. By the way, the one asian (korean?) girl that works in the little shop there is a cutey! At about $250 (after taxes), you're not going to get much better than this hotel in Manhattan. It's still expensive...but comparable to staying in any major city or beach hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Rachel85_10
Reviews.Content: Your day starts with B,fast.On the website they have boiled eggs,cappaccino,hot cereal.pastries,waffle-Nothing of this kind was there.B,fast attendant with a headgear & Big smile did help to keep my cool.I came back after B,fast hours but was still allowed a cup of coffee and a banana. Frontdesk was apologitic towards B,fast without a smile.I will comeback to this hotel again because my business trip was successful

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: ShinBoy
Reviews.Content: The title says it all, this hotel is located slap bang in the middle of manhattan, literally in the shadow of the Empire State building. By New York standards this hotel is great value for money. The rooms are a good size and have the standard facilities and also free WiFi. The business centre in the basement is great for checking in online and printing boarding passes, there is also a tourist office in the hotel to help plan your stay. The rowdy rooftop bar is another great feature though can be quite busy and noisy. The only downside to this great hotel is the breakfast which is very basic but you kind of expect that at this price, the real problem is the lack of organisation and seating which means it can be a bit of a scrum. Your best best is to quickly grab something before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect area, price point and nice people behind the scenes”
Reviews.Author: bjrWisconsin
Reviews.Content: Travel dates May 21, 2010 for 5 nites. I am a La Quinta Inn follower. I am a member of their hotel program. I go to New York city often and now that I found the La Quinta, just one more nice thing to look forward to. Located in Korea Town (K-town) very close to subway; Macy's literally right there and 34th street retail and Madison Square Garden. Many diverse establishments including grocery, cafes very close with the Empire State Building down the street. The rooms were very nice; I paid 150.00 + taxes of course --per night. Clean rooms, nice bathroom. Nice lobby with FREE continental-type breakfast. Love this. There is a bar/restaurant on the roof-top. Nice touch and views of (Empire state building and more). La Quinta offers room types including AARP, AAA, Military; helps with the price. LOVE THIS PLACE AND WILL RETURN. B Roberts

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience-First time to New York”
Reviews.Author: CasaBlanca1029
Reviews.Content: Earlier this month I traveled to New York for the very first time. We were very fortunate to have stayed at the La Quinta in Manhattan. The La Quinta is located on 32nd street in Korea town and is around the corner from the Empire State Building. The location was perfect......It was an easy walk to Time Square and very close to Macy's. Minutes from Penn Staion and Madison Square Garden. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast that was perfect for me. However, if you are looking for a hot breakfast, you may want to eat at one of the many nearby restaurants. We stayed on the 11th floor in a very nice room that was clean and charming. We had the pleasure of sleeping on a temperpedic bed, and I got probably the best sleep ever in my life. The rooms are not large, but as a friend who lives in New York said to me, they are the same square footage of a typical New York studio! The staff was very pleasant and check in was quick and easy! I would definately recommend this hotel to any first time visitors, and I will absolutely stay here again in the future! Thank You La Quinta Staff!!!!! Cecilia White

Reviews.Title: “Location and price was great”
Reviews.Author: hellokittyPlymouth
Reviews.Content: we arrived in New York at Penn station and the hotel was located just straight down the road, only took us about 4 mins to walk, there is a lovely park seating area on the corner of Broadway called Greeley Square park which was just a few steps from the hotel. We were a family of four ladies from 81 yrs to 17yrs and shared a 2 queen room, the room was very large, clean and best of all had a ironing board and iron in it ! The breakfast in the morning was great but do get there early to get a seat, we had a choice of cereal, fruit, bagels, doughnuts, muffins and toast, in the fridge was cream cheese and yogurt , drinks were tea coffee and juice. As this was included in the price of the room ( a bonus in New York) we were very happy with the "continental breakfast " advertised. It was a lovely stroll down Broadway to Times Square to see a Broadway show and walking back at night we felt perfectly safe, the area is known as little Korea and they have strung lights over the street the hotel is in, which we thought was lovely.When we came to check out the hotel has a bag check room which was ideal as we had a late flight and it was nice to know that the bags were safe while we did even more sightseeing and shopping !! We all agreed that the hotel even though very busy was quiet (at least on our floor ) and the staff were helpful, we would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, clean friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: conphila
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very clean Had everything you could possible want Best value for the money, right around the corner from the Empire State Building

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we were in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Life_in_motion1978
Reviews.Content: My husband was travelling a lot with his job so he fortunately accrued a lot of free hotel nights. We were able to use these nights on the La Quinta Manhattan location. We stayed for 4 nights and would have left that first night if it wasn't free. The room size was about the same size as our hotel in Rome. Also like our hotel in Rome, the entire staff was hard to understand. The hotel is located on Korean Way and it smelt 100% like it. Nothing like the smell of trash in the evenings. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless you also have hotel points.

Reviews.Title: “Service of the Agent at the desk is not acceptable”
Reviews.Author: james11298564
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my colleagues in July for few days . we checked in , Later we came back to the hotel room we found our hotel room open and a person in the room . i told him this is our room . He said its ok he is the General Manager of the hotel . I told him what is he doing here he said its routine check and he left . Later when we were checking out . I saw extra charge of 75 extra per manager for extra persons , i confronted the agent he said he cannot do it is per manager . Wanted to speak to him He is not calling back , Then he came he said there were more people in the room i told that my friend came to visit and left . I just want to know why will a GM go to my room to check number of people so he does not deserve to be a GM he should work as a security guard . DONT STAY AT THIS CHEAP MOTEL OR YOU WILL LOOSE YOUR MONEY , LUGGAGE ETC

Reviews.Title: “great location (the only real value of this hotel)”
Reviews.Author: DasaCzech
Reviews.Content: Great location, just one block from Empire State Building. In any other location than in the middle of Manhattan this hotel would be heavily overprised. Poor breakfast, hotel room is extremely small, you need to wait ages for warm water in the shower

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Claytonandrew
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights [July 5 - July10 ]. The location is excellent as we walked from Penn Station to hotel .We checked into room 818 which had a king bed as we requested.The room was very clean and we had enough space to move around with two suitcases in the room.Within 20 mintues after check in front desk called to see if my room was okay and if I needed anything [WHAT SERVICE].Only tried breakfast one time because my husband is a bacon and egg person .The breakfast was loaded with sweets , juice, coffee,yougut, apples and bananas [not fit for a diabetic] .The rooftop bar was nice to relax at after a long day or shopping or sightseeing. We did not have a problem with the elevator as all of them are slow at certain times [checkout, breakfast etc.] Saturday morning we awaken to no hot water for showers., call front desk and was informed that the boiler had shut down and they had to call an outside company to repair it. ---------------- 40 mintues later front desk called my room and ask me to check water because it had been repaired. SERVICE-----------SERVICE----------SERVICE .Planning to stay there again in a couple of months.

Reviews.Title: “It's NYC, What do you want for $180? The Plaza?”
Reviews.Author: Zank0529
Reviews.Content: After reading the "bad" reviews, I am convinced that the people who wrote them would be unhappy with anything less than staying at the Plaza Hotel for $180 a night and have unrealistic expectations. 1. Are the rooms small? Yes, but for the price, this IS what you get in NYC. It was enough room for the three of us (Me, Wife, 7yo Daughter). If you want more room for less money, plan a trip trip to Clarion Pennsylvania instead! 2. Was it noisy? No, not at all. We were on the 5th floor facing 32nd St when Korea (FYI 32nd is "Korea Town") won a game in the world cup. People were dancing in the street and we had to open the window to listen. We also had neighbors on either side of us and did not hear them once. This hotel was built in 1902, back when they build things to last. 3. Is the Staff friendly? YES! I can only imagine that the people that wrote about the staff being rude, got what they gave. Also sounds like a few have a problem with ethnic diversity. Again, Clarion Pennsylvania may be a better place to visits for these people. 4. Is it a good location? YES! Even the nay-sayers seem to agree on this. We were in the middle off everything. One block from the Subway (A-C-E), walking distance (If you like to walk) to Times Square. Wonderful Korean BBQ right next door. Perfectly safe. I highly recommend this place for small families 3-4 and plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: zombiepunk
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Vacation in New York City where we stayed at this La Quinta location. It's in Korean area, which was quite fascinating culturally and was within walking distance of Herald Square and the subway. Though the smell of the neighborhood sewer was disgusting. Has a great view of the Empire State bldg. from their rooftop bar (warning: open to the public so it get quite crowded in the early evening with young NYC professionals). The beds were impossibly soft, I sunk into them. The rooms were fairly small and crowded. The A/C unit was right next to my bed, and when I closed the curtains, they blew right over my bed. Fairly annoying to have this mass floating over you. The elevators are slooooow and can get quite warm inside. Our connecting flight in Chicago to NYC was canceled due to severe weather, and the management staff in NYC would not refund or compensate our room for that one night that we had no way of getting there. They did not even offer to find us a room in Chicago, even though we had already paid the hotel chain for that night. They were satisfied to have us sleep in the Airport. La Quinta has lost my business.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MrsWard66
Reviews.Content: Great Location. Good Value- Great Beds! Parking for $30 night The only disappintment was the breakfast. The website lets you believe it is an extended breakfast. It is notl. Coffee Cereal Bagles Donuts. ...but again great location and value for the rate. Rooms are a good size. I'm sure you must get a great view of the Empire state building from the roof top bar....but never found out...The bar was always too busy to get in and get a drink and take a look!....next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Room”
Reviews.Author: Travel4Less
Reviews.Content: Staying at a hotel in New York is always an adventure and even more so when you are trying to do it without breaking the bank. The La Quinta Inn in Manhattan was both an adventure and a huge bargain for the city at the same time. For convenience the hotel is hard to beat as it sits right in the heart of Koreatown and is only 3 blocks away from Penn Station and 1 block from the Empire State building. The staff was friendly enough but not very helpful. I originally booked a room on the hotel web site Applecore and received a rate of $179 per night which isn't bad for NYC. However when I checked the LQ.com site at the behest of my wife the same room was available for $129 which is a screaming buy in my opinion. I was very disappointed to learn though that the only rooms available were smoking rooms (I didn't know those still existed) and that the only thing the hotel could do was spray it. The spray lasted about 30 minutes then it smelled like smoke again. My wife bought a can of Febreeze which she used liberally in an effort t fend off the stink. Despite knowing that I wanted a non-smoking room the hotel did nothing to help find a non-smoking room the next day. By New York standards the room was small and even though there was free wi-fi there was no desk or table to work from so I used my lap or went to the lobby to find more space. Despite the flaws I would stay here again based on location and price but if you find a similarly priced hotel in Manhattan, take it and avoid this one. I know I will.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean, but noisy "neighbors"”
Reviews.Author: SusanP2010
Reviews.Content: the positives - room was clean; convenient to subway and all transportation; very helpful and friendly staff; breakfast was decent; a safe in room large enough for a laptop; great, free wi-fi; overall, worth the money the negatives - room was tight - no space to put luggage; we were right above the front entrance and it was loud all night long, possibly from restaurants next door (we had to put on bathroom fan to drown out noise) ; if you need a firm mattress, not for you

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was clean, not too costly considering convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: wel46come
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very conveniently located to subways and walking distance to Penn Station, close to Macy's and Madison Square Gardens. We did not use room service, but had quick response to problem with phone. Room was large enough for 2 queen beds with not too much space around beds, but we did not spend much time in room. The beds had Tempurapedic mattresses and were very comfortable. There was an iron and ironing board in room. Housekeeping service was excellent, and our housekeeper was very friendly. We visited the rooftop bar once, used the business center, but not the limited exercise room. The hotel checked our baggage free after we checked out until it was time to go to the airport. The free breakfast had limited choices of food and the most disappointing thing was that the donuts were soggy, as if they had been frozen and then defrosted.

Reviews.Title: “Supremely located hotel with fantastically helpful staff in epicentre of NYC”
Reviews.Author: gez95
Reviews.Content: Given that no hotel in manhattan is "great" value for money, the La Quinta I stayed in last month won me over through it's amazing location [200 meters from Penn Station and almost in the empire State building] - and more so for the reasonable and helpful attitude of the manager and staff. Booking was easy through the reservations desk and when I was delayed because of the Volcanic ash cloud in Europe, they were completely sympathetic and helpful to re-schedule a booking at no loss. I was surprised that for such a busy hotel which attracts I think hundreds of guests a week, the room was spacious and with no noise disturbance. It is not the most flamboyant hotel in terms of decor but it was a real pleasure to stay there adn I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal. Lots of bang for your buck.”
Reviews.Author: vwlangley
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location; very accessable to subways and buses. It is clean, comfortable, and extremely friendly. The staff went out of their way to assist me in what I needed and I never felt like I was being imposing. The complimentary breakfast was good and convenient. The bedding was great. Very updated and pretty for NYC standards especially in this price range. A great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For The Location”
Reviews.Author: NealnDC
Reviews.Content: The property was clean, safe & orderly, there is awesome bar on the top floor. Great for a couple get away or a single person visiting the city. The rooms are small but functional but the bathrooms are TOO DAMN SMALL. If you are a average size person or larger you may have problems with the toilet and how its situated. Kinda awkard!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were pleased with the cleanliness and location of the LaQuinta Hotel”
Reviews.Author: epopeAlexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: I chose the La Quinta solely for monetary reasons. The staff was helpful. Our room was small but very clean. One issue with the bathroom. There is a wall phone where the light switch should be. Very annoying to knock it off the wall in the middle of the night. Th high speed internet worked best in the lobby. The continental breakfast is very basic: cereal, pastries, bagels. There were apples and bananas one morning. Luckily, we thought to grab a couple for later in the morning when we knew we would be hungry again. The location was very convenient. It was 2 blocks to Penn Station Subway. Taxi's were very easy to get at the corner. The Empire State Bldg and Macy's are close by also. We definately would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “greatest hotel for central manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: southam97
Reviews.Content: perfect location less than 3 blocks from penn station & madison sq garden- easy access to theater, diamond district , great rstaurants, ANYWHERE in manhattan! staff was accomodating and pleasant; all necessary amenities for a long wknd in midtown manhattan. rooms were very clean, comfortable beds, and QUIET!!!!!I in the heart of manhattan. nice rooftop bar , too.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean room and great location”
Reviews.Author: EKat7
Reviews.Content: Although the room with a king-sized bed was small, it was well appointed with a dresser, desk, and closet. The bathroom was an adequate size. Our room was on the second floor overlooking 32nd St. with a large window. Even though we had a great view to the street below, it was surprising quiet. Free breakfast is always a perk in New York. The front desk staff was extremely helpful and courteous, although use caution if asking the doorman to arrange for a cab. (We did so in order to get to the airport, and instead of a Yellow Taxi, he directed to us to an unmarked car. When asked the driver quoted a rate much higher than either a Yellow Taxi or shuttle fare.) The rooftop bar on this hotel is a nice, laid-back place to relax in the evening. You couldn't ask for a better view of the Empire State Building.We also enjoyed the central midtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Great locations, Nice rooms but very dessapointed about the rate.”
Reviews.Author: GIORGINA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great location, just a few blocks from time square and a few meters from the subway. good rooms , nice beds. and free wifi!!
