The only thing we were very dessapointed was that we book 4 nights from sunday night till thursday, every night the same rate but the last night the rate just as nothing came up 110 usd ..just becouse the hotel had only 2 rooms left for that reason they prices the rest rooms higher..just not fear..I'm a hotel owner my self if i do that to my customers they kill me!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PTMill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here end of April, first of May. Hotel was convenient to Midtown, about 4 blocks from Penn Station. Convenience store just a few steps from the front door. Room was clean, very comfortable king bed and was fine for what we needed it for - sleep, shower and change clothes. It was small, but I think anything in Manhattan is going to be small. There was no hot water one morning, which was a pain as it put us behind on our schedule, but it was taken care of fairly quickly. Would have been nice if the front desk had gotten back to us to let us know how restoration of hot water was going. Breakfast was fine for what we needed - fruit, bagels, donuts, juice, coffee, yogurt, cereal - nothing hot. Would have liked to have checked out the rooftop bar, but didn't get around to it. Woman at checkout was somewhat rude when I asked about the different rates for Saturday and Sunday ("It was on your confirmation.") However, I'd stay there again and would recommend to anyone who wanted a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: azrin74
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel for the price we paid for. Clean room, comfortable bed, nice breakfast, free internet. I don;t think you can find any other hotel which can match their pricing with the quality they offer. Not forgetting great location, just a few blocks from the Empire State Bldg. Will return to this hotel if coming again to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful surprise”
Reviews.Author: tchtalk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my 70th birthday with a wonderful trip to Manhattan. Usually, we're priced into staying in the suburbs and miss the evening activities of the city. This hotel will now make staying in the city affordable. I have been telling all of our friends about our great find-from the excellent, convenient location to the surprising large size of our room, to the comfort of a great mattress and feather pillows, to the graciousness and helffullness of the staff to the greatest surprise of a rooftop inside/outside bar with an outstanding view of the city at night-it was the best. We have nothing but praise for this hotel-the affordability is simply a plus. You are compromising nothing and simply adding to your New York experience by staying at this hotel. I can promise that this will be our hotel of choice from now on. Marilyn and Charles Charkin, S. Burlington, Vermont 05403 tchtalk@comcast.net

Reviews.Title: “The best bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: discodollydiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The bed was so comfortable-tempurpedic with down pillows. The actual room size was very small but hey, its NY! The location is within 2 minutes walk from the empire state building, 5 from madison square garden, loads of shopping and its in Koreatown so some really great Asian restaurants. The only bad thing I can say about this hotel is that the elevator is pretty slow and the hallways a little dingy. The breakfast was free and good also-bagels, doughnuts, cereal etc... I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience at La Quinta Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: TravelerVienna
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife at La Quinta in April for a week, at the end of which the Icelandic volcano erupted; then we moved to a friend's apartment for five days. The hotel has a fantastic location, nice and efficient lobby, excellent free Internet in the rooms, nice beds, good TVs with lots of channels and very reasonable prices. The breakfast is not enormous, but they have coffee, juice, bagels, flakes, milk, yoghurts, pastries etc. The negatives were the slow/overcrowded elevators and the loud slamming of guest room doors at all times. On balance, I would not hesitate to stay here again. I can highly recommend it! We had a good time. We did not use the gym, bar or the concierge services, so I cannot vouch for them.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and quiet”
Reviews.Author: MaggieNIreland
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel very good - reasonable price and good value. Room was not large but was very clean and quiet. Staff helpful. Breakfast adequate

Reviews.Title: “like the renovated guestrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgirly1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this La Quinta location a few times in the past years, we skipped a year to stay eleswheree in NYC,. Decided to try LQ again or 2 nights, very happy to experience the updated accomodations! Clean and comfortable and service very friendly and efficient! The only thing missing is the hard boiled eggs( needed the protein and less of the sugary carbs) and packages of oatmeal in the breakfast buffet. Good for a quick stop for a piece of fruit and a hot beverage before hitting the BIG CITY!.I agree with other reviewers, LQ is in a great location! Cabs pick you up right outside this busy area if needed..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic mid-town Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: Truaii
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the La Quinta. Yes, the rooms are small as per previous contributor's, but that is what I expected of a hotel in Manhattan. Rooms are clean and they provide plenty of towels and soap. Very comfortable beds and our room faced the Empire State building and had no street noise. The only two negatives: The continental breakfast. I was NOT impressed with the use of disposable styrofoam plates, bowls and cups and plastic utensils, plus donuts and bagels for breakfast isn't terribly exciting. Hot water was spotty. Sometimes there was no hotwater..and when there was, the temperature either scalded you or was cold - no mid-point. All in all, we would stay there again and recommend it to others. Excellent price for a hotel that is located 2 minutes from 5th avenue and multiple subway lines!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ReubenSingapore
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in New York and La Quinta Manhattan was the most affordable hotel i could find. Upon my arrival, i was surprise to find that the hotel was prety decent. The rooms were clean and had all the basic necessities. Though it was a bit small, i had no complains for the price i was paying. On top of that, they even had free WIFI and also free usage of computers. Complimentary breakfast was also provided daily though the spread was limited. The service staff there looked fierce initially but after awhile, we realised that they nicer and friendlier and definetly more helpful than they looked. On a whole, I would say i enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leapyearboy
Reviews.Content: This week we stayed at La Quinta Hotel on 32nd Street in Manhattan. This hotel was an awesome place to stay in Manhattan. Although the room was small, we had a queen sized bed, a desk, and a flat screen TV and a nice bathroom which was all we needed as we were on the town during our stay most of the time. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel employees were courteous from the from desk people to the bellman, to the maids. Anything we needed including having to pull up to the front of the hotel with our car to load our bags was taken care of efficiently and politely. What we particularly liked about the hotel was it's convenient location and price. We could catch any of 3 different subway trains at the corner, and 9 different trains were within 3 blocks. My wife enjoyed the 5 minute walk to Macy's and we walked to Times Square and back from a show in 15 minutes. The rooftop bar was also awesome and a great place to unwind at the end of the night. Great hotel and we will stay here again anytime we're in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from La Quinta Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: hafdman
Reviews.Content: My a/c did not work for the 2 and 1/2 days we were there, I was over charged for the room and there were long blackhairs in my bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: kathy2451
Reviews.Content: My daughter and grandaughter and I stayed at this hotel for 1 week. I picked this hotel because it was close to Penn Station and from the reviews I read on this site. I was a little nervous about the neighborhood, but the location won me over. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and updated. We saved a lot of money on breakfast because of their ample free breakfast. I read that the elevator was slow, but we didn't have any problems with it. The only complaint was that the bar on the roof was always closed when we got back to the hotel. We stayed out late, and would have liked to see the view from up there, but never made it. We never felt in any danger from the neighborhood, but the smells can be a little overpowering at times, but once in the hotel, it was okay. We requested the back of the hotel and were told we could have a room in the back, but they gave us one on the 8th floor in the front, and we could hear police cars, garbage trucks etc. in the morning and at night, but we were usually so exhausted, we didn't hear anything once we were asleep. There was a subway down the street from the hotel which was convenient. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone and I would definitely stay there again. One other thing I would like to mention, is that they have a bag check for guests, which really helped. We checked out on a Thursday morning, but our train didn't leave till 3 a.m. The hotel let us check our bags (9 bags) until midnight and then called a cab for us and helped us load them into the cab. This is probably the best hotel I have stayed at in the past couple of years!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for central manhattan”
Reviews.Author: student_north
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine. It is not perfect or awfull. The price isn't to bad, for manhatten. It is perfect for fist-timers to the city because it is close to times square, macy's, metro(fastes way to travel around). Location: It's next to the radisson martinique. Located in "korea-town" which is really just one street. It is a busy area, loads of people 24/7, but the hotel is surprisingly quiet. The rooms were very clean, and the bathroom was good. New tv and ipod doc-station. The beds were comfy. We had no view from the window, but it did'nt bother us to much. Where out all day anyways. There is not any resteaurant selection around the hotel, but you should eat all over manahattan to get the overall experience(chelsey, little-italy, soho, china-town.....) The only real negative thing about the hotel is the breakfast. It is included in the price and contains of really simple; bagels and cream-cheese, donut's, cerial, yougurt, coffee, milk and juice. And there are few tables going around so the one day we had breakfast at the hotel, we had to stand around waiting for a table for ten min. or so. But the food they got tastes good. It's just not a healthy and nutrisious breakfast :) I was perfectly happy with my stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not luxurious but more than adequate”
Reviews.Author: hollholl
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it was very reasonably priced and within close proximity to Penn Station (2-3 blocks). It had everything I needed for a short business trip, including access to computer/printer, wireless Internet, and free breakfast. It isn't fancy -- i.e., it's not the place to pick if you're booking travel for your company VIPs and want to impress them -- but it's clean and seemingly well-kept. My bed was quite comfy and the room had a flat screen TV. The service was very good. When I made my reservations on the La Quinta website, there was no selection for smoking/non-smoking (at least I didn't see one), so the system had assigned me to a smoking room. When I got to the hotel, there were no nonsmoking rooms available at my rate. However, the desk clerk and manager gave me a free upgrade so that I could get into a nonsmoking room. That was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: ShellyMaranaAZ
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to NY and I was very impressed with this hotel. I don't normally stay at La Quintas but found to be pleasently surprised. The rooms were small, but I think all rooms are small in NY. The hotel was pretty clean and you get a free breakfast in the morning. Mostly bagles, donuts and cereal but hey its free! It is located in a great location. Right around the corner from the Empire State Building and across the way from Macys. And its only 1 subway stop away from Time Square. The roof top bar is pretty cool. Drinks are expensive but I guess that is what you get at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: iknowcourtney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The rooms ridiculously overpriced, so I was expecting a nice hotel when I arrived. The lobby is nice but that might be the only winning feature. The rooms were small, smelled awful, and to top it off we had NO HOT WATER. I had friends in lots of different rooms so I know it was not just my room. When I called to have them come fix it, they blew me off....TWICE! They were doing testing on the fire alarms, which I know is unfortunate that I was there during that time, but they started testing very early. I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Yo. Damn near perfection”
Reviews.Author: TRCB
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in Manhattan, look no further. This is IT. Sure the rooms are small (This IS the middle of NYC!). And I'm not sure where to start. The Flat screen TV has lots of choices. iPod dock on the alarm clock. The bed has memory foam. Better than some La Quinta breakfast offerings. Better than decent shower. Of course the value is good. Much better than other La Quinta's (I'm an elite member so I do know La Quinta.) Now. The staff. I didn't meet *everybody*, so sorry. I do want to thank Kapil, Zakir, Ronica, Dmiz, Shabbiq, Melinda, and William. Sorry I didn't get the names of my breakfast team, or housekeeping. Everyone, I mean everyone, was friendly and down right fun to see. I didn't get to meet Victor (manager), and I will correct that shortcoming the next time. I have only one sad point, and it is *not* a La Quinta issue. Due to other factors, I did not bring a laptop. I used the business center computers (Windows XP). Yes, I checked and they use a managed security system. No, it didn't help. I was busy the entire trip, on my departure, I checked my paypal account. Before I could get to JFK, PayPal suspended my account due to unusual behavior. Within 1 hour of using the business center, the cyber-mafia attempted to drain my PayPal, and everything was locked down by PayPal (Thank you PayPal). Again, I CANNOT blame La Quinta. This is more a reflection and alert of the level of cyber-crime. I foolishly thought the 3rd party security would protect me. Clearly the computer has a keystroke logger installed. Since this can happen by anyone visiting a website these days, how can you blame the property? This is only a warning about using unknown computers. Most La Quinta's are well run. This one sets the standard for the others to look up to. I am actually ready to put up with JFK again to work and visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: KelBecSam
Reviews.Content: This is a great price for such a fabulous location. The rooms are small but clean and the memory foam matress ensured a great nights sleep. The breakfast was simple but there was plenty of choice for us, and again considering the price we paid I was pleasantly surprised. The roof-top bar was cool, but very small, and with a group of people already in there, we couldn't get a seat. Not ideal when you are paying $40 for 4 drinks. It would probably be better in the summer when it is warm enough to stand outside, otherwise it is just to cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our next stay here.”
Reviews.Author: off2cnyc
Reviews.Content: Our total stay was fabulous. I can't think of anything that was a disappointment or could have been improved upon. The location was great for our plans. The staff was helpful and attentive. Bellhop,Daniel, was especially friendly and helpful. The room was sufficiently large and very clean. We were on the 10th floor so we heard very little street noise. The breakfast was great---fresh bagels and pastries, fruit, yogart, cereal, ect... There was parking on the same street. We are looking forward to our next trip to NYC and we will definitely be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and great location”
Reviews.Author: PaulBz
Reviews.Content: Travelled on a quick shopping trip. Wanted to stay right in Manhattan but didn't want to pay big dollars. This spot was perfect. Tiny room, but who cares. Cheap price, no frills. great location. Walked everywhere. Would recommend it for cheap stay in NYC

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Flatcoatfun
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel at a good price - Ill be back. I did have to switch rooms after two nights as the toilet kept plugging up, they would respond right away to fix it but after it happenend 2 mornings in a row I asked for a room change which I got with no problems. The second room 1012 was larger than the first which was 1114. In the first room you could not pull the chair out from under the desk as there just was no room between the desk and bed. The second room had plenty of space. Both had a window to the street - but not much of a view - just looking at the building across the way. Next time I'll ask for a room at the back of the hotel - as other travelers mentioned the street is loud all night. Everyone honks and you can hear all the trucks. The beds have the foam top mattress, nice bedding, all very neat and clean. Bathroom is small and not much space on the vanity, but shower head massage was great. Hot water did take longer in the second room than the first. Towels are on the thin side. Overall very clean bathroom. My room did have a closet and also has iron and ironing board. Flat screen TV. Coffeemaker in room. (friends staying in the New Yorker did NOT get coffee maker in their room) Breakfast was great, staff is there making sure everything stays stocked as it was very busy. Apples and banannas, yogurt in a fridge, cereal, bagels and donuts. The staff was very good. I was able to check in at 10:30 AM even though check in time is not until 3 pm. They do have a place to hold your luggage if they didn't have a room. The bellman saw I left my wallet on the counter after checking in and immediately let me know. The housekeeping staff was friendly. They handled my room change well. The hotel is so well located, half block walk to the subway station. 2.5 blocks to Madison Sq gardens/Penn station. I had worried about walking alone from MSG to the hotel at 11PM and it was not a problem at all. Tons of people out, the block where the subway station is has a cop and a camera. Its only a 2 block walk to Macy's. There is a Korean place called Mandoo Bar (not really a bar) Had great food. Your in Korea town. Keens steakhouse is only a few blocks away. So good we ate there 2 nights. And at $125 per night on weekend and $98 during the week it was a steal. That was AAA rate. There are multiple taxes - Sales tax, City Tax, Javits convention fee and Occupancy tax for each nights stay - added $22.00 per night at the $125 rate. The business center has 3 desktop computers down in the basement and a printer. Was very handy for making reservations, if you need the password just ask the front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Price!”
Reviews.Author: dugsky
Reviews.Content: I travel to New York quite often and find the hotels to be overpriced and underserviced. La Quinta was the exception to the rule. The room was warm, cozy and comfortable. The price was under $100 with my AAA discount (not including the 20% New York City Tax). They even had a half price parking deal at the lot across the street or offered valet parking with a small surcharge. The internet was fast and FREE. The continental breakfast was included and served in a clean and constantly serviced dining area. Altogether everything went without a glitch and they were keen on being helpful. One should also note that La Quinta is in a heritage building and is well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was hoping for!”
Reviews.Author: Gita27
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location & great value! Short walk to Madison Square Garden, the Flatiron and Madison Square Park, Curry Hill, etc. Herald Square metro entrance on the same block or hop on the Park street line a few blocks down . During the cold spell, I never even had to turn on the heat in the 9th floor room (and I'm very cold natured). An awesome bonus was that I could see the reflection of the Empire State Building in the windows of the building across 32nd street. Dead remote batteries and safe left closed by previous visitors were quickly addressed. Though frequent La Quinta visitors may be surprised there's no waffle option for breakfast, it makes perfect sense due to the volume of people in the dining area at once. The donuts were wonderful, and I got the feeling they were from a local bakery. Drinks at the rooftop bar were great and reasonably priced ! Love the feel of Korea Way and the beautiful architecture of the La Quinta. Will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: KJRJDR
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel appeared nice, but the room was a different story. The room though clean was very small. We ended up in a room that was poorly insulated and was very cold during the recent storm. It lacked simple ammenities like a closet, iron or ironing board. The drains in the bathroom clogged frequently. What I did like was the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: luvsa3
Reviews.Content: Very Nice and clean rooms, good breakfast and very good staff. Location was the key. If I go back to NYC, I wouldnt stay anywhere else except this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and value”
Reviews.Author: BREED5577
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Near walking distance to all midtown attractions. Friendly staff. Very comfy room. Hip roof top bar. If I had to nit pick the water took awhile to warm up in the shower and the room faced 32nd street which was very noisy. Next time I will get a room to the rear of building. Will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lacubfan
Reviews.Content: Me, my son, and his fiance stayed here January 4-9. With 3 of us in the room, there was plenty of space. Did not feel crowded. Very convenient to public transportation. Our room was very clean. Breakfast consisted of donuts, bagels, toast, cereal, and fruit. Breakfast area was always very neat, clean, and well stocked. Hotel staff was courteous and helpful. Felt very safe in this area even when we came in late. It was very quiet. Room was right by the elevator but never heard any noise at night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BeantownMan
Reviews.Content: I was in Manhattan for one night and needed an inexpensive place. I found this hotel on the Web and I couldn't beat the price. The reviews here on Trip Advisor sold me on it. I wasn't disappointed at all. The hotel is located in a beautiful historic old building on a busy side street in the middle of Koreatown. They have valet parking for the garage on the corner, and a very reasonable (for NYC) discounted daily parking rate. The inside of the hotel is all brand new and very stylish. The room itself was small, but not miserably so. There was room to move around. The beds were tempurpedic foam style and were amazingly comfortable. The bath had a great big tub/shower with a shower massage and was clean and well appointed. I was extremely impressed with the style and ammenities this place had, relative to the price. They also had a very nice fitness center which I made use of. The location is absolutely perfect for tourists. It's three blocks from Penn Station, around the corner from Herald Sq. and the Empire State Building, and there's a major subway stop at the end of the block. We were able to walk everywhere, from Times Square to Chelsea. I will definitely come back. Be warned though, if you are driving, that the hotel only has two very small signs out front (due to historic district issues), and it's easy to miss. Going around the block in that area takes a lot of patience. The Korean BBQ place in the hotel was excellent, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-Nice place”
Reviews.Author: JRWilcox
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't have many bells and whistles but for the price this is one of the best values in the city. About a 6 minute walk from Penn Station and a 10 minute walk from Times Square, we found the location to be perfect for our sightseeing/shoppine/eating desires. The hotel is in an area called Koreatown and is thus surrounded by an array of Korean restaurants, bars, and karaoke joints. As for the hotel itself, the amenities are what you expect from any run of the mill hotel. Breakfast is simple but free. The rooms are really clean and up to date. All the people we interacted with were friendly in city terms. Mostly, the price is fantastic for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to subway lines, all the basics, great price”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoomer
Reviews.Content: Hardly a five-minute walk to Herald Square's multiline (BDFNQRVW) subway & PATH station at Sixth Avenue and just a bit farther away from Penn Station's additional lines, the location was convenient for my tourism. It was just a couple short blocks to the Empire State Building and an easy walk to Times Square. Just like a La Quinta adjacent to an interstate highway, this hotel has all the basics, including a free breakfast buffet and a free wireless internet connection that was very, very easy to set up. I paid $125/night plus tax, which was very reasonable, compared with other Manhattan hotels I checked online. Check-in and check-out were quick and accurate. It was easy to store my bags on departure day since I checked out just before noon but didn't have a departing flight until that evening. Heat and water worked well in my room. Even though it faced the street, I didn't notice any noise. The room safe easily accommodated my laptop computer. Only one minor complaint: Electric outlets were a bit loose--my plugs tended to fall out of them rather than being gripped securely when I plugged them in. This was a repeat visit (my second time this year), and it would be tough for me to find a better hotel option in Manhattan for my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice older hotel---good value”
Reviews.Author: Dr._Bob_4
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location in midtown Manhattan and thought I would give this hotel a try. Overall, I was pleasantly surprised. The check in was efficient and without surprises. I used the valet parking, and while a bit expensive ($30) it worked well and the price was not out of line with the cost of parking in that part of New York . The check out was also efficient and without any surprises in terms of delays or added costs. The room, while a bit on the small size was clean and quite ample for 1 person (or perhaps 2 compatible individuals). There was a nice flat screen TV in the room. The bed was quite comfortable and the room was quiet, with no noise from either the street or other rooms. so I slept well. The internet, while a bit slow, was free and basically worked well. There was a very cozy bar on the top floor with reasonably priced drinks (for New York), a nice outdoor patio (covered with snow when I was there, but still accessible) and a friendly staff clientele. Saying this, you would not confuse this hotel with the Ritz. The wallpaper and carpets had seen better days, and the water in the shower did not get past lukewarm. Also the staff, while efficient and helpful, did not have the effusive "we'll do anything for you" attitude that is common in 5 star hotels. Overall, I found this hotel a fun place to stay in a great location, and an excellent value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoHughtoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. Do not be mislead by reviews that are positive - clearly they are written by either inexperienced or inexpensive travelers who accept low quality. My room was small and very, very dirty including a bug in the shower, crumbs on the threadbare, stained carpet, cigarette burns in the drapes and a broken nightstand that was propped against the wall to keep it from falling down. I tried to find a different hotel but due to the holidays everything was booked so I was forced to stay in this disgusting, filthy place. Upon checkout I voiced my complaints to the deskclerk who promised me the manager would address my concerns. If he offers a free stay, KEEP it.

Reviews.Title: “Lotsa heart in mid-town!”
Reviews.Author: kwbts124
Reviews.Content: We were staying on Long Island with relatives for Thanksgiving and decided to stay in the city for one night. Since I am a loyal La Quinta patron I chose that hotel. they only had one room left- #619 @ 127/night. The room was a nice size with a flat screen TV, new mattress, and a decent bathroom. The view was typical for mid-town Manhatten but the LOCATION was superb! Two blocks from Madison Square Garden (Penn Station) and just a block from the Empire State bldg, Times Square was less than a 5-minute walk. This hotel is a great place to stay if traveling to NYC. There were three computers downstairs - I used these to book my airport shuttle and print my boarding passes (printing was free). The gym was small but the equipment was brand new and no one seemed to use it. The breakfast was not the best that La Quinta had to offer (no waffles) they put out large donuts and the dining facility was very small for the amount of guests. I also would warn about the slow elevators - we only stayed one night and we don't mind taking the stairs but the elevators were noticiably slow and small. I would stay here again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jessandmona
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right around the corner from the Empire State Building and walking distance from Times Square. Staff was very helpful and the hotel was very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable good location”
Reviews.Author: Caseyboy06
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location near Penn Station. Room was clean,affordable and quiet..Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value-would stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: Nickel7375
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints whatsoever about this hotel. The room was a bit small, but on par with other NYC hotels. Nice new flat screen TV, very comfortable memory foam mattress, AC/Heat worked great. The hotel was very quiet and in a great location; close to Times Square, The Empire State Building, Penn Station, etc. The hotel was very clean and the staff was professional and friendly. Check-in/Check-out was fast and effortless. When we were leaving the bellman stood in the street with a whistle to get us a cab to the airport. The breakfast was ok, cereals, milk, juice, yogurt, bagels, donuts, muffins and coffee. The wireless inetrnet worked fine for us on the 10th floor. I really don't think you can find a better value in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “very small room but has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: James1958
Reviews.Content: The room was small. I booked a kings bed to find out I only got a queen. Location was excellent in the middle of Korea town and very very close to 5th,6th and broadway. I felt safe at night in the area as it was a busy section of midtown. The staff were friendly. the breakfast was basic but reasoable. Once I came back to the room at about 23:00 it was a bit noisy from a party on the roof. I would stay there again if I came for a very short time and by myself. I was told that they have slightly bigger rooms but I was disappointed that I did not receive what I have booked and paid for. I paid around $210 including the tax.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like neighborhood. Moved to other hotel on third night.”
Reviews.Author: turquoisebuyer
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 double beds for four nights. We walked from Penn Station (easy walk) and tried to check in at 4pm after a day of travel. The room was not ready and we were told to come back in an hour. We returned more than an hour later and still had to wait in the lobby. This is a small hotel with a very unattractive front desk, unattractive people and unattractive views. Most views are of the street or a brick wall. The room was large, uninspired and dark. Comfortable beds Very clean Large rooms free internet free breakfast Fair price We were very unhappy with the neighborhood - crowded, dirty, crummy stores, just felt unsafe. We notified the hotel the next morning 10 am that we were checking out and they made us pay for the room that night so we were forced to stay another night. We moved to the Thompson Hotel on Allen for our last two nights which was amazing for the same price as La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Pro active general manager”
Reviews.Author: kofeann
Reviews.Content: We planned a mini vacation to New York in Sept. 2009 and stayed at Laquinta Manhattan. While my family and I were there I left my cam corder in the Business Center and the next day it was gone. I reported the situation to the General Manager who immediatly took actions and reviewed all the camera recoding of the hotel with me. Based on the review of the recordings, staff identified the person who took the camera,but he no longer was in the hotel. General manager asked his staff to keep an eye for the person who stole the camera and meanwhile he contacted the local police and the local hotels with information and the picture of the person who stole the camera. Surprisingly the same person showed up at the hotel and wanted to use the Business Center. The General manager Mr. Victor Alim and his staff confronted the thief and got the camera back. During the whole ordeal staff and the General manager conducted themselves in a profesional maner and I certainly believe that a good hotel is run only by capable people. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Vowo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 nights & were very pleased overall. Rooms are a decent size for NYC with a nice flat-screen TV, & it was quiet. Liked the free Internet & phone + a printer available in the `business center' downstairs. Bed was comfortable as long as you don't mind it very soft. Decent bagels included in the breakfast, but everything else is over-sweetened American food + some truly awful coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: rbettsjr
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The room was small but unless you want to spend over 300 a night, that is typical New York, especially when the buildings are so old. Cleanliness was immaculate, staff was exceptionally friendly. Water pressure and abundance of hot water was fantastic. Continental breakfast was just perfect to get the day started. What I really loved the most was the location. 1 block from the Empire State Building, 1 block from access to the subway, 1 block from the largest Macy's in the world... Anything you need is within a short walk. I cannot wait to come back, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: NYC092009
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean rooms, good price and fine breakfast included!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Toby080
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Location in Korea Town: Close to Metro Stations, loads of Korean and Indian restaurants closeby, direkt next to the Empire State Building, 5-Minute walk to Flatiron Building and Macys - Clean, quiet rooms, comfortable beds - free breakfast, internet and national calls, no extra and high carges like in other hotels - cool rooftop bar with Empire state building view - friendly staff Cons: - if you like a hot breakfast including eggs etc. this is not the right Hotel for you - no amenities like a pool and a fitness centre, but who needs that in NYC anyways

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: wild09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a weekend and had a very good experience. The location can't be beat as it is close to everything. Next to Herald Square and right behind Empire State Building. Penn Station and Macy's are a few blocks away.The rooms were large and just been remodeled with flat screen TVs and tempurpedic mattresses. What a treat! Includes a free breakfast too. This will be our home when we come back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkVisitor09
Reviews.Content: I have been to New York 6 times. This may well be the worst hotel in Manhattan! The staff doesn't care about guests and were completely not helpful. There was hair on every towel I received. The elevators are used mostly by people not staying at the hotel who are using the bar on the 14th floor. Be prepared for very long elevator waits! The ice machines are noisy and one night I was woken up by an employee bashing a ladder outside my room. The breakfast is all white-carbs. Nothing like other La Quinta breakfasts! The free internet is fine, but a lot of time it was down. This hotel is old and grungy and I hated every minute of my stay. It's on a dirty, disgusting street. Do yourself a favour and stay somewhere else. When I told the manager (via email) how unhappy her was, he replied, "what would you like me to do?" No concept of customer satisfaction!

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: bl80
Reviews.Content: La Quinta in Korea town in New York City - a really great budge hotel. First and foremost, the location is just 1/2 a block from the 34st subway line which feeds tons of trains. Only one stop down from the Time Square station that feeds every other train you would ever need to catch. Our room was on the 5th floor and was very clean, non-smoking (didnt have any smell at all), and the bed was a foam-top king.. extremely comfortable. Rooms are small.. but I fully expected this. Plenty of room for the two of us.. and we spent most of our time outside of the hotel.. for our type of travel it was perfect. If you plan on spending a lot of time in your room you might be better off somewhere else. Being in a very busy area of town I was pretty nervous about noise. The room was dead silent.. could not hear a peep from the streets below (we overlooked 32nd Street). The counter staff were very nice and got me setup quickly w/o issue. The cleaning woman who I saw everyday was super friendly and helpful. (we left in kinda a rush and forgot to leave a tip.. I feel very bad for that) The rooftop bar is small and pretty packed.. if you enjoy the nightlife, its really only an elevator trip away... which leads me to my only real complaint of the whole place: The elevators are horrible. In the evenings when people are going up to the rooftop bar, you will typically be stuck waiting for a long time to get an elevator. I found myself taking the stairs more often that I would prefer, but it was not a huge issue. Overall, for the price, I could not ask for more. Quiet, clean, great location and friendly staff. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Check your reservation details before you get there!”
Reviews.Author: Ph0t0Master
Reviews.Content: Location is great! It is pretty much right in the middle from Chinatown to Central Park. It's about 20 blocks or so to Central park, and but you better take the subway to Chinatown, but it's a short ride. The room is very very small. But what do you expect.. You at least have a room with a very comfortable bed, your own bathroom, and an in-room safe that works. The room smelled a bit like mold.. but it will do.. What I did NOT like about this hotel is the service.. At check in and check out, the customer rep actually offended me with their smirks.. They charged me extra things for no reason.. Just make sure you print out your confirmation letter with you, so they can't charge you extra stuff.. It was not at all a good start or ending to what could have been a better weekend. I will stay here again next time, just because it's cheap and its great centralized location.. but that's about it.. (Don't even eat their continental breakfast.. it sucks..)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice, great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Wilsonmargrn
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 times. And I have never had a problem there. I was quickly checked into my room. The guy at the front desk wasn't overly friendly, but he wasn't rude either. That comment was based on other negative reviews that I had read. But to his credit, it was 230am. This hotel provided exactly what I was looking for. The positives 1. the location. It's walking distance to many attractions 2.the rooms were clean and the mattresses were very comfortable.3. Breakfast is included. They have toast, bagels,donuts, cereal (hot and cold), yogurt, fruit and juices and coffee. What more do you want? It saves a lot of time searching for a place to eat. You can then move on with your day and do what you came to New York City for. 4.the roof-top patio. It's quaint, and offers a great view of the Empire State Building. I usually go there before or after my evening out.4.Internet service in basement to pick up emails. I went with my sisters on my third visit. One of my sisters wanted to try another hotel that she had previously stayed at. I convinced her to try this hotel and now she recommends it to everyone. Also, when I have checked out other discount hotels on websites, the price never matches La Quinta. Try it. I think you will be pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: cashu
Reviews.Content: very clean room and comfortable bed. continental breakfast, daily newspaper, safe box and coffee in room. very convenient location steps from Herald square. all that in a surprising price - great value for the $. we stayed 3 days and enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, and, as you would expect, not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kansaskeith
Reviews.Content: This is a bargain-priced hotel in the shadows of the Empire State Building, near Broadway on 32nd Street, in the Korean neighborhood of Manhattan. It is part of the Apple Core Hotels group, which prides itself on satisfactory accomodations without the traditional high New York prices. Staff is friendly enough, and I felt secure and for the most-part comfortable. My AARP rate of a little over $125 per night USD included high-speed internet and continental breakfast, plus business and fitness centers in the basement, and my small room with a king-size bed overlooking 32nd Street. Those are the "pros." The first "con" is that my room seemed -- even allowing this was New York -- noisy. The trash trucks come along 32nd Street in the 1 - to- 3 a.m. time frame and take a very, very long time to collect huge numbers of sacks of trash from all the Korean restaurants from the previous day. This isn't any quick trash-collection run like "back home," it is a very loud, slow, institutional one. Other "cons" included (1) that the housekeeper didn't come by to clean my room when she said she would (I had adjusted my schedule to accomodate that, all for naught); (2) parts of the room looked worn and in need of spruce-up, but in the hotel's defense there are signs everywhere that new furniture is in the process of being installed; (3) elevator service can be crowded and slow; (4) if you make a reservation through LaQuinta's computer system, be aware that the "Returns" (frequent guest) ID number may not make it onto your record in the hotel's different computer system -- I had to make a couple phone calls after I got home before I got my points. Obviously, none of those "cons," with the possible exception of the noise, will in themselves ruin a stay, so if you can accept them in return for bargain New York rates, I will recommend. Just don't expect luxury -- you aren't paying for it and you won't get it.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for the business traveler at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: Trav4Biz_9
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta at 17 West 32nd Street exceeded all my expectations for what I would consider to be a budget-friendly hotel: Professional, friendly, helpful staff Clean Room was good-sized (especially for Manhattan) VERY reasonably priced Easily accessible, FREE, high-speed internet access Convenient location near 32nd and Broadway FREE continental breakfast (including fruit)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely frustrating.”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodWndr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel in the past and stay at Laquinta's frequently. This by far was one of my worst experiences. Upon check in the gentleman behind the counter said my credit card was declined due to the expiration date. The date on the card was obviously good. I called the credit card company in front of them and they said it was clear the problem wasn't with my card but with the hotel. He then proceeded to explain to me that my room had been cancelled because my card had been declined. He could give me a room but would need another card. I only had my debit, wich I dislike. In the end the man was rude and never offered any customer service concerning. I asked for the phone number for the management and he refused. There is obviosly an issue with the system in that hotel because I see that someone else had a similiar experience. This type of issue should be investigated to ensure everyones safety.

Reviews.Title: “Top Value for Midtown”
Reviews.Author: Italinan
Reviews.Content: I had been used to paying $300 a night for a room at very ordinary hotels in midtown Manhattan, so paying half that for excellent accommodations within walking distance of Penn Station, Macy's, etc. was a refreshing change. The room is tiny - most of it taken up by the king-size bed - but the bed is really top-notch. The amenities in the room and bathroom are all clean and new. Wireless Internet is a plus. The closet safe accommodates your laptop. The noise level is acceptable (there are no quiet places in Manhattan). The room is really a very pleasant little nook. Unlike some visitors who have reviewed here, I had no problems with the staff - indeed, when on one stay I forgot my beautiful toiletries bag, full of expensive cosmetics, the housekeeper kept it until my next visit. Honesty goes over big with me. I will say that on one stay, the boiler had broken and I was unable to take a shower. I asked for and received a discount to make up for the inconvenience. The other 'problem' at this hotel is the slow elevators; if the hotel is fully booked there can be a line in the lobby to get on. You may want to request a high floor room so as to ensure yourself a spot in the elevator in the morning. The 'continental breakfast' is weak; pastries, juice, coffee, cereal etc are all pretty bad. I'd skip most of it and maybe just take a yogurt and a banana. Given that you are paying half the going rate for a nice room in midtown, I don't hold it against the hotel. You can take your savings and treat yourself to a fancy breakfast somewhere else. All in all a great bargain and a positive experience on several trips.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Neat Memory foam beds Awesome shower curtain PLEASE bring back hard boiled eggs”
Reviews.Author: travellinoz
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for check in on a very hot July 4 and Ronica was so courteous and checked us into an available room. She showed initiative by asking for our AAA card and was very helpful in determining what floor we would like. As I am a light sleeper, I appreciated her concern. Thank you! We stayed in a comfortable room, KS bed. It was very clean and neat and the bed was so comfortable. We were so tired we took an afternoon nap but were woken up by hammering on the floor above us. We found out later they were installing flat screen TVs. Better than hammering at night time! The shower curtain in our room was almost clear (so much better than the regular 2 layers of dark yuk curtains) Awesome. Breakfast was well stocked. It was a busy morning and the gentleman taking care of the food was working hard . But PERLEASE bring back hard boiled eggs LA Quinta people. Some protein in the morning is a very good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Bad customer relations”
Reviews.Author: NDRaigg
Reviews.Content: My stay wasn't uncomfortable. But when i found out afterwards that they didn't apply the AAA discount, the hotel manager's attitude was "it's not our responsibility to ask for your AAA card" and the customer service couldn't care less. I had a confirmation printout of my reservation with the discounted price on it which i presented that at the time of check-in, but they didn't tell me that they were charging me more than the printed price. (By the way, how about putting a reminder on the confirmation?) To be fair they did offer to correct it. All i needed was an apology, and assurance that it wouldn't happen again, but instead i got "Is it worth to have all this conversation for a few dollars?" Well, firstly, they can keep that money, and secondly, this time i'll be staying at a more expensive hotel which treat their customers better.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright”
Reviews.Author: taace1i1a
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice enough. It looked good on the inside, however is easy to miss if you're driving or even walking. The staff was alright, but I've found most people in NY don't seem happy. So I'll say the staff was as nice as the staff usually is? The location was ok, but I don't think I've ever walked that much in my life. It's definitely far from everything but the Empire State Building, but it's really close to all the subways, so that was a plus! The breakfast was good, had a lot of variety. You have to go up on the roof! They have a little lounge area there, and you get an awesome view. It's a great place to chill after a day of playing tourist. They also have memory foam, which was fun to try, and was great to have after a long day. While we were leaving someone from the hotel called us a taxi. It was really hard to understand him, but the guy said don't let the taxi driver charge me more than something...because something something. Anyways, the taxi driver was terrible, and I'm pretty sure ripped us off big time. But I guess it's my fault I didn't ask the person to repeat himself with the price.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great stay”
Reviews.Author: RiosRA
Reviews.Content: My wife, 16-year old daughter and I stayed at the La Quinta Manhattan and considered it one of the best values we've ever experienced. The location is good for anyone who is looking for a centrally located place to stay. A few walking minutes to Times Square, nearby subway stop and easy walking distance to several Big Appleâ€™s attractions (Empire State Building, Macy's, etc.). The two Queen bed (excellent mattresses, by the way) room was outfitted with new furniture and plenty for our party, flat panels were being installed while we were there. The bathroom was clean and neat. We were on the 12th floor and street or the upstairs MÃ© Bar (just as a side note â€“ do not miss the opportunity, you should visit this Bar and enjoy an amazing Empire State Building view!) was not a problem. Wireless Internet worked fine and when we needed the Business Center PCs, we did not have any problems. The hotel crew (front desk, maids and bellboy) and the free breakfast made our stay just GREAT. La Quinta Manhattan will be our NY home from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly”
Reviews.Author: jupiter13
Reviews.Content: Never stay in this hotel. I booked through online. They jacked up the price when I checked in. The front desk pople are not nice. Will not recommend

Reviews.Title: “Rude desk clerk! -- adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: gurluvs2travl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the LaQuinta Manhattan for a total of 8 nights. I found the hotel itself to be adequate in fact quite good, however the front desk clerk with whom I originally checked in with is absolutely the worst person in the hospitality business that I have ever come across. I have traveled extensively both for business and pleasure and have never met such a rude, unhelpful and uncooperative person that works in the "hospitality" business. After originally departing from Oregon, our flight was delayed for 2 hours in Denver due to weather at which time I called the LaQuinta Manhattan directly to let them know that we were going to be checking in very late, possibly early in the morning. Once we finally got on the aircraft we had another 2 hour delay while sitting on the tarmac due to mechanical problems, so again I called LaQuinta (while on the plane) to let them know we would be delayed even further. Both times I called I was assured by the front desk clerk that it would be no problem and that they would hold our reservation (which was guaranteed with a credit card) and then I was further transferred to the reservation desk so that they could make a note of it. My daughter and I were originally supposed to arrive at the hotel about 11 pm, however with the airline delays, we didn't arrive until 5 am. To my horror, when I got to the reservation desk, "R" said she had no reservation under my name! I even provided my paperwork for my online reservation and she insisted that my reservation was cancelled due to a "no show." However, she stated that she could still provide me with a room, but it would be at a much higher rate!! Then, even though I told her that I called twice and was told that it would be held, she would not budge and was extremely rude. I then insisted that she call the reservation number to verify my reservation since I had been assured that my reservation would be held. However instead of handling the problem herself, she told me to call the Applecore reservation line myself using the house phone. I did so and reached Debbie, a customer service rep. who thankfully ended up being an advocate. She apologized for the mix-up and said that she still showed a reservation for me and did not understand why "R" would not have the same reservation. She asked to speak with "R" who proceeded to argue with Debbie over the phone, and would not check us into our room until Debbie actually faxed over a copy of our reservation!!!!! Almost 45 minutes later (close to 6 am) we were finally checked into our room!! This was our first visit to New York and we had heard that New Yorkers could be rude, however I think it's pretty sad if the worst experience of our stay was with the front desk clerk of the hotel whom we stayed with for 8 nights, and by someone who is supposed to in the hospitality business!!! PS. Like in a previous review, I also wondered how the complimentary breakfast was monitored since anyone could basically walk in off the street into the breakfast room. It was usually packed and I wondered if everyone was actually a guest at the hotel. I think they should require room cards for entry into the breakfast room and the business center. A time limit for computer use in the business center would also be good. On the night that I wanted to print my boarding pass, a couple of teenagers were on "myspace" for hours... I finally had to ask to use a computer.

Reviews.Title: “A Great NYC Value!”
Reviews.Author: sneilen
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter and I spent 3 nights at the La Quinta Manhattan and were pleasantly surprised with the experience. The location is terriffic! Close to the subway, shopping & the Empire State Building. The rooms were clean and the bed was very comfortable. Try to avoid getting a room next to the ice machine as they are very noisy. The business center is a great convenience and with internet free internet access no need to travel with a computer. The hotel staff was very accomodating and even offered to store our luggage after check out so we could enjoy the day before our evening flight out. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those looking for a affordable accomodations. A suggestion to the hotel, install lighting over the bedroom mirror so that customers can put on make up in the bedroom while the steam clears in the bathroom. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: vwpickup
Reviews.Content: Excellent Choice! The La Quinta Manhattan is reasonably priced, convenient to Amtrak, the subway, busses, and taxis, and is clean, and offers all of the necessary amenities we required (breakfast , a concierage, free nationwide calling). We were very pleased and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “very clean, not expensive and comfy...”
Reviews.Author: calderou
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by CAA considering our needs. We stay there 4 nights and we found the room to be very clean, even if we were on the 12th floor, the water pressure in the shower was excellent at any time. The king size bed was very comfortable (visco elastic topper, bug don't live in foam...) This hotel is well located on 32st also call Korean Way there's a subway station few steps away . I think you get a very good return for your money. The breakfast was OK and it was good not to have to go out for it, it was a good starter! Anyway, if you're not sure and do not want to spend to much money on hotel, THIS IS A GOOD CHOICE. The staff was helpfull and we did not encounter any problem. And by the way, the rooftop bar is very pleasant .

Reviews.Title: “Chairs Damaged my clothing”
Reviews.Author: Ilusion01
Reviews.Content: All was fine until I noticed that the badly painted chairs (brownish color) had ruined my favorite business suit. thanks alot.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Known About This Place A Long Time Ago”
Reviews.Author: BHL
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the La Quinta for the first time, but it won't be my last. I come into the city via Penn Station, so the location one block away couldn't be beat. Nor could the convenience of having the subway right on the corner. I arrived around noon, left my bag in storage, and went on about my way. When I returned check-in was fast and friendly, with the clerk saving me another ten percent by inquiring if I have an Auto Club membership. So remember to show your card and save a few more dollars. My 6th floor room, even though it was across from the ice machine, was very quiet. The queen-sized bed was incredibly comfortable - my next mattress will definitely be memory foam. Everything was spotless. The AC worked well on a hot day, the water pressure was amazing, and the bathroom was a nice size for NYC. One complaint, though, was the placement of the toilet right next to the sink. While it was great to find a bathroom sink in NYC that actually had a counter top (most are pedastal sinks, with no room to place your toiletries), someone didn't do their measuring, because the end of the countertop jabs you in the ribs while you're trying to do your business. I am not an overly large female, so I can't imagine how a large man or any overweight person would fare. Other than that, I was pleased with the room. Didn't partake in the continental breakfast, so I can't comment on that, but we did check out the rooftop bar, which was very busy on a Saturday night. The view of the Empire State Building is indeed great, but if you don't like cigarette smoke this might not be the place for you, since smoking was allowed and, at least that night, was very heavy. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back, especially since I got this room for under $100 on a Saturday night in Manhattan, which is just unheard of.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel right in the heart of NYC”
Reviews.Author: mully_7
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from 7 nights at La Quinta, West 32nd Street. Room good size. Bathroom fine - constant hot water. Room cleaned daily. Staff helpful and friendly. A big plus was the included breakfast. Only two lifts so a little slow at times but didn't bother us as we were never in a hurry and comfy leather sofas to relax on while waiting. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: modernwilla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with 2 friends. The room was somewhat small but clean. It's located just behind Empire State Building, in the Korean streets. Good restaurants near, try Korean BBQ, it's delicious. Breakfast (continental) was served downstairs. Be sure to go early because there's a lot of people and not a lot of tables. The cleaning lady was singing opera while cleaning, a bit disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: b10g7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was CLEAN. A real plus in the city. It is in a great location and is a very good price. The rooms are small but you have everything you need. Bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in central Manhattan location”
Reviews.Author: GeelongAussies
Reviews.Content: A good sized room with continental breakfast included. Easy to get around with a subway stop only half a block away and a short walk to Times Square, Penn Station/Madison Square Garden. A highlight and must do is a visit to the rooftop bar which has a view up to the Empire State building towering overhead (its in the next block). Staff are very helpful and there is an ingenious wheelchair access at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Inn Manhattan is a rip off”
Reviews.Author: crg722
Reviews.Content: Our flight was delayed into NY and we arrived at this hotel around 7:00 pm. We had a confirmed late arrival reservation - which was made 3 months prior. When we got there we were told that our reservation was cancelled! They were very unsympathetic towards the situation, even though I showed them the confirmation. They told us our room, however, WOULD be ready by 6 am the next day if we would come back. They offered to find us another room - which they did - for $350 for 8 hours!!! They said it was the ONLY room available in town that evening (which I find hard to believe). Of course, we had to take it. When we came back the next morning, they raised our rates as we were now considered "walk ins". We requested a room away from the elevators, and our room was put right across from it. They would not work with us, give us our original rate, etc. so we have since put a stop payment on our credit card until they honor at least the price quoted. If you stay at this hotel, make SURE you confirm EVERYTHING up to the last minute. If you stay for the breakfast up to the last five minutes, they shuffle everyone off rudely stating "breakfast is over, you must all leave NOW". VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location,rooms and staff”
Reviews.Author: TARMexico
Reviews.Content: Room price is very expensive in nyc but this hotel has the best pricing in the city, the location is perfect everything is there around the corner also the staff is very nice and frendly we recommend this hotel to anyone to stay ho I forget to tell you about it is very clean.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: kelly123456789
Reviews.Content: The service was perfect. My room was always clean. The people at the front desk are kind. I liked the free morning breakfast. The housekepping very nice and friendly. I was so comfatable beacuse you could play your ipod, they have irons and ironbroads. they also have tv. The bathroom is always clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: dvestermark
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in room 1111 and loved it! 2 Queen beds and I thought the room was huge for New York. Two 30something girls with lots of luggage and plenty of room for it. Great area for shopping and sightseeing, close to subway and Penn St. I would stay her again and recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: hotelsstudent
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. Last time we stayed there, about 2 years ago, I found hairs on the towels. We didn't came back since. This weekend we decided to spend the night in NY. After calling several hotels in the TS area and finding them too expensive, 200+, we decided to go back to la Quinta. Yes, we found the lowest rate of the hotels in the area, and quite difererently to last time, the people in Front Desk were very kind. The complimentary continental breakfast this time was also better than before, more food to choose from, including fruit, yogourt, cereals, bagels and more. A bit boring having to wait for a table cuz the room was full. Rooms: Average, comfortable. Beds: Comfortable too, we had a queen size. Now, if your wondering if i found any hairs this time, the answer is yes, I found a hair in a towel again! So, the main issue here is the cleanliness of the hotel. It's a pity cuz with the location and low rates this would be perfect for people on the budget.

Reviews.Title: “simply awesome!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust249
Reviews.Content: Where can you possibly get a room for two, in NYC, with breakfast, for the absolutely stunning price of $112.49. Taxes extra, of course. Now the really good part - the rooms are very decent sized for New York, but get this - memory foam beds. Did you know these beds are bug proof - yea - absolutely! This was one of our concerns we had, and when we found this one feature - we knew we could not stay anywhere else. So here we are right next to the Empire State building, across the street from Macys and a short walk to Times Square - what a deal at a steal! The Hotel has a roof top bar (phenomenal view)and a 24 hour restaurant (Korean) too. The room was clean though not the most modern, but it had a laptop sized safe, wireless internet (anywhere in the hotel-no charge), an Ipod player on the bedside and the staff were just amazingly helpful. The breakfast room was a bid crowded but we got ourselves a bagel and coffee to go every morning - the breakfast attendant ws a pleasant felow and would happily bag our breakfast for us every morning. Great restaurants/eateries all around, all kinds of prices from $5 to $30 a meal depending on the ambience and whether you had a drink or not-so something for every budget! I would recommend this for anyone coming to New York City on a budget and yet wanting to be able to walk to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Budget Place”
Reviews.Author: ianwyj
Reviews.Content: Considering that accommodation costs in NYC can be as high the skyscrapers there, this place was very affordable. Travelling alone, I didn't need a lot of space. The room was a little cramped but the bed was very comfortable and the toilet facilities more than adequate. The only significant problem was a lack of hot water between midnight and 7 am. Breakfast was reasonable although sharing a table was necessary most mornings because the room was small. Location wise, this hotel was in the middle of Little Korea and some of the restaurants there are open 24 hours so food's never a problem. It's also only a block away from the Empire State Building and within walking distance of Times Square. Other than that, the 34th St-Herald Sq subway station is only a short walk away and using the city buses is also a good option if a little time is spent studying the routes - but have a Metrocard - it's so useful.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Horrible Experience In All My Travels”
Reviews.Author: BobbyChristchurch
Reviews.Content: The hotel that I had confirmed was over-sold, and they transfered me to this hotel. La Quinta Manhattan in NY City put me in a room on the top floor; it was apparenlty a Suite room - this floor had a pub/bar on the floor - next to 5-6 rooms!!! It was noisy, boisterous, and I did not get to sleep until 4am in the morning. Worse of all, the staff to whom I complained to on the phone just did not care. When I asked ot see the Manager in the morning(unfortunatley it was a Sunday) - of course he was not on Duty, and apparently gave instructions to his staff that he would not answer to customers unless the "hotel burnt down" - do much for customer satisfaction!!!

Reviews.Title: “Big value for little bucks in NYC!!”
Reviews.Author: amyp224
Reviews.Content: I just ran up to NYC for an overnight trip to visit with some other out-of-town friends. I wanted to find a place that was inexpensive and in a good location, but wasn't a hole or a hostel . I found it at La Quinta! The room was clean and the bed was quite comfy. It had an iron, 2 luggage racks, a safe, a hair dryer, a big TV, iPod dock/ clock radio and a phone in the bathroom. It was hot as all heck the day of my visit, so I cranked the AC, which worked just fine (thankfully!!!). These might be considered basics to some, but you'd miss them if you needed them and they weren't there. The bathroom was clean with plenty of towels and extra TP. They even called me 10 minutes after I settled in to see if everything was OK. Now, the room was smallish (no surprise there) and there was a view of the other wing of the hotel out of my window (no big deal). It was a little dark and the bathroom had a swinging door, but, for my $98/night AAA rate I got a continental breakfast, free newspaper, clean room, private bath, 1 block from Broadway, and a short walk from subways and major shopping/dining. The employees were pleasant and helpful. I signed up for the La Quinta rewards program and I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: ibbyCalif
Reviews.Content: When I saw rooms 1005/07, it reminded me of the old "where's the beef?" commercial. The rooms were tiny, maybe 250 sq. ft. I did look in other rooms, there are larger ones. Looks like hotel had a makeover, it was spotless. No foul odors/ stains, etc ( they supposedly fine u for smoking in places where it is forbidden) Ventilation was good, and it was relatively quiet despite the ice machine in the hall. Views WON'T take your breath away, you are in the shadow of the Empire State Bldg. Unlike many NYC hotels, U DON'T HAVE TO SHARE A BATHROOM W OTHERS, u get a FULL BATHROOM IN YOUR ROOM. At no extra cost u get a great tv w lots of channels, i pod dock on the radio, coffee maker, blow dryer, toiletries, safe, iron/board, 3 phones in room, even in the bathroom?? They have vm, no charge to dial out. WIFI is free , the computers in the basement were always in use when I went by after the free continental breakfast. I ASSUME there is no charge to use them. U can check in/out, get boarding pass at a kiosk in lobby where they have free NY Post/ USA Today copies. Small gym had a Bowflex (broken) and cardio machines. No pool. There is a concierege desk and a small convenience store. There is better store down the block, Jack's 99. Lots of stuff there, much of it <$1. No restaurant, only vending. U R in Koreatown, eateries are all Korean, walk a block or so, u will find lots of other choices. There is a rooftop bar on 13th floor, has a skylight where u can c the top of the Empire State Bldg. They don't own the parking lot, it is $30/ night!! Ouch!! Laundry service has a fee. Looks like place is ADA compliant, they lower a ramp to let u in the front entrance. Elevators are small/ slow, stairs are not in a creepy/ dirty staircase ,they are a good option. U can easily walk to many places in NYC from here, area was safe. Subway stops r a block away in either direction. Costs $2 a ride w free transfers as long as u don't leave station. Uu can buy a Metro card and add value to it, or get a day pass for $7.50. If u have a group and u r not going far, cabs can be a better deal since 4 ride for the price of 1. Penn Station/MSG, 2 blocks away. Catch Amtrak/ Long Island RR here. To get to JFK, take LIRR to Jamaica station (25 mins) transfer to AIRTRAIN . Total cost is about $10,on off peak hrs. Even if u have bags, this is fairly easy. Getting to LGA, is harder if u have bags. I took subway to 125th St, transferred to M60 bus. U can get to EWR from Penn too. Get to NJ on PATH via 33rd St station around the block. There are buses to all airports too. Grand Central ( beautiful bldg.) a mile away, $6 cab ride. Metro North trains go to NJ, up the Hudson, and Conn. Go at off peak time up the Hudson, great day trip , beautiful river views at a low price. Got great AAA rate for hotel( need to show them the card) it was < $100, taxes raise bill 15% . Join the rewards program, it's free. U can redeem points 4 future stays at other LQ hotels. U can easily pay 2x as much and get less elsewhere. I don't think u will get your own bathroom and a good breakfast and many other extras in a great, safe location ,w a great staff for this price anywhere else in mid town.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: mslys
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel was convenient for it's location, the rooms were small, the bathroom was small,our room smelled like smoke and we were unable to open the windows. We arrived with a large group and for future group travelers this is not the hotel for you. This place cannot accomadate groups that large. The lobby was very small and the elevators were slow and most of us had to take the stairs which were inconvenient given the amount of luggage we had. To top it all off a few of the parents left with rashes from bed bugs. Definately would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was roomy for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: hildynyc
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here one night so we could catch a play on Braodway ("Mary Stuart" - OUTSTANDING!) . As former NYC-ers, we were familiar with the city and just needed a place for the night that was inexpensive (by NYC hotel standards!) and within walking distance to the theatre district. Although the neighborhood this hotel is located in is not one I'd spend much time in (no character), it's close enough to the theatre district that it didn't matter. Rather than book online after seeing the nice reviews here on tripadvisor, I called the hotel to inquire about a non-smoking room w/ 2 queens. They gave me the room at the same price as the single NS queen room. The beds were VERY comfortable! And the room was surprisingly spacious for NYC. Check-in and check-out were a breeze. We easily stored our luggage so we could walk about the city. My only criticism of my stay would be the "complimentary" breakfast (they can call it complimentary but it's always figured into the price you pay). The breakfast area was overcrowded (possibly due to the holiday weekend). The location of items made it difficult to reach certain things. For example, the coffee and juice located in the corner - everyone crowded around those two items making it almost impossible to reach any other item located on either side. I would suggest locating drinks at the end or in another area altogether. Also, many items ran out at about 9AM and were not replenished (i.e. bananas). Having only one coffee spigot meant that it was hard to get one cup of coffee let alone a refill. And the quality could barely be considered "coffee" it was soooooo weak! Had to go to a Starbucks for a real cup of coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: katrand
Reviews.Content: Great help! Nice lobby help, towels late, but with honest apology "I forgot!", and cleaning staff found and returned a scarf I left (after I returned for it).. I wish the free breakfast included what was listed on website, no hot food at all, but I was full each day. SMALL room! Location great! I paid about $120 a night.

Reviews.Title: “I was really pleased with my stay there.”
Reviews.Author: Maddie35
Reviews.Content: My small room was cozy, reasonably priced, and appointed with everything I needed. Everything was clean and up-to-date. Continental breakfast was well stocked and pleasant. And the location is truly convenient, near Empire State Building, near Macy's, near Penn station and near 3 subway lines. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you go to New York stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kaz1703
Reviews.Content: The staff in La Quinta are extremely helpful & friendly, nothing is too much bother for them. Not only did they book us in at short notice after a disastrous episode at the Holiday Inn at Newark airport, they went out of their way to make our stay both welcoming and enjoyable. The room was clean comfortable with everything you need for a short stay. You can leave your valuables in the safe without worrying about them. La Quinta is situated within a few steps of the Empire State Building and Times Square, Broadway, Madison Sq Garden & Macy's are a few minutes away. The only small annoyance was we could not open the window, but it had air conditioning so it wasn't a real problem. I have already reccommended the La Quinta to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location! Great service.”
Reviews.Author: DianeNiagaraFalls_NY
Reviews.Content: We were in NYC for the St Pat's Day parade. We had a lovely time at this hotel. It was convienient to everything. When we checked in the front desk staff were very friendly and courteous. We were offered a front or rear room. We opted for the rear so it would be quiet and we weren't disappointed. The view was of another building but that didn't bother us at all. It was very quiet and didn't hear any noise at all at night. The only trouble we had was when we went to get our car from the parking garage they told us it was not part of the discount with this hotel. My husband told them that when we parked our car we were told that it was by the attendant, he ended up getting us the discount anyways. Be sure that you ask specifically which parking lot is the one that offers the discount. That was not the hotel's fault. Our room was small but very comfortable and spotless. The bed is out of this world. The shower was great! Wonderful water pressure and the water was hot. We didn't eat the free breakfast so I can't comment on that. The high speed was okay but a little sporatic, but that happens at all hotels. I will definately stay here again when we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “central location in Manhattan but...”
Reviews.Author: 2Rock
Reviews.Content: We spend 4 days at the hotel for a little stop-by from Germany . Basically the hotel is quite ok because the location is so central that you can reach everything within 15 min in Manhattan by using subway. Unless you are not stying at the 12th floor next to the ice-machine you also will be able to have a good night. So avoid the 12th floor - or even all equal numbered floors where ice-machines are located - as i heared (but maybe I am wrong). Breakfast was quite moderate, kind of coffee-to-go atmosphere but very convenient. The cleanliness was also good, maids made a good job. But now the little shady side: we got a little subtenant in our room: a mouse. This one entered the trash box and also the handbag of my girlfriend because there were some almonds located.
