We were disturbed in sleeping during the last night because of the action of this animal. Perhaps they will do sth. about it - at least we gave the hint at the reception and to the maid. Nevertheless we would recommend this hotel even because of this little discomfort - it was quite avarage and compared to european standards between 2* and 3*.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitly stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: pokerplayer26
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at La Quinta from March 5th through March 8th and had a very good experience. After reading some of the past reviews I have to admit I was a little weary but was pleasantly suprised! The staff were very friendly. The room was a little small, but very clean. The bed was comfortable and you really cannot beat the location! I really liked the fact that after we checked out we were able to store our bags there while we finished up our exploration of the city. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a great deal along with great location!

Reviews.Title: “great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: mickeykitty
Reviews.Content: La Quinta was in a great location, about 1/2 block from Herald Square and the subway. $131 for a room with 2 queen beds can't be beat. The beds were very comfortable temperpeautic mattresses too! The free breakfast and internet added to the value and if you looked out the window and WAAAY up high, you could see the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “2 stars not 3”
Reviews.Author: ElleSD
Reviews.Content: I stayed at many La Quintas across the US, but this has to be the worst one. It was marked as a three star (Expedia, priceline) but I would give it a two. The lobby is nice and it is in a fabulous location...easy to jump on a subway, by the Empire State Bldg, etc... BUT I was dissapointed of the size of the room....very small....and it's overall condition...very outdated...tiny bathroom...not to mention the sink was held up by a 2by4. The pluses were....nice staff, decent breakfast, and LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION...loved getting pizza on the nearby corner @1am and walking around the town. At $250 a night...this was considered a bargain for Manhattan???...maybe a local could steer you in a better direction!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Nory0109
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Quinta from Dec 28 to Jan 4. I was with my daughter and a cousin. When I booked it , they didnÂ´t have a double bed room available, so we had to stay in a king bed room with a rollaway bed, until a bigger room was available for us. The first room was clean and comfortable, even though a little bit small for the three of us, but then , a few days later we were able to move to the other room, with two double beds. It was a big and nice room.It was a bit dark because it was in the 2nd floor and it didnÂ´t get much light from outside the window, but it was ok anyway.The breakfast was good , as usual. IÂ´ve already been to other hotels from the same company, and they are all very similar. I guess ' La Quinta' is the only one of the five hotels that wasnÂ´t renovated, but the rooms are nice and clean. The location is fabulous! You have the Empire State Building, stores like Victoria Secret, Gap, the Manhattan Mall, Macy's just a few steps away from the hotel. There is a nice deli called ' Speedy's' where we had many meals. The staff was always very friendly. When I was trying to book a room by email, the manager was very thoughtful , replying all my emails promptly. Everything went well during our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms don't seem clean”
Reviews.Author: dougly
Reviews.Content: location is good if you want to be close to Time Square and the Empire State Building. It is in the middle of Koreatown. Personally, I prefer more residential neighborhoods of NYC (e.g. Chelsea, Upper West Side). The staff was nice- allowed us to check in early (at 12:30pm). Our room did not smell clean. The bathroom had no heat- it was freezing in the morning. The bathroom also looked like it had not been updated in 10-15 years. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal I've ever experienced in a Manhattan Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Engos
Reviews.Content: Best location. Friendliest stuff I've ever experienced. Clean room, though small. Best deal I could have ever expected for a 1 night stay with spouse & 2 kids, where evth. needs to be as quick and close to the hotel as possible.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: pburko
Reviews.Content: The LaQuinta Manhattan is an "ok" hotel. Location is "ok", not the greatest area but there is a subway stop right at the corner of the block so that makes it really easy to get to where you want to be. The rooms are "ok", pretty small but not terrible, however our non-smoking room really smelled like smoke. The breakfast is "ok", although any free breaksfast in NY is a plus, this is very basic: cold cereal, bagels, fruit. All in all, for the price it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for reasonable price )”
Reviews.Author: korob
Reviews.Content: Great location for reasonable price cozy and clean rooms you can walk to many famous sight seeings empire state building is next to you also breakfest is good reason to stay in this hotel coz most of the hotels in NY doesn't include it in price a lot of korean restourants on the 32 street coz it's called korea way also pizzas and buritos not so far

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronb89
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel rooms are a bit small but clean and well kept, early check in was nice too ,the guy working the breakfast room was very rude , I had taken some items from the breakfast table up to our room , my wife and daughter were getting ready to go, when i went back down for coffee the guy asked me if i could read, at first i was like what did he say to me then he said you cant see the sign it says dont bring food items to room , 1st off Ican read and 2nd I didnt see the sign , I just looked at him like what an [--] well other then that stay was good

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HOLLYB91
Reviews.Content: We checked arrived at 1130am and the hotel allowed us to check-in early gave us a room that looked directly at the Empire State Building beautiful at night. The only thing wrong with this room was there was a ice machine right outside of the door so every time someone got ice we heard it all night long. We changed rooms the next day got another room with a nice view. Hotel provides a very nice breakfast which saves you money on one meal a day. Beds are VERY comfortable, didn't like the window in the shower felt like I was showering in front of all of New York. Front desk was very accomodating and friendly had no problems will definitely stay again and recommend this hotel highly. Very clean and great location subway station very close.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for NYC”
Reviews.Author: MJTT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 08. This hotel had the best rate <200/night for any hotel in the Manhattan area. Very close to Times Square and Penn Station. Opened the window and saw the side of the Empire State building. The rooms are old and needs updating but well maintained. The free breakfast is OK but the eating room gets crowded. Good to have a outdoor rooptop bar with a great view of the Empire State Building in the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location ! :)”
Reviews.Author: liljapus
Reviews.Content: We came back today after spending 3 nights in this hotel. We had a great time, the location is the best, the subway is right outside, along with 5. avenue and many other shopping streets! The staff were very polite and helpful, and the cleaning lady was really cute, I think her name was India? :) The breakfast included was nice to have when we woke up early and starving! Bagels, tea, donuts, cereals +++... All you need! Our room was ok in size, and the bed was comfy with clean and fresh linen. We will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling conditions”
Reviews.Author: avidtraveler22043
Reviews.Content: What a dump...avoid at all costs. This hotel and staff is worst I have ever come across. No water, a broken sink, no heat, pubic hair on floor and bed, and a short walk on the carpet turned my girlfriends socks black. The hotel staff could not be more incompetent and rude. Do yourself a favor and sleep on the street first. I hear the dumpster near 32nd and Broadway has a nicer view than the dirty massage parlor directly across from my window.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: sundboell
Reviews.Content: Very mediocre hotel; scruffy and dirty reception area, small and old rooms with nothing in terms of views. Amongst the cheaper rates you can in Manhattan, though, short of going to a hostel. Good location right next to the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Flipper1ohio
Reviews.Content: I travel to NY on a regular basis and continue to struggle with finding a reasonable rate for a reasonable room. This is the closest that I have come. The room sizes are similar to other NY hotels (small) and could use some updating. That aside, its clean, comfortable and the staff is excellent, Specifcially Ronica and Marjerie who work the front desk in the am. They are terrific. As mentioned this is not the Ritz, but it is conveniently located, reasonably priced (for NYC) and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: queenm365
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home having stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. This is our 4th year in a row staying in this hotel. As a group of girls on a weekend shopping trip it fits the bill perfectly. We have stayed in many different rooms over the years and each time have found them sufficient for our needs. Having stayed in two other hotels locally the rooms in manhattan for this price are generally small but the rooms at La Quinta are well equiped and clean. The staff at reception are always polite and helpful and on one occassion when my mobile phone charger didnt work they searched until they found me one that was compatible to my phone for me to use for the duration of my stay. This year on our annual visit when we arrived the room we were given only had one bed and was very small. When we returned to reception to explain that we had booked a room with two beds we were told that there had been a problem with the online booking system but it was since sorted. We had booked the room through a website rather than with the hotel directly which we normally do, so perhaps this was partly the problem. The manager on duty that dealt with us was called Victor and was most pleasant and professional. He told that there was no other room available that night but they could offer us another room and promptly took us to the 14th floor. The room we were given was what they called the penthouse! Although it still had just one bed they promptly offered to set up another bed for us. The room in New York standards was huge. It had a very large bed with ample space for a second twin bed and a sofa/table and chairs. The bathroom had a large double walk in shower, jacuzzi and double washand basins, although the room is quiet outdated and the drawer units had the knobs missed on two drawers it was perfect for girls who have a lot of suitcases! The downside of this room is that it is located right next door to the bar, which is open till 1am. However as we never planned on being in bed before that hour it didnt effect us in any way. One night we were in the room before the bar closed and it was very noisy so I doubt that you would get any sleep before the 1am closing time, but if you come all the way to New York they why would you want to be in bed early in a city that never sleeps?! Breakfast is included in the price of the room and is again totally acceptable. Throughout our stay Victor enquired as to how we were enjoying our trip and if the room was satisfactory. We were never charged anything extra for the upgrade which was greatly appreciated. We have recommended this hotel to many people who have also stayed and all commented on its cleanliness and location. It is only a short stroll from Penn Station and most importantly Macys! There are also some lovely places to eat nearby to suit all tastes. While the rooms are generally on the small size they are no smaller than other hotels in this location and represent good value for money. The hotel also offer a shuttle bus to and from the airport which is a lot cheaper than getting a taxi. No doubt next year when we are again planning our trip to New York we will again be staying with La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: 2BCgirls
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta was recommended in the economy accomodations section of the Fromers travel guide that I purchased. My girlfriend and I were on a shopping/sightseeing getaway and we were really pleased with the hotel. It was in a great central location 1/2 block from Broadway and close to the subway and walking distance to lots of attractions. Clean rooms, comfortable bed and compared to other hotels we looked at it was economical but not short on style. We were on the 8th floor facing the street and did not hear any street noise in the night. The continental breakfast that was included in the price was the basics but more than adequate. I would stay here again. The Martinique around the corner on 32nd and Broadway is a great place to eat. Good portions and by New York prices reasonable. Burgers, paninis etc $10. Open 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “I thought about not writing this at all . . .”
Reviews.Author: OneMaryland
Reviews.Content: It's ridiculously hard to find a decent budget hotel in Manhattan, especially one that is only a couple of blocks from Penn Station, so I was holding my breath as I walked to the LaQuinta. It's in the middle of a block of 34th St. that is called "Korea Way," literally surrounded by dozens of Korean restaurants, karaoke bars, spas, not to mention a Pinkberry on one side and their "tangy frozen yogurt" competitor Red Mango. The price was right, the small lobby was lovely, the room was tiny but clean and well-maintained, and the AC worked. What more could I ask? I really did think about keeping this secret to myself, because all the inexpensive hotels shoot up in price as their business increases -- but what the hey, why not share the wealth! If you're budget minded, and care about cleanliness (but not so much about lovely decor) this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst La Quinta I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jockadog
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a mid-town name-brand hotel for under $300 (barely) per night. When La Quinta fit this criteria I figured it would work for me. I was wrong. Here is the short list of things wrong on my 2 night stay... 1. No hot water first morning at 6:30 AM (I was told to let it run a few minutes...I did this for over 5 minutes and all I got was lukewarm water). At 7:00 AM the hot water showed up, but too late. 2. Tub drain slow...took my lukewarm shower standing in 3 inches of water 3. Cordless phone handset did not work. Speaker phone worked. 4. Message button on desk phone not programmed correctly. Called front desk and told to dial "40" for messages (why have a "message" button?) 5. Clock/radio (iHome) time not set correctly. Apparently no easy way for customer to adjust. 6. TV remote control - power button did not work. Had to get out of bed to turn TV on/off. 7. Room very small 8. Front desk staff spoke English as a second language...difficult to understand instructions for messages, internet access, etc. 9. Limited breakfast choices (compared to other La Quintas) 10. Water in toilet cloudy with sediment on first day 11. Insufficient electrical outlets around desk and in room in general 12. Given nonsense promotional welcome package that included commercial items of limited interest. Apparently this La Quinta were being paid to distribute these for the vendor. This was not a La Quinta promotion. I will not stay at this La Quinta again. It does not meet La Quinta standards. Price not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: crabgroupie
Reviews.Content: This is an adequate hotel for a reasonable NYC price. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and adequate if all you want is a place to sleep. Breakfast was fine. The rooftop bar is a lively place. The only negative is that it is located on Korea Street - not the cleanest street in the world but perfectly safe. It is 1/2 block from the subway, close to Penn Station and many tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sjuda
Reviews.Content: Helpful staff and convenient midtown location. Free breakfast, pleasant and clean rooms. The closets could be bigger though! Loads of Korean restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Niky & Dasy”
Reviews.Author: niki477
Reviews.Content: Just want to say to everybody this hotel is allfull,we ll never come back.The stuff is unfriendly ,the service terribly ,the breakfast restaurant is very ,very small and breakfast is not enough for nobody .For this price 260$ per night we eat in the paper plates and drunk cups .It s ridiculous.The duties to the doorman are to help to the customers with the laguage ,but even after our riquest he did not help us.In New York are many amasing hotels but this is the worst we ever see.

Reviews.Title: “Great place....But...”
Reviews.Author: Hookasales
Reviews.Content: This property is in a great location in litle korea town.. the rooms are on the small size but hey its for sleeping anyway. beds are comfortable and very clean but the one hich in this place is EXTREAMLY poor reception for cel phones or at the least if you have t-mobile fugetaboutit it sucks unless you get a room faceing the street. missed many appts. due to bad reception. but asked to move rooms second day and problem was fixed. other than that I think it is a great value overall. ohhh yea the bar upstairs is way way over priced

Reviews.Title: “Affordable rate, terrible service, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: alj1979
Reviews.Content: If I could give this place zero stars I would. The only thing good about this place is the location. It's ideally placed close to Penn Station and 34th Street subway stops. It's in the middle of New York so it's easy to get to via the subway, cab or shuttle. The reason I'm giving this a terrible review is the fact that they screwed up our room not once, but four times when we arrived. That alone is unacceptable. The guy at the front desk didn't do anything to accommodate us, neither did the manager. Here's what happened. My friend and I arrived just after midnight Saturday morning. We were guaranteed a late check in so we figured we'd have no problem upon arrival. Haha that's funny. We arrive and they tell us there's a problem with our room so they upgraded us to a bigger room...what they didn't tell us that it had one bed (we clearly said we wanted two beds) and it was next to the bar. Um...first of all, my friend was sick, second of all, we actually wanted to sleep. So we go back downstairs and request another room. The guy up front says no problem. We get to this room and we unlock the door only to find LUGGAGE AND PEOPLE in it already. The TV was blaring and everything. Luckily, there weren't people in there doing things half naked or something that could've been embarrassing. So we go downstairs with our luggage again. The guy tries to fix the situation but this time he puts us in a smoking room that was so tiny, a rollaway couldn't fit in there! This time, we're pretty annoyed, tired, cranky and pissed off. So we go downstairs again in the slow as molasses elevator and explain to the guy we want a comp room because a) they screwed it up so many times b) we didn't technically stay for "Friday" and c) they never really fixed the situation because it was almost two o'clock in the morning by the time we got a decent room. All we got was the runaround from the moment we checked in. We have the guy call his manager because there wasn't one on duty, he tried to find us another room at one of their other Apple Core Hotels because that's what good management does. They usually offer to pay the fee for the night and put you up somewhere else. Not this place. We had the option of a) having them WALK US to another hotel at 2 effin' AM in NYC and taking a small fee off our bill b) finding us another room giving us our regular AAA discount plus $50. We settled for another room with a roll away with the plan b arrangement. They finally got us to our room, but it still wasn't worth the trouble. I'm definitely sending a letter to the CEO to at least get a comp room for that first night. It made the start of our trip lousy...At least we finally got the room we requested for the rest of our stay because they really would've heard from us again. And trust me, it takes a lot to piss us off. The continental breakfast is OK but nothing special and neither are the rooms. They're overpriced for the "quality." Don't do it unless you're desperate. Go somewhere else and pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: NorthEastRailfan
Reviews.Content: If I returned it shews that I was not unhappy first time round last year. As I commented last time it is not the typical La Qinta in its own grounds with very spacious rooms. But you cannot expect that at a reasonable price in Manhattan. My wife is very fastidious and we have no complaints about cleanliness. The linen is clean and the bathroom, though small, kept spotless. The rooms do tend to be decorated in rather dowdy wallpaper, which can become scuffed around the doors and peel slightly in the bathrooms. This can lead to an initial downbbeat impression. This time we were on the 4th floor witha view of the street; last year we overlooked the light shaft. It was more pleasant but we did not spend time looking out of it! To live in the hotel room is surely not why most able-bodied travellers visit Manhattan! The major gripe I had last year was the reception desk staff. This year a complete change. Personable staff who smiled and actually communicated with guests. The telephone seemed to have been re-routed elsewhere too, which meant they could concentrate on dealing with guests. The breakfast must be one of the best complimentary ones going, particularly now the waffle makers, for which guests refused to follow the instructions, have been discarded. The room is perhaps too small for the numbers in the hotel, but it too is kept clean, well stocked and pleasantly managed. We too were using Return Points and there was no feeling of being given second best. With so much still to see and do in New York I am sure we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EBJUppsala
Reviews.Content: We just visited US and stayed for a few nights at the hotel. The room was quite small with two qeen beds with not much space to put your luggage, and a small bathroom. This was however very well compensated by the very good location: two blocks from Empire state buildning just in between Broadway/6th street and 5th street. The breakfast was the best during our 3 week holiday with cereals, bagels, toast, egg, fruit, several drinks, yoghurt, donuts etc. We highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Safe Location”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego82
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I traveled to NYC for the first time and wanted a hotel in a central location in Manhattan, but also something affordable. We stayed at the La Quinta for 5 days/4 nights. This hotel is in the middle of Korea Town and was a great location. It was walking distance to Times Square and Rockefeller Center, around the corner from the Empire State Building, plus it was easily accessible via the metro. There was a continental breakfast every morning, and while the cereal was stale, the juice was watered down and the milk was spoiled one morning, the bagels and yogurt weren't bad so we found enough snacks to get our day started. There were many markets within a block or two so we could always grab something to eat. The room was small (the queen sized bed took up most of the room) but it worked out fine since we weren't hanging out in the hotel except to sleep. Bathroom was a little dingy, but clean. The staff were friendly and we felt safe. Plus there was a cute roof-top bar with a view of the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: oguni
Reviews.Content: Great location above all ! And good cost performance. * very close to some subway stations. * H-mart super market is next to the hotel. (It would be very, very convenient especially for Asians!) * very close to Empire state building. (and many souvenir shops, as well) The only thing that I want to say is... I wish I could have had a refrigerator in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Great room "That is all you need"”
Reviews.Author: Ctower
Reviews.Content: La Quinta hotels is almost all I use at work and at play and it will stay that way. We used Return points to go to New York for 4 nights ( Wenesday - Sunday morning). I was not sure if the free rooms deal would get us the "free room Deal" What we got was a very nice place to go to after the long days out and about the the city that near sleeps. New York City--- What a town and The Manhattan La Quinta was a very nice Hotel. Pro: Location Cons: Internet weak on floor 12. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “New York's SLOWEST Elevators, Otherwise Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1NicePerson
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel using LaQuinta Returns points and very pleased overall Room cleanliness was top notch. As the previous reviewer noted, the bathroom sink encroaches on the toilet but it's a century old building and bathrooms are on the small side. Overall the room was very comfortable and the housekeeping excellent. Don't think you'll find a cleaner room anywhere. Breakfast was nice too and the location of the hotel is quite convenient. Major shortcoming, however, is with the elevators. They move SLOWLY, very very slowly. While two elevators should be more than adequate for a hotel of this size, these two elevators move at about one-third the speed of a normal elevator. Hence there are long waits, even at 1 o'clock in the morning! If you're looking for a fast-paced "New York minute" trip, the elevators here will certainly disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in NYC”
Reviews.Author: onemoreroad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for free using LQ points, but was pleased to read the reviews before I stayed there. What a find! I'll be returning when in NYC on a budget. Location - near subway stops, Madison Square Garden and Macy's. Lots of inexpensive restaurant options nearby. The hotel in in the midst of Korean restaurants, but I enjoyed walking by and looking in the windows - and buying an ice cream at one market. Room - a very nice moderate-range hotel room. Very clean and good maid service. Pluses - LOVED the free wifi - and the access to computers to printers in the Business Center. Those came in very handy for printing out show tickets and directions. Liked the roof-top bar. Great option for traveling on a moderate budget in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; not great service”
Reviews.Author: kareningeorgia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at a great location: it was right by Macy's Herald Square and right in Little Korea. The subway was one block away. The service wasn't great at the hotel; they didn't care to even try to assist us in checking in early, but the room was large by NYC standards. The breakfast was good; saved us money from eating out. I can't say enough good things about the location, especially for the price. I would stay there again. We were hardly in the room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: LiveInMyCar
Reviews.Content: I work in NYC and live in NJ so when I have to stay in the city late or when my boyfriend comes in from VT, I get a hotel room. This is by far the best place we've stayed in so far. I'm a girl that grew up on the Plaza and the Waldorf, but now that I'm footing the bill, its a different story. Yes, the rooms are small, but they are NOT Paris-small, if you want a big room, get a smaller bed. The place was immaculate. And for the price we paid, we could not have asked for anything more. Yes, the elevator is really really slow, but take the stairs! Its not like its a 40-story building. The staff was AMAZING and helpful. With any hotel, do some research first. Don't come on sites like this and complain because you didn't know that your hotel is in Korea Town when you could have found that out in under 20 seconds on the internet. And no, the whole hotel does not smell like Korean food...

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: UruKiwi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel so that we could visit the Licensing Expo at the Convention Center. The hotel was a 20 minute walk from the convention center, so suited us perfectly. We chose La Quinta because we are members of their Club, "Returns". We were given a king size room, on the 6th floor. It was perfectly satisfactory for our needs - in fact, our room was on a corner and was quite large. The bed was great (as we often find at La Quinta properties); the bathroom was small but very clean; the location was excellent, and our room was very quiet even though we faced Korean Way. Double Glazing helps ! My only complaint is the price - two nights cost us more than $600, including taxes, which is outrageous. I tried priceline and hotwire but was unable to get any other hotel even close to that price though, so perhaps there were many other things happening in the Big Apple besides the (rather small) Licensing Expo.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and unacceptable receptionist”
Reviews.Author: Barendam
Reviews.Content: General: In the past I stayed at the La Quinta hotel at the Ontario airport in California. There I had the most wonderful stay. I told a friend about it and because of that he stayed at the La Quinta in Santa Rosa New Mexico and had a very pleasant stay as well. Those experiences moved the La Quinta chain clearly up on our lists of hotel-preferences. That's also why I booked the La Quinta again in Manhattan. Accessibility. The hotel is very close to a number of subway stations, which makes it very accessible. Room: I had a room with a queen-size bed. The room was about 5 x 5 meters, which I consider the minimum. I come from Europe where hotel-rooms are often smaller. If this is the minimum for me, then I expect it to be too small for most Americans. The bathroom was 3 x 1.5 meters, which I found too small. The room had one window only and it was situated in a corner of the room. This made the room dark and I find dark rooms unpleasant. I always had to have a lamp on. Gym: The gym had a number of cardio machines. I had hoped for weight- lifting material but those weren't there. Internet: There's wireless Internet in the hotel, but that only worked good enough in the lobby. In the room I would sometimes have normal Internet connection, then it would disappear (while I didn't change a thing), and after a while the connection would be back. That way you can't really work on the Internet. Going to the lobby and work on the Internet there should be an alternative, but there's often a draft because people are constantly going in and out of the lobby. The televisions with the news channels in the lobby disturb you while working on your notebook. If the televisions are off there's guitar music playing constantly, which can be a distraction. It's the same song playing over and over again, which makes the distraction worse. Therefore, going on the Internet in the lobby isn't an opton either. Surroundings: The nearest subway station was at the corner of the block, really close-by, which was very nice. There are lots of Korean good restaurants in the area. If you like shopping (LOL, which I don't :-) ), then Macy's is two blocks away, and Manhattan Mall is one block away. Reception: When I checked in the receptionist was unfriendly. Even though I had paid the total bill for my entire stay of 6 nights in cash at arrival, the receptionist still wouldn't accept an international driver's license as an ID, although it met all the requirements he mentioned. While at reception (!) he actually made me go through my luggage to find my passport, even though I had told him several times that I didn't know where I had put it. Although I travel a lot, this had never ever been an issue before (not even in the La Quintain in Los Angeles). He even had the guts to say that he wasn't obliged to let me into the hotel if I didn't show a passport. When I had half of my suitcase unpacked (in order to search for my passport), he complained about the contents of my suitcase being displayed in public, while it was him in the first place who had demanded me to do so. To be frank, I think that this man should find another job. Housekeeping: The personnell that cleaned my room were clearly different. They were nice and helpful. My compliments to them. Conclusion : Would I go there again? Don't hold your breath for it. The current experience moved the La Quinta OFF my list of hotel-preferences. Before submitting this review I sent it to the La Quinta main office in Irving, Texas in February this year to give them an opportunity to correct the situation, but there was no reply whatsoever. About me: I am a male in his fourties from Europe. I travel several times a year and often to the United States. In 2007 I stayed in least in 8 different hotels. Since the extra luxury of the upscale hotels isn't important to me I try to avoid them.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: marianne219
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at the La Quinta Manhattan from the 12 - 19 May 08 and were disappointed. The water was shut off on the Saturday afternoon. A sign was posted in the lift saying that we would not have water between 1 and 3 pm We returned to the hotel at around half past 3 to discover that we had no water. We reported this to the front desk and they kept passing the buck saying it would be on in half hour. It was off till around half 10 at night. We couldnt shower, use the bathroom or make a cup of coffee in this time. The staff really didnt care. We were checking out on the Monday morning and asked to speak to the manager at around 9am. We were told he was in the hotel but they didnt know where he was. This went on until half 11 and we had been down 5 times!!!! In the end my fiance was told to go find the manager in his office in the basement?? For our inconvenience we stated that we were not happy paying for Saturday night but were happy to pay for the other nights we had stayed there. He knocked 30 dollars off the total bill which was more of an insult and gave the attitude that he couldnâ€™t be bothered to do anymore. We found it appalling that we had an issue we wanted to raise with the manager and we had to chase him instead of him coming to the front desk. He told us to take the matter up with the la Quinta chain which I have done but they have since ignored my email The hotel also has a friendly note in the room saying ask about our late checkout which we asked about and considering on average we had paid about $250 per night they were going to charge us $315 to use the room for an extra 4 hours. We didnâ€™t take them up on this. On getting our final bill which was minus $30 we noticed that we had been charged 3 different sets of fees and taxes per night. When asked what the Javits convention fee was the receptionist could only tell me that it was a government charge then she later mentioned it was a charge for our keys?? but on researching this cannot find anything to say that this is a compulsory charge. Therefore they added on $1.50 per night on top of the sales tax and occupancy tax. Overall the staff were not in the slightest bit helpful, the manager was rude and incompetent and his lack of management experience turned what would have been a good review into a bad review and we will not be staying at any of these hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Most likely would NOT stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Blureindrawps
Reviews.Content: My Start: This was my first time in NY (Manhattan) and I just spent a few days in Washington DC. Traveled using the Amtrak from DC to Manhattan, so it helped that Penn Station was about three blocks from the hotel. Rolling my 26 inch suitcase wasnâ€™t too bad. Pro: The hotel was close to many points of interest which was nice (Empire State Building, Penn Station, Subway , Macys, etc). I didnâ€™t have a great view from my window but you can see part of the Empire State Building. Con: Front desk staff was rude when I checked in. NOTE: Make sure you show your AAA card when checking in, if you booked using your membership. I forgot to and the front desk gave me a story about how foreigners book using AAA rates not knowing what it is, therefore the customer must show the card when checking in. I guess I was lucky in DC because they gave me the AAA rates without showing them my card (Doubletree Hotel Washington DC - nice hotel). It wasnâ€™t too much of a rate difference and the regular rate was charged for only one day since I realized it, so more or less it was the principle of the fact. Location (fyi): The hotel is located in Midtown Manhattan on 32nd Street which is also Korean Way (Koreatown). Lots of Korean foods, even Pinkberry, ATMâ€™s, some hotels like the Radisson Martinique and small shops. Itâ€™s a busy street, night or day. My Room (Single queen size bed--non smoking): Much smaller then anticipated and bathroom was very cramped. The building is on the older side and my room did have a funny odor. But since I wasnâ€™t in the room much and I didnâ€™t have any bug or rodent problems, it was tolerable for me. This was the best that I could do for the location, budget and the time frame I was traveling. Most likely would NOT stay here again. This was just my experience with this particular hotel. Hope it helps.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: lgreene9
Reviews.Content: Being a first time NY visitor, I wanted to be at a good central location, THIS was IT! Empire state building was less than a block from the front door! Subway station, 1-minute walk from hotel! Our room was small, but we had plenty of room. No one spends much time in their room in ny anyway. Our room was clean, smelled fresh, and had everything we needed. Housekeeping staff was especially helpful and polite. We will definitely stay here again. Just a quick note aboute new yorkers.... we think they get a bad rap. Everyone that we asked for directions or advice, bent over backwards to help us! A big thanks to them!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta Manhattan-not as advertised! stayed April 2-5, 2008”
Reviews.Author: memberinSeattle
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation based in great part on the availability of wireless in the rooms. The wireless worked about 30 minutes of the three night stay. Despite their claim (on the in-room TV menu) that they will "make things right or your night is free", they did not do so. When I checked out, I asked about an adjustment on my bill due to the lack of internet, and was told to email the manager. When I arrived home, I emailed, I also called and left a voicemail. No one EVER answered either message. For the record, I would have been satisfied with a token adjustment, but for them to not even have the courtesy to reply to my concerns was not cool. I would never recommend this hotel or any of the others in the Apple Core chain to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “A Cultural Experience!”
Reviews.Author: vsikes5
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my 2 daughters. We chose this location on a tip my daughter heard about Apple Core Hotels. We have stayed at many La Quinta's in the past and are familiar with the accomodations they offer. And we were pleased. We had been told that if you stay too near Time Square, it is very noisy, so this location is great. We had a room on the 7th floor with 2 beds, and although with 3 women getting ready in the mornings, it was a bit challenging. The bathroom is very short on counter space, we moved the mirror to the desk and made a hair and makeup station! The breakfast area is kept stocked and clean throughout the hours of 7-10am. Being located in little Korea was nice because it added to our cultural experience of visiting Chinatown and Little Italy too. But the location is great! We learned our way by subway, walked to to the Broadway show, central park,Times Square. It is near everything! When we come back we will definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: sumida
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights in New York. The hotel's overall rating position does not do it justice and more recent reviews have reported positive experiences. Following advice from previous reviews I had requested a higher room and away from the lifts and these wishes were taken into account. Check in was very quick and the room (a double) whilst not large was certainly big enough for two adults with a few suitcases. We booked direct with the hotel and were able to take advantage of reciprocal membership of the AAA car association which provided us with an additional discount.The room was clean, everything worked and the bathroom was spotless. We were spoilt for television choices with over 40 channels to select from. As previous reviewers have commented the lifts are slow but that is only a minor flaw. The breakfast room was well patronised and a good breakfast had each day. The only down side to our room was its location near the ice machine which are on just some floors and why people would want ice in the early hours of the morning beats me, but it will wake you up if you are near it. Plenty of Korean places to eat out in near the hotel but beware US plate sizes are much larger than in Australia and you may not need to order as much as you would if back home. Overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta was comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra88
Reviews.Content: The LA Quinta Hotel was just what we needed. It was a great location, we walked to the hotel from Penn Station. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The lobby, while small, was adequate. The room was very clean and this is important to us. The room was small but it was all we needed. The continental breakfast was very good. There were many choices and there was an attendant taking care of everything and keeping it tidy. We would recommend this hotel and if we return to New York we would stay at La Quinta.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in NY”
Reviews.Author: hachimachi
Reviews.Content: We've had good luck with La Quintas elsewhere in the US, so my family decided to try Manhattan location. We were pleasantly surprised with our stay. First, and most importantly, the room was very large (by NY standards) with additional space not near the beds. There were five of us, so that was very welcome. The room was clean and everything worked well, save for the inconsistent shower temps. We were on the 12th floor, where it was quiet and we had an awesome view of the Empire State Building. The Breakfast was great, as was the location. The price wasn't cheap, but fair given the location. We would stay there again- get a courtyard view!

Reviews.Title: “look for something else!”
Reviews.Author: benauskoeln
Reviews.Content: Small, dirty rooms. Much to expensive! After a room change I'm sitting here right in front of the rattling ice machine and the smell of a fast food restaurant at the other side. It's better to stay at home!

Reviews.Title: “Easter in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: HazelWEurope
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel specifically for the location and because I loved the idea of having a rooftop bar. We arranged our stay to coincide with friends and thought this would be an ideal place to have an early drink before stepping out. We were not disappointed the view was fantastic and the barman (I think he was called Julian) was a real character. We ended up spending a great deal of time socialising there. We arrived late and were checked into a room that was very small. We asked at the desk to be changed and although there were no rooms available that night (it was a very busy holiday period) we were given a much bigger room the next day. We found the people on reception were very friendly. The hotel breakfast room was always busy (again it was the holiday season) but as we were in New York we wanted to go out to experience the Deli breakfast culture, so this was not a problem. The hotel location was fantastic, it was in walking distance to all of the main attractions and only a short walk to the subway. With reference to some of the other hotel guests reviews I would agree that the hotel is in need of a little TLC but from my point of view overall it was a pleasant experience. Good find, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & family affordable”
Reviews.Author: 5Shoes
Reviews.Content: My family and I had never visited the Big Apple before this trip. We were skeptical because we heard the rooms at many New York hotels were tiny and dirty, and that the staffs were often rude and unresponsive. We were very pleasantly surprised by the La Quinta in Manhattan. Our room was at least the same size as other hotels in less crowded cities. It was clean and there were 2 queen size beds (which were a must, but almost impossible to find in the city!). Our room was missing the shower curtain upon arrival. I called the desk and they said someone would be up to correct this. I waited about 20 min. and called again. The clerk was apologetic and said someone would be there immediately. And guess what...they were! The breakfast was great every morning. It was so helpful that we didn't have to spend time finding a restaurant for breakfast and waiting for service. There were bagels, cereal, coffee, tea, fruit, donuts, yogurt, etc. which offered something for everyone in our family. Don't get me wrong - if you're looking for and can afford the Waldorf-Astoria- you may not want to stay here. We also didn't pay $400 - $500 per night either. If you want a reasonable price for a clean, well-maintained, pleasantly run hotel, this is the place for you. We were there to sightsee and wanted a clean, safe place to stay. We got more than we expected. Everyone from housekeeping to concierge to the person keeping the breakfast items stocked to the manager was friendly and helpful. Even if my husband and I go back w/o children, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: TonyFLondon
Reviews.Content: For anybody thinking of travelling to NYC for a break, this is the place to stay. The location of the hotel means that you can be into Manhattan in around 20 mins or should you need to travel away from town (as we did to visit family) it is equally easy. I travelled with my wife and 2 kids (18 & 20) and we felt safe at all times in the district. For $25 you can buy a weekly pass for the subway and we found this excellent value for money. Around 500 yards down the road from the hotel is a diner called Pete's which I cannot recomend highly enough for breakfast, lunch or dinner. Back to the hotel. The only small gripe I had was that it was a little noisey with guests not respecting others and making excessive noise when coming back in at 12 / 1am. I made a complaint to the front desk which they took very graciously and put a stop to the noise! All in all if you add the $25 travel card to a week's stay it comes nowhere near what is being charged to stay in Manhattan. No need to pay those prices when you can stay at La Quinta!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: MarieGreenwood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Manhatttan Laquinta in November 2007 and I would recommend this location. We found the rooms clean and the staff helpful. The continental breakfast and daily newspapers were a nice bonus. The location is very close to Macy's, subway connections, and MSG. We were pleasantly surprised to be in the heart of little Korea and had great restaurants all along the street many being open 24 hours. We felt safe at this location and I would stay there again. I would like to thank the manager Sunnie for her help in making our stay in New York City great. I look forward to coming back. Yours truly ST.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: TheresaP
Reviews.Content: The room was ok for the price. The room was a bit small and the hallways needed a good paint job. My boyfriend went down to the continental breakfast 10 minutes before they were to close up, but they already had. Outside our window people were screaming at eachother at 6 am and when you are out till 2:30 in the morning thats not something you want to deal with. Even though I know that is out of the hotels hands. Overall for the price, it is a bed and a shower and that is all you really need when you are in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta, Perfect Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: ReginaIreland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Manhattan La Quinta for five nights and I have to say both my husband and I thought is was a perfect place to stay. Just two blocks from Penn Station so you really had the city at your feet. We paid just 130usdollers per night. Breakfast is included in the price, and we stuffed ourselves silly, then at least you could get out and see loads before hunger pangs stopped us. The staff always had a good morning. The rooftop bar is a must see. Great place to go at night to wind down and the suprise is the view of the Empire State Building through the glass. It is fantastic to see the building all lit up while sipping your drink. Rooms were always tidy great cleaning service. Overall have to give this hotel a thumbs up for everything. Had a great time there. Regina.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: Pack_and_Play
Reviews.Content: We booked a non-smoking room for 4 adults 2 months prior to our arrival. We were only staying one night for a concert at the Garden. Cost-$480.00. When we arrived they tried to put us in a smoking room because that was all that was available. They said my reservation was only a preference, not a guarantee. We refused smoking even though they said they would 'spray it real good' . We ended up in a room with a double bed and 2 roll aways. We were wall-to-wall beds. Bathroom had a sink but no vanity... made hair & makeup rituals an adventure...the electrical outlet was on the other side of the toilet. No lid on the toilet and the tank cover sloped. Don't bring a curling iron....too dangerous. Hotel is old but convenient. Staff was pleasant but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Quinn”
Reviews.Author: msdelila
Reviews.Content: After a less than par night down the street at the Radisson Martinique, we decided to switch hotels. I was very pleased with the friendly customer service we received at the front desk. The room was clean and larger than others (by New York Standards) and there is a private bathroom. The room is a bit old looking, but still very nice and comfortable. For the same price as other hotels La Quinta includes a complimentary breakfast, which I thought was amazing! There is fruit, donuts, bagels, toast, juices, coffee, milk, yoghurt and even red bulls. It was quite a good selection, and we were able to leave everymorning with a full tummy and head out and explore the city. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The location is great, just around the corner from the empire state building, near some asian restaurants and near a nice frozen yoghurt place. The street that the hotel is located on is an asian street? (I'm not sure how to say it, but there are many asian stores and restaurants). At the other end of the street there is a subway station. It's also about 5 blocks to the big Macy's. I would stay here again. The cost was something like $220-250 per night, but it's worth the extra dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Evelien_8
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in New York and after seeing pictures of various hotels I was afraid to get a tiny room. But for a great price we got a good sized room. The breakfast was good, there was a perfect staff member who filled everything up before it was gone. People at front desk and shop were also very helpful. Location was very good. The room was a bit warm and if you turn heating off it's quite cold during winter, but it was comfortable enough. We had a great stay! Evelien, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in customer service”
Reviews.Author: amiga1109
Reviews.Content: The hotel manager was not available for us to speak with the entire weekend. It appeared that there was no one "in charge" and could not make any corporate decisions. The restroom on the lower level was dirty, unkept and had graffiti on the hand blower. The "breakfast area" was very cold and everyone was wearing their coats. One of the concierge had to look in her books and map to give us "inaccurate directions". I complained to one of the hotel clerks to no avail and was told that the manager would be in on Monday. When we left in the morning she was no where to be found. Our room wastebaskets went umemptied, the windows were dirty and the bathtub was filthy. The room was in need of updates and a good cleaning. The location was very close to the subway and there were many restaurants within walking distance. I would not recommend anyone stay here unless they expect less than average customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMike33
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us. We just wanted a clean place to stay while we enjoyed the city, and this hotel more than met our needs. The rooms are plain, but decently-sized for a room in the city. The lobby and breakfast area were very nice, but were very crowded at all times. The upstairs bar was very impressive, as was the view of the Empire State Building.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: ell33
Reviews.Content: Our third trip to NY and our first stay at La Quinta. One of the main reasons we decided to book here was the location - a central location near to Penn Station (this was also to our advantage as we flew into Newark and decided to transfer by train) - as you leave the station on 7th it's just a two block walk to the hotel. The hotel is in the Korean district and is surrounded by restaurants and watering holes - the ESB is directly behind the hotel and Macy's is a two minute walk away. There is also a subway 100 yards away - a perfect location. The reception area is small and has a few loungers next to the lift and the small shop - it makes it feel like a friendly place to stay, and indeed the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They also have safety deposit boxes in reception which we took full advantage of. The room itself was basic - a double bed, tv, coffee machine, hair dryer etc. The bathroom appeared to have been updated recently and all in all was a comfortable place to sleep - which after all is all you need in a hotel in NYC, the only time we spent there was when we were sleeping! The 14th floor houses the bar which was small but cosy. An excellent idea as you look out at the ESB as you're supping away! The bar is like a conservatory so you have excellent views, particularly at night. Breakfast was also included. An impressive assortment of cereal, bagels, doughnuts, fruit and youghurts. A member of staff was always available to replenish the food so that it was always available. This was great as you could fill up before walking it all off! There is also a fitness suite there, but I didn't use it so can't comment. In the basement area there is also an internet room. A very nice hotel that I will consider again when I return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: goodadviceBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We had booked into this hotel for two rooms for four people, one a brother and sister. On check in there was only two rooms with double beds. No other room was available and our son slept on the floor. On asking if there was a trundle available the answer was no and if there was a spare mattress were told it was being used. They did however kindly send up a spare bedspread, but not pillow. It was the middle of winter in New York City. No apologies and no discount. The rooms were dark, musty smelling and depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mangymutt_7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our visit to New York,stayed at La Quinta W32 street.Stayed here 2 years ago and decided it is an excellent location and very reasonable breakfast included.It cost us $580 including taxes for 4 nights in a room with two queen beds !Only one tiny problem check in was a bit slow due to the fact the computer system was down.Staff were very courteous room was cleaned daily and towels plentiful.Suggest if travelling from Newark come by rail,$15 single trip comes into Penn Station and two block walk to hotel.We also took trips on the Metro at $2 per trip, one to Coney Island which took about 40 mins.Bubba Gumps on Times Square is a great place to eat,also try the food hall in Grand Central station.Brilliant holiday cant wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “a great find in NY”
Reviews.Author: dpiltd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at La Quinta and have to say what a great find it was ! We paid just $135 per night from the hotel website and with the exchange rate so good, I'd challenge anyone to find better for Â£70 a night inc breakfast. The location was great, across the road from Macys (girlfriend happy) and within walking distance of 42nd st and Times Sq area with Subway at end of street as well. Free internet usage for guests is a plus, the roof top bar is a fantastic location for a post-shop drink to recover - can't be a better view of empire state anywhere. Also, free safe deposit box at reception. Few minor gripes - the lifts must be the SLOWEST anywhere. Our room wasn't cleaned and made up the 1st day and despite repeated requests, we never got any condiments to go with the in room coffee maker. The hot/cold water situation was the main problem - either scalding or freezing, plus the day we left there was no hot water or heating at all because of maintainance. But overall, great location & price. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Horribe Hotel and Extremely Rude Staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I recently statyed at the La Quinta Manhatten property for two nights. This was my first time to stay at a La Quinta in the state of New York. I used my points for the stay. My wife and I were extremely disappointed with the service at the hotel. Upon checking in we were greeted very rudely by Ronica at the front desk. When asking her questions, she would not answer them and made no effort to find out the answer or point me in the right direction. At any hotel, you should have someone at the front desk that can interact well with people. Ronica had no social skills and was extremely rude to my wife and I. We later went down to the concierge desk and asked for directions. The lady there was on the phone with a friend when I asked my questions and she continued to talk in a foreign language to her friend while trying to explain the directions to me. I finally gave up and left and she continued her conversation. I discussed these concerns with the hotel manager and was told that the hotel is operated by union employees. I'm not sure what difference this makes or why this was even mentioned. She did not apologize for my experience and just said she would look into it. Overall, we were very disappointed with the stay and I would never recommend this hotel to anyone in the future. We will definitely not be staying at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: balcorn5
Reviews.Content: We have stayed two times at the La Quinta since our daughter lives nearby. The location is ideal and the price is right. Both of our rooms were quite small, but clean and adequate. The bathrooms were clean but dated. We had no view, but the value made it worthwhile. Elevators are slow; breakfast was more than adequate, although the breakfast room was small. Check in went smoothly. Discounted parking down the block. All in all, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: mes876
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my fiance's mother between Christmas and New Years. After reading some very negative reviews on this site I started second guessing my choice, but in the end it turned out well. The room was exactly what it should have been for the rating and price. It was clean, comfortable and affordable. An unexpected perk was the generous breakfast. At check-in she did overhear some guests complaining about hot water issues at the front desk, but the staff seemed to be addressing them. We later figured out that shower is labeled backwards, so the hot comes out when it is set on cold. Don't be mislead - all NYC hotel rooms are generally small. If you want luxury you have to pay top dollar. I'm sure La Quinta's in other places where real estate isn't so precious are a lot more spacious. As someone who has lived in NYC - the Herald Sq location is excellent for shopping and exploring the city, with the subway just half a block from the hotel entrance. 32nd Street where the hotel is located is known as Koreatown by New Yorkers, but it's hardly the only thing the area has to offer. Macy's, Madison Sq Garden, Penn Station and the Empire State are all very very short walks. My future mother-in-law was very pleased and plans to go back. This hotel is good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Price”
Reviews.Author: Heather_T
Reviews.Content: What a location!!!! If you are debating the Waldorf or this hotel then it's not a fair comparison....the Waldorf bathrooms are gross :). However, if you want a hotel with a decent price, good location and CLEAN. Then this hotel is it! I read reviews and changed hotel reservations 4 times before finally deciding on this location and I'm glad I did. Location: Walking distance to everything! Empire State Bldg two blocks, pick up for the sightseeing double decker busses are around the corner, food and shops all around you, Time Square walking distance, Broadway walking distance, Penn Station walking distance. And by walking distance I mean my 60 year old mother could easily make the trip.It really is a great location. Felt completely safe no matter what time of day or night. (We are from a small town so this is a major change for us....but we felt completely safe in traveling...just 2 women) Hotel: The lobby is nice and the rooms were clean. We had no problem with anything. Rooms are small...but I think all NY rooms are. Are you really going to NY to stay in your room all day? B'fast is called continental for a reason. If you're expecting bacon and eggs then you misunderstood what the description meant. Plenty of food to feed us until lunch. Cereal, oatmeal, fruit, pastries, breads, bagels, juice, coffee and Red Bull. Recommendations: We got a SuperShuttle from airport to hotel and back for $32 roundtrip/per person, highly recommended. We bought the all loops tour on Gray Line Double Decker, hop on and off bus tour for $44 online. Also recommend, they have good guides and it can also be your transportation to different parts of the city. Feel free to email me with questions. I believe this website is a great tool for travelers. I know I use it ALL the time!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BillsMaryland
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Hotel Manhattan is an oasis in the middle of the city. Located on 32nd Street, just off Broadway, the location can't be beat. You are near so much or the subway stop is just down the street. The hotel is very well kept. Free computer useage in the Business Center is a real plus. The " Big Boys " charge as much as $ 20+ per day. The free breakfast in the morning is very tasty and filling. Someone is always present to keep the items fresh and well stocked. The La Quinta is a jewel !!!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrownsPawcatuck
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 other girlfriends stayed at the La Quinta, it was very busy the day we arrived, the staff were helpful, the rooms clean, the breakfast nice (just the basic toast, fruit, cereal etc but very plentiful), the hotel could not have been more central and parking was straight across the road from the hotel what more could you want!!!

Reviews.Title: “A 180 from the reviews on TA”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: After reading multiple reviews regarding rats and rude staff, I was prepared for the worst. Fortunately the stay was nothing but the opposite. The location was easy to get to and perfectly located near the subway, Empire State Building and Macy's. Check-in was friendly and easy. The rooms were dated and only slightly noisy from outside honking. Linens were clean. The bathroom was small but adequate. The breakfast was the best part of the stay - nuts, dried fruit, bagels, doughnuts, muffins, fresh fruit, Red Bull, yogurt, etc. It was over the top and very satisfying. The hotel lobby and stoop were consistenly full like a hostel - lots of folks about. My friend used her LQ points for the stay; not sure that I would pay to stay here but it was not at all like the reviews I had read. The property is only 4-5 doors down from Pinkberry - a great frozen yogurt shop. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “oh no....”
Reviews.Author: lizardn2cats
Reviews.Content: This is going to be a three part review. I'm starting this review as I sit at work, because I wasn't able to check into the hotel as of yet. The rooms were not ready when I arrived at 1:30 PM. No rooms. Zero. Of course, it didn't matter to the front desk at all that I was here for business and I just wanted to secure my room for the night. On top of it all, I had the front desk person tell me that the rooms weren't ready because the maids were on break until 1 PM. Um... it's 1:35 now... where are they, if they aren't back and doing their job? They looked up to see that I was right, but the answer was standard -- come back later. This, after calling the day before, because I had read the reviews on how bad the customer service was and the cleanliness of the rooms. I wanted to find out of this was true or not -- the answer I got when I made that first phone call? "If you are trying to cancel, it's too late, the 24 hour policy is in effect, and we will have to charge you for the room." But... I just wanted to talk to someone about the Tripadvisor reviews. I left them with a comment that they should look on this website and see what's being said. This type of customer service CLEARLY does not make me ever want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “What a nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: slpion
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at about 1am on a Friday morning. I called in advance to make sure my reservation was all set. I was transferred numerous times and when the gentleman finally helped me, he was quite rude. When we arrived at the hotel, we were in line behind three people who were inquiring about renting a room. The front desk man gave them a rate of $200 per night. Howevery, when I rent up to check into my room, which I booked with my travel agent, the hotel refused to honor the price my travel agent had booked at. I had booked the room at a rate of $247, but the man at the front desk stated "it's a very busy weekend, we can't charge that." I found it funny that the couple in front of me were only charged $200. My rate was going to be $404. Because I had no where else to go at 1am in NYC, we checked in. The hallways were filthy. The mirror in front of the elevator had spit on it. And, I mean spit. Our room, was less than clean. The shower had hair in it. The room was very run down. Wallpaper was pealing off the walls. The carpet was so dirty, we didn't walk on it with our bare feet. The curtains were broken and wouldn't shut. We slept about 20 minutes and checked out. Got a better rate at the Radisson Lexington and had a fantastic stay there. I would never stay at this or any La Quinta hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “our stay at la quinta was fine”
Reviews.Author: natjak44
Reviews.Content: As visitors to New York from Ireland we had no problems with our stay in La Quinta Manhattan we got a double room for 2 nights with 2 reservations. one night for $265 the other for $160 .The room was very clean if a little dated,the bathroom was spotless. The breakfast which was included in the price was great,plenty of everything ie cereals,bagels,donuts,yogurts,fruit, even free red bull drinks.The hotel is very central on a very lively street with alot of Korean restaurants, when you leave the hotel turn left for the empire state building a few minutes walk or turn right on leaving hotel for maceys nearby.I would concur with other reviewers that the people on the desk were not very friendly,but i had no real problem with this.In summary i would recommend this hotel for its location and its breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “did not love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: fraidofflying
Reviews.Content: If you don't like Korean food, too bad. This hotel has no other kind of restaurant within blocks. And if you don't like TV blaring at you from every public space except the computer room, don't stay here. Especially if you like a quiet breakfast. If you are concerned with cleanliness, don't stay here. And if you hate eating off of styrofoam and drinking from styrofoam cups, don't stay here. If you don't wan't the help throwing you out of the breakfast nook at precisely ten am.,with a loud announcement from the middle of that very small space, don't stay here. If you don't want to run the risk of finding a rat in your room, don't stay here. ( I did not personally see a rat, but as I was checking out, a man came to the desk, quite clearly upset and saying there was a rat in the bathtub.) I would never stay here again. Beds were good, noise on the floors was quiet, , but the exhaust fan in the bathroom was so encrusted with dirt as to be useless. The room wasn't filthy, by any means, but neither was it spotless, especially the bathroom. I could go on, but you get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: worstnightmare
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel i have ever stayed at. I stayed here six years ago, the last time I was in New York. At that time, it belonged to the best western group and was very nice, so I had no hesitation in booking again for this trip. However on arrival I was extremely shocked and disappointed. Our double room was a quarter the size it had been the last time. O.k hotel rooms are small in manhattan, but I nearly fell over the bed when I opened the door. Two bags and the room was full, there was no space to walk. This however, was not the worst. The room was filthy. The bed clothes were stained, there was a pubic hair on the tiles in the shower, there was dust and dirt everywhere. The room was exceptionally hot and the windows were nailed closed. The air conditioning was on but blew out a hot breeze while sounding like a train. Having been travelling for 20 hours and needing some sleep, we went to reception to request a larger room. We were informed that none were available and that we could be moved the next day. A business man who had been checking in at the same time as us, was checking straight out again. It was late so I put on my insect repellent, laid my coat out on the bed and tried to get some sleep. It was very difficult to sleep with the extreme heat and loud noise of the supposed air conditioning, which by the way cannot be turned off. Next morning, exhausted and wheezing from the dust, we went out to find an internet cafe and another hotel. The computers in la quinta were broken!. We booked into the sofitiel (a lovely hotel) and returned to la quinta about 1pm to collect our luggage and check out. When we arrived at our room, the door was wide open and our luggage was gone. Down at reception, after some investigation, it was discovered that the staff had moved our luggage to an upgraded room as we had enquired about it the previous day (at our expense). When we said we wished to check out they gave us a key to the room to get our bags and charged thirty dollars for late check out. I later emailed the apple core group to inform them. I recieved an e mail from the general manager, apologising and stating that this was unusual, however judging by the amount of similar experiences reported on this site, I don't think it's at all unusual. They offered me a 10% discount on a future stay but frankly, if they offered it to me for free, I would not stay at la quinta again and would strongly advise anyone thinking of booking this hotel to think again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: turyna
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dog. Front Staff treats you like a number. The pictures on their web-site are deceiving. It all smoke and mirrors to look really nice and it isn't. Room decor is old and beds are firm, wall paper is bubbling. No internet access and the response time to fix it doesn't exsist. Stay down the street at the Radison. I was going to stay two night, but my wife was crying because everything was so depressing. I should have bailed even before I checked in, but I was afraid that I would be charged anyway. Avoid this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: Blomsterpistol
Reviews.Content: "La Quinta is Spanish for 'everything just clicks'" is one of the hotel's payoffs, and for the two weeks I stayed there that seemed to be quite the case. The room and bathroom was clean, he bed was fine, the tv and air conditioning worked, the staff was pleasant, and the breakfast okay. All in all nothing spectacular, just a good place to stay if you're in NYC to make the most of the city and not hang around the hotel all the time. It's within walking distance of most things and it's really easy to get there with the subway, which is the biggest con I can think of. The hotel is right next to The Empire State Buliding and has a roof bar with quite a spectacular view of the Great Neighbour. I will definately recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a cheap place to stay without compromising their level of comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloGB
Reviews.Content: At the beginning, we booked a room for 2 with a queen size bed. Than, as a friend decided to stay with us, we changed the reservation for have a room for 3. And when we arrived, we were given a iny double bedroom, with oinly a queen size bed. No possible negociation with the reception, who didn't want to listen to us. Finally, one of us had to sleep on the floor, as they could not even provide us an additional mattress. They did not provide us some more sheets or towels. But of course, we had to pay the charge for 3!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: DisgustedPhoenixAz
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty. Mold in two rooms, hair in the shower, dirty comforters, a/c did not work. I'm a member of the La Quita member program and booked thru the reservation service.

Reviews.Title: “Student-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: gengen22
Reviews.Content: This is a student class hotel. Cons: Nothing fancy about the room (had king size room). The bathroom was below average, but could be used. No safe in the room + the TV had some problems. No refrigirator (ice machine). Late checkout is for extra charge. Pros: Excellent location. Walking distance from all major attractions. Free WiFi + free computers on the -1 floor. Good buffet breakfast, but small dining room. Final note: Good choice for budget travellers. If you need business style comfort - it's not for you.

Reviews.Title: “No New York welcome”
Reviews.Author: ableung
Reviews.Content: I booked my parents into this hotel and given the price, I was hugely disappointed. I think we paid about $250 dollars for a double room (small, air conditioning was just noise, dingy and not altogether clean shower - not entirely sure why the prices were so high for a two-star hotel. When we arrived, the receptionist barely looked us in the eye before telling us our room wouldn't be ready for another 4 hours. Did she offer up the possibiltiy to leave our luggage somewhere? No. She made absolutely no attempt to 'smoothe things over' given we'd been on a 8 hour flight and were completely exhausted. The 'bell boy' was a bit of a joke too, he looked at me when I said I wanted to check my luggage in, then asked me to bring it on over (i'm a 5ft nothing female and I was surrounded by 3 suitcases and two bags) I don't know about you, but that is not service. A hostel may have been friendlier... Suffice to say, we got none of the all-American welcome that one expects so people do not stay here if that's what you're after too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: kfrf
Reviews.Content: Great bargain for mid-town Manhattan. Friendly and accomodating staff. Room size above average and clean. Air conditioner was sufficient even with entire week of above 90 temperature. Great location within walking distance of all subway lines and Penn station. Complementary breakfast in clean dining room with many healthy choices for great start to full day of sightseeing or business. Gets crowded quickly on weekends - come early!!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: kidskids
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very conviently located, the staff helpful and cordial, and the room clean and quiet. I would recommend this hotel and plan to make this my headquarters for sightseeing, business and theatre trips when in NYC. We are always interested in keeping costs down but like to be within walking distance of major destinations. Ours are the Javitts Center for trade shows, the theatre district for overnighters, close to great shopping (for our teenagers) and close to the subway for sightseeing. Additional criteria on our list: complimentary breakfast, internet access and a business center, fitness center or pool, cleanliness and family friendly staff. The La Quinta met all our needs and expectations (no pool, but had no time to miss it). Thanks to the staff for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Meesh83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from 1 - 7 July and I cannot rate it highly enough! The room was comfortable and clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I went to New York by myself and the staff were always on hand to give me advice as to what to see and do. For the price of it, you get everything you need from a New York hotel, including complimentary breakfast, free internet access, a rooftop bar(if they are still doing the sangria, try some - its tasty but dangerous!!), and, for the fitness fanatics there is even a gym. It is also in a very handy location, being situated between 5th and 6th Avenues. It is a two minute walk from Macy's and a 10 minute walk from Times Sq. Next time I go back, i'm definitely staying at La Quinta - great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tjcoult
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel and were very pleased with the hotel, the staff, the room, etc...
