However, if you are looking for wonderful surroundings, the immediate area around the hotel is not so great. When we arrived, the taxi had to pull forward to unload our baggage to avoid a nasty mess of something in the street - but when we headed out a little later - the mess was gone, which we appreciated. There was a lot of trash along 32nd street, but the Empire State Building is just around the corner, and the area there is much cleaner and well kept. We ate at the Heartland Brewery in the Empire State Building and were very pleased with the food and the prices. The Rooftop bar at the hotel was also very nice and not too pricey. Times Square and Central Park are within easy walking distance and we only used the subway when we went out to Yankee Stadium and into Union Station Plaza. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a family on a budget”
Reviews.Author: PamperedLP
Reviews.Content: Location was within walking distance to Times Square, Empire State Building and other areas. Room was clean and large enough that we were able to use a blow up mattress (we have 3 teenagers). We felt safe entereing and exiting the building each day and at night. The doorman was extremely helpful when we arrived, helping unload our vehicle and giving directions on where to self park. The front desk was friendly and helpful with the questions we had. The only complaint we had was the lady at the broadway shows window at the hotel wasn't very helpful and hard to understand, but the next day a different person was there that was much better. The hotel was pricey on broadway tickets so we went into Times Square and found the tickets we wanted (Rent) cheaper and with no problem. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: travelman045
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel is. I stayed in a room with one queen bed and the room was a wonderful size. The furniture was in great shape and clean, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was very clean. The shower/bathtub was spottless and the shower head had wonderful water pressure. The room was quiet as I did not hear my neighbors or street noise (I was on the 5th floor). The continental breakfast was okay. They had the normal cold cereal, bagels, dounuts, juice..etc. Their health club consisted of two treadmills and two bikes (wish they had some kind of weights). Their business center which was next to the health club had three computers with free internet access. I felt very comfortable and safe as the hotel is 2 blocks from Penn Station. The only downfall I felt was how long you had to wait for one of the two eleavators. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - big room!”
Reviews.Author: AustinfamilyTexas
Reviews.Content: We were dreading being crammed into a small NYC motel room with our two teens, but received a pleasant surprise! Our room - 1111 - was actually big. Also, wifi, great location, an easy walk with luggage to Penn Station, efficient staff, so overall we were very pleased. Only drawback was elevator kept breaking, so we used the stairs. Breakfast is limited to cereal, breads and yogurt. For excellent $3 breakfast go to Brooklyn Bagel Deli at the corner of 6th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: CABerkeleyTravel
Reviews.Content: I have returned home from my Memorial Day weekend trip to NYC. The first night I stayed in the La Quinta Manhattan. Having never stayed in a hotel in New York before and having read many reviews for various hotels in Manhattan, I was prepared for anything. The area around the hotel was okay. It was a mix of industry and tourist attractions. The room was small but clean (no vermin). The bathroom was a standard hotel bathroom. I found the staff helpful. Since I was there alone this first night, I didn't venture out after dark. So, their Tv lineup was above average. They also gave you a nice little welcome package with candy, toothpaste, emergence-C, and coupons. Al in all, no complaints. It will be a very close and cozy stay if more than one person will be in your party.

Reviews.Title: “Worried”
Reviews.Author: Yakeen
Reviews.Content: the most special and lovely experience of all my years of traveling. La quinta is a warm welcoming place with great location or sighs and shopping areas. one concers thought is the breakfast room, the worker was not very kind when it comes to the guest needs. I wanted a drink and he refused to give it to me. Other than that every thing was excelent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: nytexan70
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to NYC and I am always looking for a good deal on hotels without getting a bad room. We read several of the previous comments from other guests left on this website. We saw that there were both good and bad comments and decided we check it out for ourselves. The lobby is very nice and yes the staff seems unfriendly but that is what the work ethic is like with the people working in the hotel. They are helpful and give you information as needed and it is their culture not to be friendly because they only are there to do the work. We were given information and never was anyone rude. When we entered our room we were happy with the conditions. It was clean and small but most of the rooms in nyc are small unless you want to fork over $400-500 a night in a swanky hotel. I have stayed in hotels with smaller rooms and not as clean in NYC before. For what I paid and the location of this hotel it was worth the stay. We went through La Quinta to make our reservations and fiqured if we were not satisfyed with our stay we would have contcted the corperate headquarters and asked for a refun on our rooms. Well we didn't have any complaints where we could demand a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel Unredeemed by Surly Staff”
Reviews.Author: lfjkfiutnt
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to start my litany of woe regarding this particular establishment. The only positive that I can mention is the location convenient to Madison Square Garden & the Empire State Building. On the negative side let me enumerate: 1) General The hotel is run down & in serious need of basic maintenance (not to mention renovation). The staff seem to make a valiant attempt to run a proper hotel, in spite of the 'Fawlty Towers' building. The rooms are dingy & have water stains on the walls, although the room I had was quite large by New York hotel standards. Even when you put the 'maid service requested' sign on your door the maid may not bother to clean your room. At one stage I chased the maid, who had not cleaned my room for days, down the corridor just to get some clean towels. 2) Plumbing The plumbing in my room leaked in both the hand basin and the shower. The toilet did not flush properly (in spite of several visits from a surly & overworked maintenance man) - I remained a afraid of using it for the duration of my visit. The shower hot water only worked after a visit from the aforesaid surly maintenance guy. The toilet made weird gurgling & running water noises all day & night, this wsa not ideal for sleeping. 3) TV & "Free Hi Speed Wireless Internet" The TV in my room initially did not work requiring a visit from the maintenance guy. Once working for free to air TV I decided to attempt watching a pay per view movie. Unfortunately my optimism was not rewarded - on the pay per view the sound did not work (even though the volume was set to full). I advised the front desk & asked not to be charged for the movie. The wireless internet connection via ethostream is as slow as a dial up connection. I gave up on it & picked up an alternative that was available in the area outside of the hotel. 4) Summary DO NOT stay at this hotel if you have a choice. It is run down and you can find better at about the same price in similar location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: OJudy
Reviews.Content: We spent a full week at La Quinta Manhattan and couldn't have been more pleased. We paid $121 a night (plus taxes) and when you consider the price included a nice breakfast, free internet in the business center, and a "goodie bag" with toothpaste, deodorant, etc., it was one of the best NYC bargains to be found. Our room was basic but very clean. The bathroom was small and appeared to be recently remodeled. There was no mildew at all -- that's one thing that I always check for. The bed was comfy, and our room overlooked the street. The location was ideal -- we could walk almost anywhere within a half hour, and there was a subway stop right at the corner for when we needed it. Penn Station was maybe 2-3 blocks away, which made it very convenient to reach JFK. There are numerous Asian restaurants on the street - we especially enjoyed a delicious Korean barbeque one evening and Vietnamese pho another. Macys and a wide assortment of shops are just a quick walk away, and the Empire State Building is just around the block. La Quinta is not luxurious, but it is clean and convenient, and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again !”
Reviews.Author: PortugalPrt
Reviews.Content: This was the worst Hotel I ever stayed in my life. I hope I will not go through the same experience. The rooms are really DIRTY. They stink. They smell humid. The WC are unbelievable. You will not believe if I describe. Never seen before !!!! Needs urgently a sanitary inspection. Another point: Items forgotten in the room, disappear. Housekeeper never knows anything. This is a kind of a Hotel you will only suggest to your enemies.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly front desk staff but an utter dump”
Reviews.Author: jct_junction
Reviews.Content: Hotel Web sites sometimes employ pictures that do not accurately reflect the rooms. This La Quinta is no exception. The Art Deco lobby looked like it needed a good cleaning. The clerk was very polite and speedy in getting me set up for the night. Upon reaching my room, I saw that the door was partially open. Cautiously, I entered the room and was greeted with the overpowering aroma of marijuana. Overpowering, like someone had just toked up minutes before I arrived. I was prepared to call the front desk to complain but having arrived late and after a day of back-to-back business meetings, I just wanted to sleep. I decided to crack the window and air out the room. No luck. Window bolted. At this point, I noticed that the place looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in some time. Carpet was stained and worn. Bathroom was dirty. Walls were peeling. Smoke alarm looked like it got in a fight and lost. Badly. Oh and the locks on the door barely worked. I've stayed at lots of La Quintas all over the country. This one was by far the worst. Look elsewhere. The reviewer who posted previously about the nasty coffee maker wasn't joking. We must have stayed in the same room.

Reviews.Title: “OK place but I will look harder next time”
Reviews.Author: chucklesinri
Reviews.Content: It was $300 for 2 nights (including taxes) thru AAA. Positives: It had a helpful front desk.staff, working elevators, breakfast& coffee were good, no off odor or smells anywhere. Good fast computer center in basement (fine/free) (also a bathroom down there, folks!). I don't know about wifi, we didn't bring our laptop. Found out now that there was a cool bar/view on the roof. Darn! Very central location. Good parking (left side of street) for Valet. Cheap parking rate - $30 for 24 hours. No apparent bedbugs! Negatives: Rooms small. Doors thin/not a good seal so you will likely hear hall noises. I still slept ok though, and am a light sleeper (helped that it was an end of hall room). Small bathroom (shower only, no tub). The bed? fair. The room coffee pot, though -that was disgusting - I could see tons of dust in it - tried repeatedly running just water though it to clean it out, but the gobs of crud(?) never stopped coming out. Front desk said they would send another coffee pot up, but I gave up after 15 min. and called down and cancelled and went to bed (just wanted hot water to make a cup of tea (my own)). Oh well. I also noticed dried up coffee splatter on the pot and on the wall behind it. Yech. Doing a final room check, I found a huge plastic hoop earring (2" diameter) of a previous tenant. This should not have been missed by housecleaning. Overall: OK place. I will look harder next time and read more reviews to try to find more for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: on-the-cheap
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™d like to first point out a billing policy at this hotel that might affect other travelers who book multiple rooms. I booked two rooms on-line through the chainâ€™s website and used my AAA membership in order to receive a discount. The discount amounted to $18 per night per room for two nights, or $72. At check in, I was told I could apply my AAA membership to only one of the two rooms; that the other room would be charged the non-AAA rate. In the next breath, the clerk said she would honor the AAA rate for both rooms if anyone else in our group of four had either an AARP membership or another AAA membership. We came up with a second AAA card and all was fine but beware of this policy if you book more than one room at the discounted AAA/AARP rate. I canâ€™t say enough good things about the staff. Every maid, bellman, clerk, server or maintenance person we encountered was polite and accommodating. There was an efficient busyness, but our requests were honored quickly including a toilet repair that was finished no more than 15 minutes after we called the front desk. Our bedroom was clean and so was the bathroom. The bedroom had one queen bed, a writing table, a straight-back work chair, a chest of drawers, cable television and a coffee maker. The room was small, but completely adequate. We requested non-smoking rooms and there was no lingering smell of smoke. The closet was tiny, with about eight wooden hangers, an iron and ironing board. The rooftop bar resembles a backyard or fraternity barbeque and there is an enclosed area for inclement weather. The bar is open from 5 PM until midnight, year round. Itâ€™s worth a trip for the view of the Empire State Building, even for non-drinkers. A mixed drink was $5. The hotel is located in the middle of 32nd Street between Fifth Avenue and Broadway. Few places in Manhattan could be more convenient or more centrally located. There is a subway entrance on the corner of 32nd & Broadway, and we had no problem getting a taxi. The free continental breakfast served coffee, juices, fruit, cold cereals, oatmeal, bagels, muffins, toast and doughnuts. We stowed three bags, as we arrived six hours prior to check-in, and stowed the same three bags for several hours after we checked out. There are two elevators which were neither particularly fast nor slow. Our bill at check out was exactly what we had been told it would be, with no hidden charges. There are four separate taxes in Manhattan on hotel rooms; two are percentage taxes, one is a flat $2 per night tax and the other one is a flat $1.50 per night tax that taken together added a fraction under 16.5% to our room rate. The hotel is in a block filled with Korean restaurants and businesses. Odd for Manhattan, there was no delicatessen on the street but we located one around the corner on W. 33rd Street with the usual deli fare and a breakfast special of a bacon, egg & cheese sandwich and coffee for $2. We are budget tourists and this hotel was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Book it - you'll be pleased you did!”
Reviews.Author: Saginaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta - Opal hotel in San Francisco last Sept, so really knew what to expect. We were not disappointed - yet again - a small but friendly hotel - really in the centre of Manhatten - and at bargain price. You just can't go wrong - the rooms are so much more pleasant than the usual 'travel inn - mass produced type' groups. Although the room was small - we were told about this on the booking detail sheet - but expected far smaller than it was - it was clean and pleasant. Anyway how much time do you spend in the room when out sight seeing all day. The location is fantastic - in addition to many other attractions mentioned in other reviews, there is 'Manhatten Mall' where the well stocked 'food hall' provides a variety of foods at reasonable prices. Some good shops too - right next to Macy's for a fraction of their prices! We would go again and again - don't want to tell too many people though as we love this group and the breakfasts are soooo good too. Toasted fresh bagels with cream cheese - WOW!!!! Go on - treat yourself - and enjoy !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: destinycalls
Reviews.Content: Mixed reviews before we went but for a cheap hotel it was exceptional. It was in a very central location. We found helpful staff, very clean rooms, everything worked, breakfast okay, although our room was opposite the lifts we were not disturbed by noise and never heard a door slam in the four nights we were there, the roof bar was attractive with lights and heaters outside, only complaint was that it closed early while we (and others) wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills with Lots of Frills”
Reviews.Author: Echelon
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel with lots of frills--not the least of which is the price! I paid approx. $107 USD per night for a room with a queen bed. The room was very clean, and the bed very comfortable. (Hint: the extra pillows in the closet are in better shape than the ones on the bed.) No view, but the sound from the HVAC system in the courtyard provided a white-noise background and I slept like a top! Lots of towels, soap, shampoo, etc.--not the expensive spa brands, but they work just as well. The business centre in the basement has 3 working computers with web access and a monochrome laser printer, all at no charge! The fitness centre had 3 treadmills and 3 bikes in addition to a other equipment, also free. Complimentary continental breakfast has decent coffee, juice, toast and lots of other choices. Close to Penn Station, Macy's, 2 subway lines, and lots of reasonably priced Korean restaurants. If you are on a budget and/or luxury is not a must, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value...”
Reviews.Author: kath210
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled to NYC to see the Macy's Day Parade along with good friends of ours. We were very happy with the rooms. They were on the small side, however, we were only there to sleep. The rooms were clean and so were the bathrooms. We did take advantage of the Continental Breakfast one day and it was fine...fresh fruit, bagels, cereals,oatmeal, etc... We arrived early--about 11 am and they allowed us to check in which was great. They were also very gracious in allowing us to secure our luggage there after we had checked out, which allowed us to sightsee one more day before returning home. The price was around $180/ night (AAA rate).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: rhynesfamily4_123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for the people who do not want super luxury and plan to only sleep, bathe, and relax a bit in the room. Our room was clean, comfy, and the hotel overall was beautiful and clean. The free internet cafe downstairs was a huge plus, the rooftop bar was awesome, and the free breakfast was great and had plenty to choose from. I dont know why people are so gripy on here about this hotel!? My husband and I loved it, besides we were out and about on the city for 14-16 hours a day and didnt even think about the hotel room until we needed sleep. I say go for it. Its a perfect location across from Madison Sq Gardens and Penn Station. We walked to Times Sq from our hotel and the Empire State Bldg is literally around the corner. This hotel is in Korea Town. Very quaint and cute. Basically just one street block. Great food too!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reasonably priced, great location”
Reviews.Author: MlleStorm
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this LaQuinta twice now and probably will stay here again. The rooms are small but ours have always been clean and I have always found the man who takes care of the breakfast room to be very attentive and willing to go out of his way to keep the guests happy. You cannot beat the location, around the corner from the Empire State Building and I liked being able to step over to Macy's and other nearby stores for shopping. We also like Korean food and so we try to visit a different Korean restaurant on this street on each visit. The desk staff has always been polite. The elevators a a bit slow so we would sometimes walk down the stairs for a little more exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Second time wasn't the charm”
Reviews.Author: Snarky
Reviews.Content: Came back to this hotel for a second time... lots of little annoying things on this visit have soured me on this place. Once again, the WiFi refused to work in my room. About the only spot on the floor that the WiFi worked was in front of the elevators. The plug-in jack inside the room didn't work at all. It was frustrating to try to get work done in this room. The curtains in this room hang directly over the air conditioner, so the air blows up into the curtains and the air doesn't circulate in the room. You have to try to balance things on top of the air conditioner to hold the curtain against the window so you can get some air in the room. That's annoying. It looked like the light fixture over the bed was being held in place with some push pins. I wasn't going to climb up there to find out. Yes, it's a mid-priced hotel, but now that there's a Holiday Inn Express and a Hilton Garden Inn among others in mid-town Manhattan, there are newer nicer properties in the same price range that weren't there a year ago. The La Quinta has a convenient location, but it needs a little maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Stay was okay”
Reviews.Author: Member001
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Quinta for 5 days -- got a AAA rate at $170 per night. Pretty decent compared to other hotels we researched. There was both positive an negative to staying here. Positive: - The location was very good, right in the middle of Manhattan, near great shopping (Macy's) and located close to subway lines. The hotel is located in "Korean Town" with a variety of Korean BBQ restaurants nearby. We ate at one of the $9.99 BBQ and sushi buffets on our first night in NYC..a great deal for all you can eat! There is also a small Korean Market a few doors down that you can purchase snacks and water at a reasonable price. - Staff was nice -- the latino maid was helpful and kept our room clean. Also, the staff at the breakfast was very good at keeping the place fairly clean and choices stocked. - The continental breakfast was decent and offered toast, bagels, pastries, cold cereal and oatmeal. There was also bananas and apples, and your usual choice of beverage: coffee, tea, orange juice, and a cocoa beverage (which I really liked). Overall, good for a light fare and getting you going in the morning. - Be sure to check out the rooftop bar at night, which has an excellent view of the Empire State building! We hung out there a couple of times because the view was so spectacular. The bartender was friendly, and the music was great. Negative: -Room was really SMALL. We stayed in an -02 room, and asked for an alternative room, but were told the hotel was booked. Be sure to ask for a larger room - or ask if you can see the room before you sign for it. It will be worth it, even if you have to wait for the room to be ready. The room was also very musty and smelled. I had to was all our travel clothes again because the smell came home with us in our suitcases. One plus was the bathroom, the shower had good pressure, and there was hot water all the time. - The rooms did not look like the room pictured on their website. I think the photo on their site was a suite. When we were at the rooftop bar, we could peek into the window of a neighboring room and saw it looked like the photo. But our room did not resemble it one bit. - I read in an earlier review that someone else had a problem with their room key. We had the same problem, and had to get our keys changed three times because it did not work. The front desk could not explain why. - The elevators were SLOW, I mean really SLOW! There are only 2 elevators to service everyone in the hotel. We took the stairs a couple of times because it was faster. - Our room did not come with wireless accessibility. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who spends little time in their room and wants a hotel to rest their head at night. There are no frills here. The location and value was good, though I would probably spend more $ and try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz, but acceptable”
Reviews.Author: damjam
Reviews.Content: I almost cancelled my reservation because of some of the guest comments I read but I'm glad I didnt. The Front desk staff were most proficient and welcoming at check-in and gave us a great check-in amenity (which by the way came in handy as I felt a cold coming on). The room which was on the 6th floor was extremely small but very clean and had all its amenities working. My one complaint which I had to endure for the entire stay was no shower curtain in bathroom (despite reporting it) and a bathroom door that doesnt close. Overall I'm a Ritz Carlton guest but for my last minute, had-to-stay in Manhattan trip, the La Quinta Manhattan worked out ok.

Reviews.Title: “Jury's still out on this one!”
Reviews.Author: travelinCAfam
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the favorable things. Location...half a block from the Empire State Building, subway is close, Manhattan Mall is a block away. Room on the 12th floor was roomy, in fairly good condition, and cleaner than expected after our first night! The price was very reasonable for New York! They also held our luggage when we checked out until we were ready to leave the city in the late afternoon. They booked a great airport service to JFK for us. We were here two nights with four people the first night and two people the second night. We reserved non-smoking rooms through the La Quinta website. Now, the not so great things! When I checked in I was quoted a higher price because I didn't have my AAA card with me...it was circling the block until we could find a place to pull over and unload! When we arrived at our room on the fourth floor, it was TINY, a smoking room and icky. I went right back to the front desk to have the problem corrected. I was told the reservation didn't request a non-smoking room (even tho I had my confirmation specifying non-smoking) and that they had no non-smoking rooms available. We tried calling around to change hotels but everything was booked. We were stuck in this smelly, icky room! After spending $15 on room freshners and Febreeze, it still smelled terrible. We suffered through the night. We were up and out early to escape the smell. The second night they did give us a much better and bigger non-smoking double room. The elevators were very slow and sluggish. The overall condition of this property is dingy, and unkempt. The breakfast room had dusty lint on the wall above the food and the ceiling was leaking in several places near the food. Wireless internet was suppose to be available but it was not. Valet parking for one night was $38! Yikes! When we did check out, they did give us our reserved price and a 10% discount on the first nights room. Not much but at least it was something. I'm thinking it might be worth the extra money to stay somewhere a little cleaner and nicer.

Reviews.Title: “If a business traveler...look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: gaffj
Reviews.Content: La Quintas are usually nice but this one....not so good. I stayed at the La Quinta in Manhattan for a week in July 2006. I was there for business and expected a business type hotel. Their website stated they had Wifi but there wasn't. To check e-mails and upload reports I had to go down and plug my laptop into their switch down in the business center. The room was small and the carpet and curtains very dirty and old. The bed was horrible and the AC did not work well which made for a very rough nights rest. When you call the front desk at night nobody answers and when I called in the morning it took forever to get an answer. In addition, the elevators were slow and constantly malfunctioning. That being said, the location was great. The hotel is in the middle of everything and just a short walk from our company offices. This hotel may be good for tourists but not for the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cagster
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here in late June 2005 as a trip of a lifetime before the birth of our first childin November We checked out the reviews of lots of hotels and despite some bad reviews on here, decided to go with La Quinta as it was relatively cheap. We were not disapointed with our choice at all. The location is fantastic, subway at the end of the block, plenty of cabs going past and right near the empire state building. The room was fine, nothing fancy but when you are getting a cheap rate what can you expect? I would say the rooms are on par with many that you would find in the UK. We had a problem with the air con one day, I mentioned it to the front desk and when we returned from our day out it was fixed and working better than ever. I wasnt massively obviously pregnant at this point so I dont believe I was getting any preferential treatment. The free breakfast was OK, we only ate there a few times, preffering to sample all the other food delights new york has to offer. All in all I would recommed this hotel if you are looking for a reasonable cost hotel in an excellent location. PS I work in the hotel industry so am perhaps harder to please than most and I had no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “$139 a nite??”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_eh...
Reviews.Content: I am coming to NYC in 2 weeks and am getting a rate of $139 a nite at the La Quinta!! But the problem is that many of the other people who have left reviews have complained of bait and switch where the hotel refuses to honour the quoted rate. Anyone have any thoughts?? i have stayedd at other applecore hotels in the past and was quite happy with their service..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - No complaints from me.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location with the subway only a half block away. Desk service was very helpful. Rooms showed some signs of aging and could use sprucing up. Nights were quiet. Was a little disappointed in the bar - expected a quiet place but it was really a place for young singles. Nice continental breakfast. In the midst of Korean restaurants/stores. Try the Mandoo Bar for some great dumplings at super price.

Reviews.Title: “OK - But not much more”
Reviews.Author: imagine71
Reviews.Content: The location of the La Quinta is very good - just a few steps from Herald Square. The rooms are well maintained though small, which is to be expected in New York. Rooms facing the backside of the hotel look out to a small inner yard and are quite dark, espacially on the lower floors. We changed rooms from one of those to one facing the street because the smell from the restaurant next door was all over the room as it's air condition exhaust was just about 10 metres below the window. There is a pretty nice rooftop bar. If I were to stay there again I would ensure to book a superior room towards the front side.

Reviews.Title: “Double-billed at LaQuinta New York, NY”
Reviews.Author: jw0413
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the New York, NY LaQuinta in Manhattan. The room was average for New York City. The bathrooms are extremely small. I stayed there May10th -May 12th, 2006. The worst experience was the double-billing of the room charges. I was billed once on May 12th, then again on May 16th. After trying to resolve this issue with the desk clerk, I tried to contact the manager and left numerous voicemail messages, none of which were returned. I submitted an online complaint to LaQuinta's customer service, and was told they would have a response for me "in a few days." I finally talked directly to the manager on May 23rd, who told me she would "look into it and call me back by 2 PM that day. As of May 27th, I still have not received a return phone call nor has the charges been refunded to my account. Based on the above non-responsiveness of the management and unethical accounting practices, I do not recommend staying here unless you are paying cash. My issue is still unresolved and I the hotel owes me $218, which they have failed to address or refund.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The La Quinta Manhattan is great value for money, We stayed there for 4 nights. Rooms were clean and tidy and staff were very helpfull. The free continental breakfast was great to get you started. Location is superb , close to subway Great roof top bar with stunnung views of Empire state building Would stop there again

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dallmat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 1 night in May 2006. I reserved the room on La Quinta Inn's web site. We had a very clean, spacious (by ny standards) room with an adequate bathroom. The mattress was a little old but we slept without difficulty. We were on the 5th floor facing 32nd street but found the double paned windows shut out all sounds but the garbage collection at 11:00 pm which lasted only a couple of minutes. There were no hitches in check-in or check-out. The room, with AAA discount, was $187.00 taxes included. The location is a little seedy but we did not feel any apprehension on the street at night. The staff were very pleasant and helpful in giving us directions to the Brooklyn Botanic Garden. We heartily recommend this attraction. The number 2 or number 3 subway will take you to the entrance. We will stay at La Quinta Inn on our next visit to Gotham.

Reviews.Title: “DEpressing!”
Reviews.Author: JoeFoodie
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC on biz very frequently. I happened to hit a very busy hotel week without advance booking ... almost every room in the city was selling for $299 plus a night. Decided to take a chance on the $179 room/ night rate for two nights at this hotel. The best features -- 2-block walk from Penn Station for those arriving from Newark on the airport train, and complimentary wireless access. Everything else was dismal. Arrived to find that they could not find my reservation. Stood at the front desk patiently for 20 minutes (with my online reservation confirmation in hand). Seems like they were encountering a communications breakdown with LaQuinta[-] Finally, the (minimally) English-speaking desk clerk handed me a key to my 5th floor room. The typical NYC small room featured: -windows that would not open (and a view of an old brick wall) -noisy window A/C unit that never cooled the stuffy room -a desk too tiny for anyone to work at -scuzzy old green carpeting (suspect for my sneezing & allergy outbreak) -cheap, thin towels The hotel had two slow elevators and a basement fitness room that smelled of sewage. (There was an odd smell throughout the hotel ... like an unemptied grease trap.) I wasn't brave enough to try the breakfast room. (Starbucks and other options a couple blocks away on 5th Avenue.) There was a crowded rooftop bar which was nice for good weather evenings. Just be sure not to accept a room on the 14th floor where the bar traffic was noisy. The neighborhood? Bleak block featuring many Korean restaurants ... but only two blocks to Herald Square (Macy's!). Overall, a depressing place to sleep in NYC -- unless you just need a (relatively) clean bed to sleep for a few hours near Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before staying here!!”
Reviews.Author: D_Roamer
Reviews.Content: I booked a queen non-smoking at the La Quinta website for the AAA rate. What I got a was a tiny room with a double bed, with about a foot of space from the bed to the wall. The bed, bathtub and toilet were clean. The carpet was grimy and you can see mildew on the bathroom wallpaper. The free continental breakfast was fine. At check out, I told the front desk clerk that I booked a room with a queen bed, and she immediately responded that they had nothing smaller than queen beds in their hotel, but that some queen beds LOOK like double beds (note I hadn't said anything about a full bed to her at this point). When I got the bill, I was billed for the regular rate. When I brought this up, she did adjust my bill after making some rude remarks and making it sound like it was my fault to begin with (I did not cross check the rate at sign in and I did not show them my AAA card).

Reviews.Title: “Beware - it is a scam with the low rates”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a confirmed and guaranteed reservations at this particular property, when I checked in I thought something funny was going on as it was taking them a long time to fiddle with the reservation and then they come back and tell me that they cannot honor the rate I am booked under and wanted to charge me an additional $59.00 per night. Needless to say I was very upset, they mishandled the whole thing, conveniently no one in authority were available, all supposedly on holidays and could not speak to anyone, when they called the toll free number for La Quinta - yes they had my reservation and yet the Hotel would not honor the rate I honestly think it is a hook and bait, where they tell you the rate is low and when you show up they charge you the higher rate. Attitude was very poor and rude. Luckly for me I found another hotel that wanted my business and treated me with respect and dignity. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone at all unless you are chancing it and when you show up they will scam you. you can reach me at sben10@hotmail.com if you need further clarifications these people are part of the applecore hotels, and I really would stay away from all their properties.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: ICOS
Reviews.Content: For NYC prices, the La Quinta was fairly inexpensive but offered a lot more than others in the same price range. It's very clean and well run, good location, and offers a nice continental breakfast too. It's central location couldn't be beat, as it's near to Penn Station and a couple subway lines, tons of food options, and great shopping. Very safe but busy night and day. I had a room on the 8th floor facing the street. Could be loud at times, but with earplugs I slept great. The room was clean, on the smaller side perhaps, but sufficient for 2 people. I had only small annoying complaints, such as the fire door constanly slamming shut through the night, the slow elevators, and how my room at first smelled of chinese take-out (several take-out menus were slipped under my door daily, so that explains it). Overall, I'd recommend it for families or budget travelers since it's a pretty good deal for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “good and bad things about it...”
Reviews.Author: lmingras
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel and upon arrival, I thought it seemed like a great deal for the money. The lobby is nice and the staff is extremely accommodating and helpful. The only bad thing are the actual rooms. I got a room with one queen bed and it was the smallest room I had ever seen. Not to mention that you could hear everything. My neighbor came home at 2am and it sounded like he was coming into my own room and putting his coat in my closet. I heard people getting ice down the hall and there was an enormous space between the door and the wall. It seems once again that if it sounds too good to be true, it probably is...

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I lived in NYC for 21 years, so coming back and staying in a hotel was odd, but this place was a perfect choice. Our room was quite large by NYC standards, and it faced the back of the hotel so we had no street noise at all. Room was clean, well maintained, housekeeping did a nice job each day. The continental breakfast more than adequate (cereal, oatmeal, toast, bagels, donuts, juice, coffee, fresh fruit), fresh and constantly replenished. The location is also ideal: 2 blocks from Penn Station, so if you're coming by train, or taking the NJ transit train in from Newark airport, you don't need a cab. The subway was right around the corner, Empire State Building & Macy's less than 2 blocks away. You can walk or take the subway 1 stop to Times Square, to Grand Central, basically to anywhere. The rooftop bar is very pretty and very quiet. The street is the heart of Korean restaurants, many open 24 hours, so it's very safe and you can get something to eat whenever. We had wireless internet access in our room, and in the basement is a business center with 3 working computers connected to the internet, as well as a printer so we could print out our return boarding passes. There's also a small gym that wasn't listed on the hotel website: 2 treadmills, a stair machine and a lifecycle. We did hear some guests complaining about the cost of parking. That's unfortunately normal for NYC, and even if you parked much farther away you really wouldn't get a much cheaper deal for 24 hours. And the 2 elevators are small, and relatively slow - not unexpected for an older building such as this. The baggage room was a big convenience, as we weren't leaving the city until 5 pm so we were able to lock up our bags and go enjoy the day. My ONLY complaint: I searched multiple websites to find the best price, and found out that other people had somehow gotten their rooms for even LESS than we paid. Not really the hotel's fault. All in all, I highly recommend this place, and will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at La Qunita April 1-4 and found it met our expectations based on other reviews. Queen room was on the small side but the bath was almost as large. Clean and quiet, it met our needs nicely. Roof top bar is worth a visit for the view. Tips: wear comfortable walking shoes .. we did six miles on Sunday without trying!! MOMA was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Travellers2
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel with a school group and would recommend it. It is in a great location with a subway stop on the corner and the Empire State Building and shopping (Macy's, etc.) nearby. It was very clean and quiet and the rooms are typical size for NYC (not huge, but adequate) and those ending in "11", for example 711, 811, are larger than the others I saw. Try to avoid those ending in "10" - they are right across from the elevator. The continental breakfast was fine - bagels, toast, doughnuts, cereal and fruit, juice, coffee, tea, etc., but no protein. The bar on the top floor is terrific, very cozy and has an outdoor area. The view of the Empire State Building from the bar at night is well worth seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Gave our rooms away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had booked two rooms at the beginning of the year for 5 nights from the 16th March 2006. When we arrived to check in we were told that our rooms had been given away because the credit card had been declined. On investigation with the credit card company, the reason it had been declined was due to the hotel inputting the expiry date round the wrong way. We had no phone call from them to warn us this had happened, the staff were extremely rude, they would not let us use a telephone to find another hotel. The manager never appeared the next day to make the complaint to. Whilst we were there 3 other couples had the same thing happen to them. I would say that if you plan on using this hotel, that they have the credit card details exact, and if you are from another country that you ensure that have the exp date the right way round.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great deal!!”
Reviews.Author: dnbmassey
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel last week Wed. through Sat. and we really thought it was in a great location. We were half a mile from Times Square, two blocks from Madison Square Garden and Penn Station, half a mile from Grand Central Station and there was plenty of subway stations right around us. This hotel is not on a pretty street and yes they do put out trash every night but we felt safe and the hotel was clean. The staff were very helpful and gave us lots of hints on things we wouldn't know about. They also have a room to lock up your luggage which was a life saver for us because we were late getting to a game when we arrived in New York and they locked up our luggage until we could return then when we checked out we didn't leave until 5:30 p.m. so they stored it for us again. This was a great convenience. The room was not very large but we were at the back of the hotel and did not have much of a view, it was a view of a building but by being at the back we never heard anything! It was extremely quite. The free breakfast was great and they had fresh fruit which was nice to be able to grab a piece to snack on during the day. I would definately stay here again especially if we could get the wonderful rate of $89 a night again!

Reviews.Title: “really dissappointed in room.....also too far away from things”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: myself and my daughter booked a room here for 3 nights and 4 days...... hotel lobby was runned down and very trashy on the outside. Our room view was of the building next door, (basically an alley) filled with trash etc. Had to call room service for maid cleaning twice in one day, we came back from sightseeing at 6pm and room still hadnt been cleaned. I think the bathtub should have a mat in the bottom to keep from slipping as my daughter did.... we both felt very unsafe at this hotel and we will not recommend this hotel to anyone else... also, we checked in late and had to stand in line for 2 hours before being checked in,there was only one other person in front of us.... not enough people working at the front desk.....

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews about La Quinta Manhattan I wondered had we better change our booking.Glad we didnt,it was excellent!Check in went really well,we were given two queen beds,the staff were very courteous and friendly.We were on the tenth floor,just across from elevator,some noise was experienced but that happens in lots of hotels.We were pleasantly surprised at the space we had(again after reading some critics)closet space was small but what the heck.The hotel bar with its view of Empire State Building was a bonus.Breakfast was ok,you could eat your fill as everything was replenished as quickly as it was used.It was certainly up to our expectations and we will return later in the year if possible.We stayed there 27-31January 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: AZ2MI
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location and is very clean. Check in was a breeze and staff courteous and very helpful. Roof top bar was enjoyable, indoor/outdoor seating you can enjoy gazing at the Empire State Building next door. Macy's and Daffy's are just around the corner as is the subway. Cabs are always passing by and easy to flag down. Room was decorated nice and most importantly as two females we felt safe and the room was very clean. Would select again for future trips. Free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Deal for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Ifos
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there on January 4th and 5th of 2006. We were not totally convinced with the reviews we had read previously but we decided to give it a shot anyway since we got a special promotional fare through Expedia. The people at the lobby were very friendly and available 24 hours. There was also a place by the entrance where we could store our luggage. This was really convenient, especially the day we left because after checking out at noon, our bus wasn't before 9pm and we got the chance to leave it there the whole day at no extra cost. The employees in charge of that locker were also very nice and it was a good thing we were able to take in or out our bags at anytime in the day. Concerning the room, we were a bit disappointed by the one we got on our first night. Everything was clean, but it was just so tiny we barely could walk around the bed. We had quite a few pieces of luggage as well and had to store it all in the little compartment of the room where was the ironing board. We actually were supposed to stay at La Quinta only one night but decided to stay one more to enjoy more of NYC. I had told the people at the lobby in the morning after our first night and we were expecting the room to be done by the maid when we came back at night. However, this was not the case and the people at the reception told me for some reason the message didn't go through! I was surprised when the guy at the lobby told us he could have somebody bring us new sheets and towels! That would have meant that we should have done our room ourselves! I simply told him I didn't agree and he kindly accepted to change us to the room right next to our first room. The fact our first room wasn't done actually made our day. The second room was much bigger. It was as nice and clean as the first one but we really had more space, especially the bathroom which was about twice the size as in the other room. Finally we found convenient the free internet access downstairs and the breakfast was pretty good as well, enough to get us going until lunch. You only have to wake up early cause they no longer serve it after 10 am. All in all, we would definitely go back to La Quinta on another stay in the City.

Reviews.Title: “We're going back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: having read some of the reviews here today, I just can't believe my eyes. We stayed here for St. Patricks Week in March and we're defintely going to stay here again when we visit the states this year. Initially, we were put in a very small room that backed onto what sounded like generators but after we complained following a sleepless night, we were accomodated in a much larger, front facing room with lots of space. The maids were friendly, and i can't sing the praises enough of the Concierge at the time, he even lent my partner his own dinner jacket when we went to eat in a restaurant that required same. I can't speak for the breakfast, we never got up in time, jetlag! but i found 2 good delis at each end of the street that served our needs very adequately and a really gorgeous Italian Restaurant about 2 blocks down that we hope to find again. It's not the ritz, but for 120 dollars a night, it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: madauntykell
Reviews.Content: I didn't check Advisor before we booked so when I did check i was really worried with some of the comments about this place. But really there was no need. It completely did what we needed it to do. It was a base which we were not going to spend an awful lot of time in to relax or go to the gym etc. It was in a perfect location pratcially next door to the Empire State Building and at the end of the block is a subway station, 2 mins away from Broadway and Macy's - what more did you need! Ok - the carpet could probably do with replacing and the breakfast is not silver service but it was fresh with a great selection. The staff were friendly enough but the lift was really slow. Internet access was free too in the business centre. One tip - check what is on at Madison Square Garden before you go - we managed to get to see Bon Jovi in concert - MSG is literally across the road! And if you want a great view but the queue is too long at the Empire State go the the Rockefeller - you get a great view of the Empire State Building (which is lovely when it's lit up at night) and you wouldn't see it otherwise!! New York is my number one city - top of the list! I don't generally go back to the same destination twice but this place is definitely worth a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Even Girlfriend Thought it was Fine.”
Reviews.Author: BernieSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: The girlfriend and I stayed here in late August and found the hotel was just fine. I expected the worst due to some of the reviews, but was satisfied in light of the very reasonable price. Yes, the place could use some new (and different color) paint. But, the room was clean and quiet, if not a bit on the small side. The bathroom was also tiny but, again, clean. The only smell I noticed in the hallways was of an old, well-used hotel. The air conditioner worked fine. We loved the rooftop deck/bar w/its amazing view of the Empire State Building. The bellmen both days were very friendly and helpful. I had no problem w/the front desk staff--but I didn't have to ask them for anything, either. As for the neighborhood, we never felt it unsafe, though it's a little dark and secluded at night. I would have no problem staying here again if attending a game at the Garden (a 5-min. walk), and might stay here again for a weekend if I got the same great deal. But, w/so many other choices, I likely would try another part of town and hotel for variety.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews had me scared.....”
Reviews.Author: Hynikki
Reviews.Content: I had booked the La Quinta Manhattan in August 2005,and have been steadily reading the reviews of this Hotel.. I must say I was scared the entire plane flight of what I was going to find when we got there. Check in was a breeze, and yes the elevators were a bit slow, but it is an older building. No bad hallway smells, and our room looked directly out to the Empire State Building. We had 2 comfortable Queen size beds, and a room big enough to accomodate 4 adults with large suitcases. The room and bathroom were clean, with fresh towels and cleanings everyday. I called for 2 more pillows about 8pm one night and had them within 10 minutes. Breakfast was just fine, donuts, bagels, cold & hot ceral and juice and coffee. If you don't like anything, there are plenty of McDonalds and Starbucks around.(the hotel's b-fast is FREE) So, I must say, all my weeks of worrying were not worth it. I have no complaints.. I especially liked the price we paid for it. No, It's not the Plaza or the Ritz, but it was clean, and a great place to sleep after touring all day.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Reporter
Reviews.Content: I just spent two nights at La Quinta Manhattan with two of my grown daughters. The hotels in New York were booked pretty full because of the marathon. We chose LaQuinta because of the price, which was not real cheap, except by New York standards. They quoted me $100 a night under the Comfort Inn. I refuse to pay $400 or more a night just to sleep. However, I was very pleased with this hotel, as were my daughters, who are both flight attendants and have stayed in hotels all over the world. We had a room with two queen beds and it was large and roomy, and the bathroom was very nice and larger than I had expected with plenty of hot water. The room was very clean and very nicely furnished. Of course, we had a view of a building next door, but we didn't spend time in the room looking out the windows anyway. We had a very nice breakfast. We found the entire staff to be friendly and helpful. Of course we didn't make any unusual demands. I would advise anyone who requests the AARP rate to be sure to have your AARP card with you or you won't get the discount. This hotel was only the second in many years to actually require me to present my AARP card. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who travels on a budget and is satisfied with a nice clean, comfortable room in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: cowmingo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in May of 2005 over Memorial Day weekend. The best thing this hotel had going for it was the proximity to the train station. The staff is so rude. I've been to NYC many times and always heard the myths about rude New Yorkers. I think they all work at this hotel. The room had a funky odor to it and when I was getting ready for bed the first night, I pulled back the sheets to find blood stains on the sheets. I immediately called the front desk and had the sheets changed. On the second night, I pulled back the sheets to again find blood stains. I wouldn't let them change the sheets the third night because I was afraid of what I might find. Our room was right across from the ice machine and it was noisy noisy noisy all night long. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. I'm sure that there are much better hotels for the $150 a night that La Quinta costs.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service; all they care about is $$$”
Reviews.Author: AnExiledMainer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would both advise travelers to avoid the La Quinta Manhattan. We had a five-night stay in late October 2005 and witnessed firsthand how terrible the service is. I should preface this review by saying that we have stayed in several NYC hotels in the past, and are past residents of NYC -- we know that not all rooms will have a stellar view, and one might get a room that overlooks an airshaft. Be prepared for this, and remember that many, many people in NYC have apartments with similar views. Also, many, many hotel breakfast rooms use styrofoam plates and, yes, these plates may melt when hot toast is put on them. I mention these things because these are some of the complaints that have been lodged against the La Quinta by other Trip Advisor members. These are things that will occur at any NYC hotel in this price range, and travelers should expect this. Our complaint about the La Quinta is their inattention and indifference to customer service. At times the staff members were unquestionably rude. Examples: We had a plumbing problem that took 2-1/2 days to fix, because the front desk did not communicate at all with the engineer about what the problem really was. They wasted his time and ours. He never came with the right tools, and couldn't even fix it in the end. The housekeeping staff dumped a pile of soaps and shampoos in our room the first day, and never monitored the supply again. The employee running the breakfast room was surly and sometimes downright rude. The coffee/hot water machine was difficult to figure out and there were no instructions. If this employee encountered anyone wondering how to use the machine or having a problem with it, he chastised them in a voice loud enough for everyone in the room to here. On October 24th, we heard him sarcastically ask people that he was "helping" with this machine, "Can't you read English?" He did this three times! (Many of the guests at the hotel were not native English speakers, but the way the coffee maker worked was not apparent even to those of us who were.) When my husband accidentally spilled some coffee and burned his hand, this employee made rude jokes about the incident as he cleaned up. The man running the gift shop where one could buy tickets for an airport shuttle bus tried to con my husband into making a reservation without revealing what the price was. My husband's first question had been, "How much is it?" and this man did everything in his power to get my husband to sign up for the shuttle without answering the question. (The shuttle was $45 one-way to LaGuardia airport. We used a cab and paid $27 each way, including tip and tolls! Obviously, a much better deal!) Hot water in our room was dependent upon the demand in other rooms. At times, tepid water was all that we could get, in the shower and the sink. The remote on the TV did not work well. The room door was difficult to open, with metal scraping metal on the bottom of the door frame. All this for between $219 and $329 per night. We will not stay at the La Quinta Manhattan again. Never!

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay in New York , at the end of a holiday in Canada. The La Quinta, first put us into a room the size of the bed with a foot and a half walk around it. No room even for our bags, the tiolet didnt flush, the aircon. didnt work and our room overlooked brick walls and fire escape. On the second day after a sleepless night due to the heat, we requested another room, which we were given without hesitation. The second night was better only due to plumbing problems the whole hotel was without water for the day,the aircon. didnt work for anyone in any room for longer than an hour or two, and everyone in the hotel complained about one thing and another in lifts or were ever we met one another. Breakfast was served on plastic plates and cuts, which melted when toast was placed on them . All in all i would suggust anywhere else, paying in mind that it was extemely expensive for us coming from Australia $1000 for 3 nights, I believe it is even more expen=sive to stay elsewhere. I also wouldnt recommend staying mid town, its way too frantic.

Reviews.Title: “Could have done better”
Reviews.Author: dissolvedgirl80
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a hotel in Manhattan, so I can't really compare it to anywhere else, but I think I could have done better. The first half of our trip we stayed with friends downtown and it was much nicer. As others have noted the room was extremely tiny. Just large enough that you can walk around the queen sized bed. I thought the bathroom was an okay size relative to the room. The staff was not very friendly (except for the maid who was very nice). It took about 45 minutes for them to send an extra pillow to my room, even though I physically went downstairs instead of calling so I would not have to wait for them to send it (they would not give it to me downstairs). The worst thing about this hotel is the location. Yes it is close to the Empire State Building, Macys, and Times Square, but the only restaurants nearby are Wendys and Burger King around the corner, and about 20 Korean BBQ places. If you're not in the mood for Asian or fast food, you're out of luck. Next time I will stay somewhere closer to some nice restaurants and good night life. The positive aspects of this hotel is that our room was clean and the free breakfast in the morning had some good choices. They had signs up that you weren't supposed to take the breakfast items to your room "in order to help keep our hotel clean," which I ignored. If I want to eat in my $150 hotel room, I will eat in my hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had reservation for 4 nights. we left after 4 hours when we decided it is so bad that we'd rather go to my uncle who lives in N.J. The area is bad and dirty, when you get out of the taxi you start feeling bad. The staff is rude and unhelpful. The rooms: first they took me to a smelly room that even though I smoke myself the smell was imbareable for me- so we asked another and got a room the size of my home bathroom. Than we decided to leave but they still charged us for the night after a loud and angry conversation. Stay Away

Reviews.Title: “Never Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: PLEASE, DO NOT STAY HERE. The halls smell of Indian or Oriential food at all times. The staff is not helpfull at all. The Maintenance department is worthless. I stayed in this hotel for Buisness and regret it. The Wireless Web is non-exesistant and all of the rooms do not have wired web. If they do then it is as slow as dial up. In the first 2 days I was in 3 rooms. The first was size wise fine but the AC would not work. The Second was a Handicap room but no Web Access. The Third was room 1002. I dont know of a smaller room that I have ever stayed at in my entire life. You could barely walk around the bed. The Desk"table" was in a corner alcove opposite the dresser with the TV on top with enough room for a chair. You just couldnt sit in the chair. Glad I had a long ethernet cable to sit on the bed with my laptop. The shower had a nozzle that only sprayed you in the face. If you wanted to really rinse, you had better let it drip. The staff only had the "Authority" to give me a "10% Discount" on the first night. The manager whom I called later(2 weeks) offered another 20% on the first night only. This is not the first time I have stayed there, but it is certainly the last. My travel agent,who is a manager with STA Travel will spread the word within her organization to never book anyone there at all.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Happy with this stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having heard so many horror stories about New York hotels, I was prepared for the worst. It took me about 2 1/2 weeks researching various hotels before I finally decided on the La Quinta. The rates were great compared to other hotels in the area; the location was fantastic!! The staff (from housekeeping to the front desk) did not seem very approachable or friendly, but that did not bother me. They left me alone, and I left them alone. The room was surprisingly clean, except the carpeted floor when we got there, BUT they did vacuum and clean daily, which was a plus. The bedroom and bathroom was TINY, but that is typical in New York anyway. The room was just a place to camp out at night while we explored the city in the daytime so it didnt matter at all. Internet conn was good most of the time. The rooftop bar was nice with view of the Empire building. The breakfast was ok with the typical bagels,donuts, coffee, etc..But hey if you want bacon and hot eggs maybe try the millenium hilton instead....The only problem we had which wasny that much of a big deal was the slow moving elevators!! At least there were were chairs in the lobby right next to it, so that you can sit and wait the 5 minutes for it to come. Great location, good value, clean..What more can you ask for? Would I stay there again? If the rates stay low, I think I definitely would book again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely convenient to all sights and had a wonderful view of the Empire State building at night from the bar. However, we were in a room at the back which had no light and was very depressing. The room was clean but very basic and small. The staff were rather unhelpful and not particularly pleasant but the continental breakfast was surprisingly extensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good price”
Reviews.Author: Agraontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days in August 2005. Great location for shopping and easy connections to all NYC. ItÂ´s a "korean street" plenty of nice restaurants. They gave me a nice, no-smoking room on the 12th floor. Room complete and clean with two good queen beds. A/C worked fine. Bathroom complete and clean. Lots of water, great shower. Wireless internet did not work with a weak signal, but it was solved with a wire connection under the desk. TV 27" plenty of channels. Business and Fitting center under refurbishment, so closed. Corridor carpets need replacement, but is a common problem in a lot of hotels. I do not know why the architects do not use ceramic tiles. Elevators small, clean and not very fast but who needs speed there? Included breakfast basic but good quality. When compared to other hotels in NY, it's cheaper. I would probably stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “At least it was clean!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews posted on this website, I was really nervous about staying at this hotel. My boyfriend and I came to New York for my birthday the first weekend of August 2005. While the staff wasn't overly friendly, it didn't bother me too much because they still fulfilled my requests. A simple question, asked nicely by me, allowed for kindness in return from the staff. They gave us numerous room options to choose from, and even told us which rooms were already clean so that we could check in early if we chose to. Granted, the rooms were small, but our room and our bathroom was clean. And in New York, at a 2 star hotel, that's more than you need! :-) We stayed in room 605, and I think the television in that room was possessed! Everytime you turned it on, it turned itself back off, until it decided it wanted to cooperate -- usually about the 3rd or 4th time of pressing the power button. But who watches much t.v. anyway? The air conditioning system worked great! The water pressure in the shower was good, and the room was clean. We were hardly ever in the hotel, and in New York, it's all about location anyway, right? The location was great. We were a 5-10 minute/$5 dollar cab ride from most of the things we chose to do while we were there. And naturally, I had a wonderful time for my birthday weekend in New York. So, if you don't mind being in an older model hotel, I would recommend this one to you --- the savvy traveler who would rather spend more of his/her money on things to do, as long as the place you stay is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother the staff-you're only a guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my sisters and i stayed at the laquinta hotel in late july, and i doubt i'd ever stay there again. the hotel is a remodeled older hotel and has a very nice front entrance. it is on a street known as little korea. the rooms and rest of the hotel are satisfactory, but the bathroom exhaust fan was so noisy, it was like being on a runway at laguardia. we checked in at 11:00 & went out until 5:00 (check-in is 3:00) and our room still wasn't cleaned upon our return. i specifically asked for enough towels for three, but still had to put in a call to the front desk for a few more. which brings me to the staff-they treat you like you are a minor intrusion to their day. they spoke to guests as little as possible; needless to say, i avoided asking for much. they made an error on my bill, & left a message on the room phone telling me i owed them .50 cents (i didn't). there was a $1.50 per day tax on the bill for the javits center-wasn't sure why, but i was sure i didn't want to ask that staff!

Reviews.Title: “replace the staff”
Reviews.Author: gusbruce
Reviews.Content: Location perfect, Price perfect , breakfast good,but the hotel needs a be updated. Everyone of the staff was useless or worse still, they were rude.On arrival the person on front desk was abusive to a customer who had to go behind front desk to retrieve his credit card. The customer remained v. polite, but left to stay elsewhere. If you stay at this hotel the less you have to do with the staff the better.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: andru_nl
Reviews.Content: When checking in DO NOT agree for a room # 15 (e.g. 915,1015 etc.) It's the tiniest room and it is not for 2 persons. If you paid normal amount, not some discounted price, that's it. We paid for such room 179$ for a night, but we could not argue loud enough to get us 2 a bigger one, although we got a bigger one for the 2nd night. That second room was fine. Windows in the most rooms look at the wall of the opposite buildings, so there is no view in any rooms I guess. Hotel is located on some kind of chineese street with all the chineese restaurants/shops around. Location is good, right down the Empire state. But be advised that Empire State building is NOT the center of NY! It just one of the attractions. Most stuff happens at Times Square, where also many bus city tours start and end. So if you plan to use bus tours and you should consider staing closer to Times square, otherwise you will have to walk (not far, but still). On the other side, walking NY streets is quite nice - that's what NY is really about is not it? Macy's is very close. Ah, the corridors and especially the so-called buisness center (a room with 3 computers with free internet) smell really really bad. The smell is fine in the rooms though. No cockroaches spotted. Breakfast is pretty limited - coffie bread fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Loribe
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were happy to see it was a historical landmark. They did a very nice job in modernizing it. The clerk was preoccupied with other things and barely spoke to us. She didn't even tell us about the continental breakfast, the custodian on the elevator told us about it. The people that worked there were not helpful nor friendly (I guess that's NY). Our room was 1102 and the air conditioner did not work very well (sure glad it wasn't Summer)! The room was small but very comfortable and a good deal for the money and the location was very central for everything we wanted to do. If I stayed there again, I would make sure the air conditioner worked before I trekked all the way up to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our tirp to New York was just for one night and two full days. We were supposed to stay at Hotel Newton but they lost our reservation. So glad I called the day before our arrival or else we would have been stuck. We decided to give LaQuinta a try since we had a good experience with this chain in New Orleans. The hotel staff were very friendly, accommodating, and helpful. They allowed us to check in early which was much appreciated since we left home at 3a.m. to get a 6a.m. flight from Buffalo to JFK. The room was small but very clean. The air Condition worked fine but I did encouter one person who had trouble with their a/c unit. The price was great and the breakfast was okay. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too many drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: gregiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 4 - 9 after reading reviews on tripadvisor. Got a good rate through the applecorehotels reservations site. We arrived early, and were told a room was ready, but if we came back later we could get a larger room. We had tickets to a matinee, so we came back at 5:30pm and received a slightly larger room. The room was a smoking room, very smelly, and on the second floor (I had asked for a non-smoking room on a higher floor). The weather was hot and sticky the whole time we were in New York and the AC in the room was blowing air, no cooling. We called about this and maintenance came right away and flushed the system, telling us that it would cool down soon. After 30 minutes, there was no change. We called again and asked if we could be moved. The front desk said the hotel was sold out and they would have maintenance check on it again. After another 30 minutes and no maintenance person, we called applecore to see if they could help us (either move us to another property or get us another room). They said they would see what they could do. We left for dinner and talked to the front desk. They assured us they would get it fixed or move us. When we got back the room was frigid! We didn't dare adjust it the rest of the stay. So not a great impression upon arrival. But at least it was cool. The pros: price ($149 per night), breakfast included (well stocked and adequate quality), free wireless connection (easy and fast), location (access to several subway lines within the block and more just one avenue away) and rooftop lounge (right below the Empire State building). The cons: smoking room was more than Fabreze could handle, interior room had awful dark view (couldn't even tell if sun was out), countertop in bathroom was too long and you could not sit on the toilet without leaning to the side (and I'm not fat!), bed comfort and linens were below par (and I know not to expect much), tub was very slippery (we had to put a wash cloth down for traction), and the maid service was spotty (at different times there was no bath mat, no hand towels, no tissues, etc.). The TV remote would not turn the TV off and the reception varied with each station. I didn't have high expectations, but this was not worth $149 (even in NYC). I would pay more for just a little better upkeep, or paid $99 and been more understanding. Overall, the stay was not horrible, but I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just returned from a brief visit to NYC where we stayed @ the LQ-Manhattan. Both of us were impressed by the central location (5th Ave., Macys, Penn Station just minutes away), helpful staff, & included extras (internet connection/printer, breakfast, gym). The room was 'typical' Midtown size (read:compact), but had everything we needed & was tidy. I would recommend this inn without reservation. Note --> the rooftop/terrace lounge was closed for maintenance,...

Reviews.Title: “Ok - but showing lack of upkeep”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days in mid-May while on vacation. For some reason, the NY Times Guide to New York (2005) rates this place very highly, so I decided to try it. I've never been to NYC. They gave me a quiet, no-smoking room like I requested. On the 12th floor. The problems... A/C didn't work, it was on full cool but was actually heating the room. It was 77 degrees in the room when it was 62 outside. I called the front desk. They didn't send the engineer until I called again a couple hours later. He worked on it (drained rusty water out the window!). It worked for about 10 minutes and then it started to heat up again. It obviously needs some sort of overhaul. Of course, the windows are to be left closed! I called them again and again and they weren't really interested. Eventually they gave me a fan and opened a window. That worked pretty well as it cooled off in the city at night. For the rest of my stay I just left the window open. That may not be an option in the summer! The shower head had been taken apart. When I turned on the shower, water went everywhere. I put the shower head back together. Lots of hot water, great shower. The faucet in the sink doesn't drip, it leaks. If you get it just about half way between open and closed it might stop running (weird). The wireless internet did not work, the signal is too weak. As usual for a large city, I was picking up signals from wireless points in adjacent buildings, which evidently don't have free internet. The wireless doesn't work in the lobby either. The front desk has no clue, but you can't expect them to. So I used the "business center" in the basement. One thing I heard about this place - it stinks. Boy does it ever! The smell comes from the laundry room in the basement, next to the business center. It's that sour milk smell. With no A/C in the basement, it gets humid and then that smell is almost overpowering. The smell drifts up to the lobby, but isn't as strong. Importantly, the smell does not seem to make its way any further up the hotel. If you just come down to the lobby and leave you might never notice it. But if you need to do some work down at the business center, you might want to bring your own oxygen. The other thing I heard - the elevators. Yes, they are small and old and did break down, causing lines of people waiting to get up. But they fixed it quickly.
