The staff uses the elevators a lot, laundry baskets and equipment are often hogging them (where's the service elevators?). Watch the step when you get off! No problem with breakfast. They man keeps the place stocked while people swarm in and out. Just the basics. Good bagels. Juice machines spray your feet (stand back). They ought to fix that one toaster - if they would just put on a new handle people could use it. If you don't like the free breakfast, you can walk a half block out to 5th or Broadway and get whatever you want, including 3 or 4 fast food places. Lots of places to eat around there. The business center has some old and worn down PC's and "chairs". The internet worked well. A couple times some foreign guests were there surfing porn sites - whatever. They have a nice laser printer. You'll love the keyboard where the space bar doesn't work (trying writing email). It's important to have access to the internet to get tickets and times to events in NY. I downloaded subway schedules and maps. The location is great. It's in "Korea town", really "Korea street". I arrived via train at Penn Station. I just walked the two blocks to the hotel. Madison Square Garden is next to Penn Station, so this might be a good place to stay if you want to take in an event there. Empire State Building is a block and a half. The subway station is at the end of the block at Broadway and 32nd. Several trains run through there. Including the R and W which will take you down to Battery Park/Wall St/WTC site. The W and N will take you to Queens and the bus to LaGuardia. MTA is doing construction on the subway, so you can sometimes not get back to the 34th St station on weekends. You can also pick up those double decker tour bus at the Empire State (for tourists). Overall I had a good vacation. The hotel issues didn't become big ones. What bothers me is that La Quinta doesn't seem at all interested in keeping the place up. A lot of broken little stuff which indicates a lack of interest. NY isn't cheap, but that doesn't mean that can just let the place fall apart and charge less. Compared to other places in NY, it's cheaper and the location is good. But it might be worth spending the extra $ or so a night to get a place that's kept up. Because if you have some problems, they probably won't fix them. I would probably stay somewhere else next time I visit NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: La Quinta Inn was a great choice to stay in NY. In general, hotels in NY are expensive and below the European quality standards (unless you are willing to pay a fortune). Considering this, La Quinta Inn was clean, with friendly staff, the price includes breakfast and quite well located. It was a great choice and I had a great time in NY.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: lovely clean hotel, excellent value for money in a great location.Free breakfast every morning as well. We filled up on the breakfast and didnt need to eat again till dinner so it saved us money there as well. I would definitely definitely stay here again. thums up!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sjd11
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in April, this was not our first choice because we booked quite late, and could only have a queen room but this was adequate. We asked for a quiet room, so were at the rear of the hotel and it was quite dark but had a view of the Empire State Building, it was clean and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast good -I liked the bagels, and there was internet access in basement and a gym. The location is very convenient, many places in walking distance and we found the staff helpful. This hotel was very good for the money, although we paid $125 plus more at the weekend, perhaps due to late booking.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, Clean but Marginal Residual feelings”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a number of trips to NYC, I view this hotel as functional and very clean, but with fairly BLAH, mostly due to disinterested or crabby front desk staff. Phone assistance was good, with prompt followup calls when hot water was slow to come. The maid (Gangha) was lovely, the room immaculate, and the breakfast was nice (the breakfast man was friendly too). There is a tiny basement gym. First Impressions being what they are....STAFF DEMEANOR means so much to me, that I view most hotels through that particular looking glass. Plus, I travel alone. Who wants a meany at the front desk? Having asthma, I asked for a Non-Smoking room, but on arrival had to strongly stress that all over again to an eye-rolling, blase' Melinda, who said "I don't understand what it is you want." Duhhhhh---however, to the Hotel's credit, they quickly came up with a room even though I was first told the hotel was full. Actually, my 7th floor hallway was nice and quiet and I did not see anything that looked like a FULL hotel. There was no view, but I kept the curtains drawn and watched the excellent TV with extras--and slept well. I felt secure there. When making arrangements, I asked for an e-mail verification of my non-smoking room reservation and employee SUNIT told me "We don't DO e-mail," hence it arrived via mail while I was in NYC. I think this member of the CORE hotel chain is acceptable, but not a winner I'd seek out again. The location is seedy due to ugly area and garbage and such (in the Korean district). But good things are within easy reach---Times Square, etc. Interestingly, another hotel in the chain (RedRoof) is across the street. I paid $139/nite for 3 nites, $179.00 the 4th. I think the location and value is no more than the $139/nite MAX. I prefer the Milford and its area above this site--even though the Milford rooms are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Midtown Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: Lesfaye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 20 year anniversary in NYC this year and stayed at this hotel. It is a great location, Macys half a block, 5th Ave half a block, everything very close. Nice sized room, clean, great spread in the morning in the lobby, muffins, coffee, croissants, cereal, fruit, etc... Will definately stay again! We got our room with a king bed for $100 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 7 nights, and were very pleased with the hotel. We had a large corner bedroom, good beds, plenty of hot water (some reviewers have complained about that) very clean and breakfast OK. The staff were efficient if a little impersonal, but we thought the hotel great value for that location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We researched alot before making reservations and found reviews here to be mixed, but decided to try the La Quinta. We will go back again! Arriving at 10:30 am well before checkin time, there was no problems getting our bags held for us so we could get going places. For just over $100, the location can't be beaten. Everything was great. Our room on the fourth floor above the main entrance was not noisy. The staff all seemed polite and helpful. The bar on the rooftop was rather quiet, but the Empire State Building is right there to gaze at over a nightcap. Our room was clean and average size for Manhattan. Bathroom was great with plenty of hot water. The WiFi and cable TV worked fine and both elevators worked fine. The free continental breakfast was good. There is a good subway station with in one block and Penn Station with all the main lines and Madison Square Garden are just 3 blocks away! Macy's and the Empire State Building are just over a block away too! We will recommend this hotel to anyone in the hundred dollar price range and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta A Good Bet”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the reviews on this site, my boyfriend and I were braced for a ramshackle room and rude staff, but we were prepared to take a chance because we got a good rate. Maybe we were lucky, but I wish I had known what I know now: this place is perfectly fine -- a good bet. We had a corner room with a king-size bed on the twelfth floor, and it was clean and reasonably comfy. The bathroom appeared to be brand-new, and the shower was nice and hot. The staff were perfunctory when we checked in, but friendly and fast when we called down to request things. I'm extremely picky, and I'd say this is a solid budget hotel that you can pick without any worries.

Reviews.Title: “LaQuinta Hotel, Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: lovesNY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the LaQuinta Hotel on 32nd & Broadway. Was quite pleased with the Hotel. We had rooms 510 & 511, 4 in one room and 3 in the other. Room 511 was a corner room and was even larger than Rm. 510. Both rooms were quite large and very clean. Sheets were changed daily (we marked them so we would know). We paid $99.00 for the 1st night and $109.00 for the second. WE book these rooms about 4-5 weeks prior to our trip by calling the Applecore Hotel directly. When we originally booked them, the price was $149.99 for each night. I checked the website daily. At one point the prices came down to $119.00 / night. I quickly called the hotel and asked for that price. A week before the trip I again checked the website and saw the room was down to $99.00 for the 1 day of our visit & 109.00 for the second. Again I called and asked for the lower rate. The staff was pleasant and very willing to give us the lower rate. So .... continue to check the price even after the room is reserved! Did breakfast at the hotel. Was very nice to have that to start our day, & it saved $$$$ not having to buy breakfast for everyone. Consisted of bagels, donuts, toast, fruit, several kinds of cereal, & of course coffee & juices. Since we got up early, we never had a problem with crowds in the breakfast area and we never had to wait for an elevator. We had no view from our window ( just the wall of another building). However, be sure to visit the bar on the top floor to see the beautiful view of the Empire State building. This was a great hotel and I would definitely stay there again. Even tho many on this website do not like the Penn Station area, we found it to be close to everything and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Vicki73
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-day stay and I must tell you, we had a very good experience. I was a little hesitant because of the elevator problems in the past, but we didn't have a problem in the least. The location couldn't have been better. Close to subway transportation and PENN Station. Not a bad walk to Time Square and very close to the Empire State Building. For the money, this IS your best buy. I recomend this place and hope to return in the near future. Vicki Orange, TX

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: bdoe94
Reviews.Content: This place was great!!! You cant beat the price or the location. The rooms were small but very clean. For the amount of time you spent in the room it really doesnt matter how big it is. The hallways smelled kind of funky, but remember your in the middle of NYC, not the cleanest place in the world. And besides, how much time do you spend in the hallway? I would deff. stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We registered for this hotel specifically because of its wifi claim. We are two graduate students who wanted to focus on work and use the Internet to do research. We called ahead and got a guaranteed room and were assured the wifi worked. When we arrived we were told the wifi hadn't worked for over two days. Additionally, we could not get our money back. we also had no where else to go as it was late at night. The hotel smelled really bad, as though there were dead animals in the walls. The hallways and lobby smelled the worst. The people at the front desk made no apologies for the lack of wifi service, nor for the fact that the reservations clerk did not tell us the truth. The room was incredibly tiny. The continental breakfast was the usual stale bagels and dry cereal. But in addition, the coffee was admittedly the worst, worst hotel coffee I have ever had. Do not spend your money on this hotel. There are plenty of other terrific deals in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCGirl
Reviews.Content: Hi My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel from March 4-9, 2005. We received a great rate and also got discounted when using our AAA card. The hotel is in a perfect location. Walking distance to times sqaure, fifth avenue, central park and other attractions. There is also a subway on the corner if you wanted go to other areas. The hotel does offer a free continental breakfast consisting of donuts, bagels, toast, orange juice, apple juice, instant oatmeal and fruit. The rooms were very small, but clean. Sometimes there wasn't any hot water so we had to take cold showers. This only happened twice out of our five nights. If you require basic amenties at a reasonable price, this is the hotel for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: momof3atl
Reviews.Content: We first checked into (and left!)another hotel around the corner and were afraid of what we would find here. I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was in a great location and looked nice inside. Clean, nice room...great price. It was small, but it IS NY. The hallway smelled badly like fish-but I didnt spend much time in the hallway. The front desk staff was so nice and apologetic that the first hotel was so bad. They called us a great car servicee in the morning at a discount rate so we could ride to the airport in style. I will DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Crackin' little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blondey
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay in this hotel. The location is FABULOUS! Just one block from Macy*s, Empire State Building etc and there is a subway station at the end of the street (2 mins walk). Times square is about 5-10 mins walk. The hotel is surrounded by places to eat- a fab deli at the end of the road, a Burger King, CVS pharmacy, Pizza Petes (v friendly), Wendys etc. The road itself is the chinese/thai area so if you like this type of food there are lots of restaurants to choose from. Opposite and upstairs is an internet cafe (pink sign, I think) which was $3 for a half hour. The rooms are clean with everything you need.. they were cleaned daily with fresh towels. It was a smallish room but you just sleep there! The bed was comfy and the TV massive. There was a desk, side tables, long mirror, wardrobe with iron & ironing board, TV unit, bathroom with shower and bath, soap, shampoo, shower gel and hairdryer...as I said everything you need! You can get interactive movies and games for when you are really tired and can't be bothered going out. The breakfast is fab & free- cereal, hot & cold drinks (English Tea!), bread, bagels, toaster and donuts. Also a microwave and fresh fruit. Free newspapers in here too.There was always plenty to choose from although go before 9am as between 9am & 10am it was packed full. Also front desk provides free security deposit boxes. A few minor issues...they never have enough money to change travellers cheques but there is a place just up the street who charge $5.50 per $100 or Macy*s will change them free (Floor 1 1/2 by the cafe). We had an issue with our loo which didnt flush properly and we reported it at the desk & via the complaints card but it did not get resolved- not a major issue. All in all, a great little hotel. We would stay again as everything is within walking distance which is what you need for a short stay. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: livininsfo
Reviews.Content: Why do I give it an above average rate? People! Be realistic. For $99/night in New York City you can NOT go there expecting a lot. My husband and I didn't and were pleasantly surprised when we found a friendly staff, clean room, size was ok (how much time do you spend in your room when you are visiting NY?) The breakfast was good, had bagels, toast bread, muffins, donuts, cereal, bananas, coffee, tea, cappuccino, orange/apple juice...and clean. Yes, the TV didn't work great (we could've asked for that to be fixed, but didn't bother because there were just a few channels that didn't work right). The neighborhood is good and safe, close to the subway, Empire State building, a good central location. There was free internet access in the basement. We didn't use it, but that's a good service. All in all, for that price we were satisfied, would definitely go there again, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & location”
Reviews.Author: sassysabbi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 11th January to 18th January 2005 the accomadation was great value for money, rooms were clean and well sized. We had 2 queen beds loads of space the location was perfect this was our 3rd visit to ny and i would stay there again. THUMBS UP !!!

Reviews.Title: “It Stinks! (Literally)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My parents, my wife and I all stayed at the La Quinta Manhattan just after Christmas of 2004, and I'm sorry to say it was a disaster from the moment we checked in. When we arrived, the parking valet told my parents that their RV had too high a clearance for the hotel parking garage, even though my mother had specifically told the reservations agent that they had an oversized vehicle at the time she booked the reservation, and even though the agent had assured them that this would not be a problem. We ended up having to park in a commercial lot several blocks away, at our own expense. The hotel did not reimburse us for the difference between their standard parking charge and what we had to pay to park outside. Once we checked in, we noticed almost immediately that the hotel stank -- literally. The stairways, which we had no choice but to use frequently because of the slow elevators, reeked of garbage and rotten eggs. The hallways on the guest floors had an ever-present odor of mildew, probably because the maids tended to leave carts filled with dirty linens and sheets out in the halls all day and night. And every morning, the guest rooms smelled of the food being cooked for breakfast in the lobby, which at that hour was so crowded that you had to wait in line for about 45 minutes just for a bagel and coffee. The rooms themselves were average-sized for a discount hotel in Manhattan, which is to say, quite small though not impossibly so. The cable TV mostly worked, once you got used to all the complicated steps amd menus you had to go through just to turn it on. The TV-Internet connection was absolutely worthless, and the hotel staff had no idea about how to operate or fix it. The shower water fluctuated between too hot and too cold for the first five minutes, then turned ice-cold and stayed that way. If two people share a room and take their morning showers back-to-back, the second one can forget about having any warm water at all. The maid service was the worst I've ever encountered in New York. On our second day, the maid did not come to service the room until 4:00 pm, even though we had posted the "Maid Service Requested" sign on the door before we went out early that morning. When the maid finally arrived, my wife and I had returned from a day of sightseeing and were attempting to take quick catnap before going out to dinner. When we asked her to come back after 5:00, she brusquely told us that her shift was over at 5:00, and that if we wanted the room cleaned at all, it had to be right that instant. I had to complain to the hotel manager to get them to send a maid after 5:00, and even then, it was done grudgingly. Even my wife, who always makes it a point to tip hotel maids generously, had no problem with not leaving one in this instance. On the plus side, the hotel is centrally located, just a few blocks from the Empire State Building, Herald Square, and Penn Station. The neighborhood is decent, and the price was inexpensive by Manhattan standards. There are a fair number of restaurants nearby, though most of the really good ones are either uptown or below 14th Street. But none of this made up for the poor service, the snails-paced elevators, and the atrocious smells pervading the hallways and stairways above the lobby. In spite of all of this, I have nothing against the La Quinta chain. Two years ago, my wife and I stayed at a La Quinta in New Orleans -- a city where decent and reasonably priced hotels are almost as hard to find as they are in Manhattan -- and found that one to be excellent. I got the impression that La Quinta bought its NYC hotel recently, and is making an effort to bring it up to their standards. But judging from our experience, they have a long, long way to go to make this happen, and I will not be staying at or recommending this particular hotel any time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad For The Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to admit for the money we was shocked at how clean this hotel was. It looks like it was recently remodeled. The room was a little small and the tv cut out a couple times, but both elevators worked but they are slow. Parking was only 24 bucks for 40 hours which I thought was reasonable. all in all we give it 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “not great”
Reviews.Author: tensmom
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, larger rooms smell of Korean food from neighborhood. Heat working ok, but has to be regulated often as it gets too hot. Staff not very helpful. Breakfast is good, but during busy time, not enough tables and chairs. We wouldn't stay here again, unless nothing else was available.

Reviews.Title: “Good for an affordable midtown hotel, but don't expect great service”
Reviews.Author: hibachi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid December. I travel to NYC every few months on a limited expense account, so I'm always looking for an affordable place. La Quinta had rooms available when the rest of Manhattan seemed booked up due to the holiday season, and the price was good by comparison to other options. Our room was fine; clean, good condition, with OK wifi access; certainly the room was better than other more expensive hotels I've stayed at in NYC. Wifi is definitely "iffy" though so if you must have reliable wifi, try another hotel. Staff were OK but don't expect great service. When we arrived, they had no record of our reservation. My impression is that this isn't a place where a customer can be successful with the staff if the customer gets on their high horse and complains and is demanding; my sense is that the staff would be too happy to tell you to shove it. In our case, we were very polite and smiling and patient, and after about 30 minutes the staff had successfully re-created our reservation at our original rate. Overall I'd stay here again if I could get a great rate, but if something goes wrong, you don't have much leverage with the staff to get anything fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a great experience here. We just stayed here last weekend (the weekend before Christmas) and the staff was very helpful and the room was better than expected. I recomend getting a king room, because I've heard the queen rooms are small. It was clean, quiet and the location was incredible. I avoided the breakfast in the morning because it was packed with people and took forever just to get to the coffee maker. Other than that it was quite enjoyable. And the discounted rate on parking was fantastic. I would definately stay here again. And for a rate of 136.00 (with AAA) for the friday and saturday before christmas, you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “La Quinta was all right!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the La Quinta from Nov 11-14 and found the accomodations to be very satisfactory. We reserved a King bed, non-smoking room and that is what we got. It was clean, pleasant and comfortable. Both elevators are now working, but during check-in and check-out times they can be a little slow. We found the front desk staff and bellman to be very courteous and accomodating. We arrived at 9am on the 11th and they stored our luggage for us until check in time, and arranged for late check-out for us. We booked our room directly on the La Quinta reservation website and had no problems with our accomodations. I overheard two other people at check in complaining that they had booked through a discounter website, and they did not get the accomodation that the discounter had guaranteed. Buyer beware. We would definitely stay here again, the price was reasonable and the location was good.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at La Quinta Manhattan when we returned to NYC for a wedding, having lived in NYC previously for several years. We were used to the prices and small spaces, but nothing prepared us for the horror of this stay. The room we were given was absolutely tiny, with almost too little space for 2 people to be standing up at the same time. (Bed was almost up against the walls on both sides, barely enough room to wiggle sideways into the bathroom. TV set was propped on dresser almost directly at foot of the bed.) The room reeked, and I mean stank, sickeningly and unbelievably of cigarette smoke, as if the room had been an unventilated smoking lounge for the last 50 years (we had asked for a non-smoking room). But get this: the bathroom, which smelled even worse (if that were possible) had a swinging door, with no lock and not even a door handle. In fact, there was no latch of any kind. That's right folks. It was a "swinging door" such as you would find between the kitchen and dining room in a restaurant. This door was right at the head of the right side of the bed, and the toilet was just inside the door. No privacy in there folks, because the person sitting on the toilet behind this door (that did not even entirely fill out the doorjamb) was about 6 inches from the bed, which was the only place where anyone else in the room could be. Try doing your business under those conditions. Lovely. I immediately complained to the front desk, and I was given the room key to another room to look at. Believe it or not, the 2nd room (although slightly bigger) was so indescribably horrible (smelled like a dead body was rotting under the bed) that we promptly went back to the original room. Had there been another room in the city available, we would have left, but there was nowhere to go. I have heard that some rooms at La Quinta are larger than what we stayed in, but we had asked for a non-smoking with a queen size bed, and what we got was revolting, tiny, dirty and miserably hot. Worse, I discovered when I got home that all my stuff smelled like that smoky room and I have had to throw out a garment bag and a cosmetics bag which after repeated cleaning, will not give up that smell. I may also have to throw out my brand new suitcase. So, whatever your options, do yourself a favor and stay away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “broken and smoke”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As I arrived at the LaQuinta on my first trip to New York I already had a bad taste in my mouth because when I had called to confirm the reservations I had been told that I would need to pay a different amount for the hotel than I had originally been quoted. Granted, the hotel was a nice building, but the staff was not helpful at all. Also, the famous elevator that I have read about that has been broken is still broken. During my stay the one working elevator only worked approximately twice during my stay of four nights. Also, because I am allergic to smoke I had made certain that I had a non-smoking room and it was a smoking room when I checked in...when I spoke to the staff they were not helpful in switching rooms for me. Yes, the LaQuinta was priced well, but I would definately pick again if I was doing my trip over. As I walked around New York I saw many more hotels that were priced at the same level that I wished I had stayed at. Beware of the LaQuinta unless you want to tolerate broken elevators, rude staff, and a smoky room!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the La Quinta Manhattan for two nights (9/16 - 9/17) and we both found it very clean and comfortable. Yes, the elevators are a problem - only one is working and it's very slow. However, we were on the 6th floor and we always used the stairs going down so we were able to avoid using it at least half of the time. The breakfast is really great and we found the little guy working in the shop down in the lobby very helpful. The hotel is very close to the Empire State Building - in fact, you get a great view of it from the rooftop bar! Our room was small but still comfortable for the two of us and very clean. Overall, we had a very good experience and I would say that for the money, it was more than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mark75248
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a 4 night stay. I selected this hotel because the rates were at least $50 less than any other property in the area (except those with "shared baths"). Paying sub-$100 for midweek in midtown, I was unsure what to expect. But everything was fine. The room was clean and well-serviced. The room size was not huge but not bad, especially for Manhattan: I had a King bed and plenty of room to walk around the room, even with my bags out. There were 2 elevators, but one was under maintenance. That made the waits a bit long but not too terrible. I cannot comment on the service here, since I had no problems that required attention. Typical (free) continental breakfast spread: bagels, cereal, etc. Note that the free wireless is extremely weak, to be expected, I guess, in a 100 year old stone building. I could not get any signal at all, either in my corner room or in the lobby. I was able to get a weak signal from the stairs on my floor, but who wants to work there. However, the phones have data ports and local calls are free. Summary - not the best hotel I've ever stayed at, but a great deal for the price. I would return here anytime cost is a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Garbage Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Terrible Service... Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not understand the meaning of service. When calling to leave a message for a colleague who was (unfortunate enough to be) staying there, I was told "our computers are down, please call back in 15 minutes". I asked if I could leave a manual message, and the desk man said "Actually, it's pretty hectic here; you'd have a better chance if you call back in 10-15 minutes." I agreed to call back. When I called back, I was told the computers were down for at least an hour and I should call back then. I explained that this was an important message and could someone please write it down; my colleague would check the front desk. I was told this was simply not possible. I spoke with the manager who said "we can't take manual messages", and that I could "fax a message". (I have no idea why they could handle the paper from a fax, but not one from their own hand.) When I expressed my frustration and suggested that this would be bad publicity, the manager said "all publicity is good publicity". Well, to those of you who are considering La Quinta - you know what you are getting into. Just don't expect to receive any messages. RM

Reviews.Title: “Try the Holiday Inn....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For a night or two, I guess it is ok. However, if you need to stay longer, forget it! First of all, the rooms are VERY small (think Paris hotels kind of small), and the air conditioning does not work. Secondly, the elevator is a HUGE problem... There is only one operational elevator out of two, and it is VERY small, and VERY slow, so you will be waiting quite some time for one that has room. In addition, the elevator does not have AC, so you will roast once you can get in one of them. Third, service is an issue... If you need something for your room, chances are that you will not get it because either they do not have it, or they do not have someone who can get it to you. One thing that would be funny if it had not actually happened was two mornings ago I had my "Do Not Disturb" sign out on my door when I was awakened by a phone call from the desk... They said, that they had seen the "Do Not Disturb" sign, but were wondering when they could send someone up to clean my room! I am not sure what part of "Do Not Disturb" they had trouble understanding... Anyway, I still have a week to go here, but if I had it to do over, I would not have.... Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location. Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just visited NYC this past weekend with family. I had booked the La Quinta simply based on the fact that it was located right downtown and it was the cheapest option available. To be honest, I went in expecting broken bathroom toilets and rude staff. To my extreme surprise (and that of my family) the hotel turned out to be the perfect traveller hotel. Free complimentary breakfast (nice) + clean rooms and the best of all LOCATION. Just a block from the Empire State building and only a stone's throw away from Times Square, Madison Square Garden, Penn Station. They also have a fitness center + a business center so pretty much an all in one package. I definitely recommend it ...I know I was apprehensive when I made my reservation, but hopefully this review will help others make their decision. Cheers~!

Reviews.Title: “its alright”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is alright. A good walk from Times Square but never really used taxis. Take comfortable shoes!! Room was a little tight but okay size (doubles). Restroom was good size. Hallway did stink though (I think they had just painted). Didn't really stay much in hotel room as you are too busy sightseeing. Quiet, no problems with outside noise.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for the price, nice and clean!! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back last weekend. We were looking for budget and found this wonderfully clean, centrally located hotel. And rumors about the front desk were untrue. We booked through Travelocity (not-recommended) and LaQuinta crew helped us sort out Travelocity's mistakes!! The stories about old carpet are true, but the bathrooms are completely marbled and redone, the rooms are clean. Small yes, great value yes!!! Walking distance to everything and the sky bar gets a fabulous view of the Empire State Building, you're in the building's shadow! The hot/cold water pressure was variable, take your shower before 9am!, Otherwise, we were shockingly surprised by the price, clenliness and location, we'd definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!”
Reviews.Author: HiaRob20
Reviews.Content: Ok... while most of the reviews seem good of the hotel, you need to experience it first hand. The front desk staff is fine when you check in, but once you get past them its horrible. First of all, the elevators dont all work. One elevator for the entire hotel. You walk into the hallways, which by the way have a horrible smell to them. You get into your room.. theyre an OK size for a King Size bedroom. Turn on the air and nothing cold comes out. I call the front desk and they tell me the air is central in the hotel and its turned off because its "going to be cold this weekend". Mind you, its not THAT cold and if im paying for a room i should be able to turn on the AC without a problem. Then they send someone else to come up and "fix the air". The man says to leave it on LOW FAN and it should get colder in 15 minutes. Still NO COLD AIR AT ALL... all a lie... As my guests and I are still drenched in our sweat, I call the front desk staff again and begin to complain about the air and how hot it is in the room. If i wanted to spend the night in a sauna, I would have made a reservation at a gym. But anyways, they tell me that its "New York law" that they have AC's off during certain temperatures.. first ive ever heard of this since my AC was working at other hotels when it was snowing. EXCUSES.. EXCUSES.. EXCUSES. NEVER STAY HERE.. its the worst hotel. Youll be colder and more confortable sleeping with the homeless at Penn Station.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Stephen111
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the La Quninta over the Easter break and had a fantasic time. The hotel is close to all the major attractions; benefits from helpful staff, decent-sized rooms, a great bar with a view and a fine continental breakfast. The hotel made our first trip to New York memorable..and hopefully it will not be our last!

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn Manhattan
HotelInfo.Address: 17 West 32nd Street, New York City, NY 10001
